loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
For the past 4 years Abena E. has been selling slippers at Kokowada near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is married and has three children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a driver. She contributes to the payment of school fees and other expenses.

 Abena will use the loan to purchase more slippers to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: purchase more slippers

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is a forty one year old married woman with eleven children and she owns a house in Kasese Uganda. She has been in a hair salon business for four years. Her biggest challenge is lack of capital for her business.   Her vision is salon expansion and educating her children.  Joseline needs the loan to buy a hair dryer and weaves.

loans.use: to buy hair dryer and weaves for the salon

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina J. is 60 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. She is from the village of Bonbon within Catarman municipality, a part of Camiguin province on the Mindanao islands. Angelina runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, bread, soy sauce and vinegar to the local community. She has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Angelina joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and obtain some working capital. Angelina is requesting a new loan, her fourth from HSPFI, of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snacks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell like canned goods and snacks

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee is a 58-year-old woman who lives with her two daughters and her grandchildren in their own house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her grandchildren stay home and her two daughters, age 25 and 30, help with the family business. 

She operates a knitwear business in her town. She started her business in 2005 at her home. She knits collections of clothes such as skirts, hats and dresses using threads made of wool. She purchases her threads from Goyo and Gobi Company, which are the biggest knitwear manufacturing companies in Mongolia. Now she produces two to three pieces of products per day and her monthly net profit is 500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). 

Her older daughter worked as a knitter at Goyo Company for 10 years. So Tsetsgee never had worries about her business operation. She has a very experienced and trusted partner. She is a diligent and polite woman who is planning to have her own factory in the future. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a wide variety of threads.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of threads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will serve as an increased income to buy more salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.fr: U. Nadine est agriculteuse, elle est le client d’ACB depuis 2010.elle a 26 ans et célibataire.  Nadine ne à NGOMA-RWANDA et elle a fini 6 ans d’école secondaire .ce crédit est premier cycle avec ACB, elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les houes, 2 pompes ,1rato, 1brouette et payement main d’œuvre pour son business agriculture. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de  l’affaire est augmenter les champs à cultiver, ainsi que les produits souhaités sur/au marché.ses ambitions pour ses affaires elle veut devenir une grande agriculteuse dans le district de RUTSIRO. Pour sa famille elle voudrait  assurer le bien être de sa famille, construire sa maison d’habitation. Elle possède aussi 2 motos de taxi pour augmenter son revenu.
texts.en: Nadine U. works in agriculture and has been a client of ACB since 2010.  She is 26 years old and single. Nadine was born in Ngoma, Rwanda, and she has finished six years of secondary school.  This is her first loan cycle with ACB.  She is going to use her loan to buy hoes, two pumps, one rake, one wheelbarrow, and to pay her workers in her farming business.  Her strategy for business growth is to increase the size of her cultivating fields and therefore the quantity of produce for the market.  Her business goal is to become an important farmer in the district of Rutsiro.  As for her family, she would like to assure their well being and to build them a house.  She also owns two motorcycle taxis, which help to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy two hoes, two pumps for watering, one rake, one wheelbarrow, and to pay her workers in the farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 41 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos ellos son independientes; la socia se dedica a la administración de su heladería, la socia tiene en casa su fábrica de helados artesanales, ella tiene sus congeladoras, sus depósitos para preparar los helados, sus paleteras para los helados en formas de paletas; la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de azúcar, y otros insumos para la elaboración de helados artesanales; la socia produce helados de lúcuma, vainilla, chocolate, leche, fresa y otros sabores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la fábrica de helados. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba". She lives in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, married, and she has 3 children, all of whom are independent. She dedicates herself to managing her ice-cream shop. She has a production company of traditional icecreams in her home. She has freezers, tubs where to prepare her icecreams, popsicle molds to prepare her icecreams in popsicle form. She requires a loan to invest in the purchase of sugar and other ingredients she needs to make traditional icecreams. She makes icecreams in different flavors: lucuma fruit, vanilla, chocolate, milk, strawberry, and other flavors. She requests a loan to invest in her ice cream production business.

She values the loan granted to her and she is infinitely thankful because it will help her increase her business and improve the quality of her life. She is committed to making her payments at the determined schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make ice cream.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 41 years old, single and has four children, none of whom are currently in school. Joseline has a restaurant business, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business running a drug shop.
To help expand her business, Joseline has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking at the restaurant. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Joseline hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more food for cooking at her restaurant.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is 46 years old, married with five children: three sons and two daughters. She couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial circumstances. Her eldest son has a construction supplies business while the other two are laborers. Her husband is a farmer. He grows different seasonal crops to earn income for his family. He also has some buffaloes and he sells their milk to earn extra income. 

Kosar is a housewife, staying at her home and doing her household responsibilities. She also supports her husband in his milk-selling business by milking the buffaloes and keeping their stalls clean. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow better crops and make more profit from his business. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years. Kosar is hopeful that an investment will help him increase his income by growing better quality crops. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has established a good credit record in previous loan year and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35-year-old married father of four children. He is a dairy farmer, and also runs a motorbike business in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for the last eight years and has been a success. 

This is his third loan from KADET to finance his business. With this loan he plans to add a dairy cow to his herd. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan and to gradually expand his business. 

His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to add a dairy cow to his herd

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 58 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

José desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) , su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que llegan a su tamaño y peso ideal los ofrece a los pobladores de la zona o los vende en los distintos mercados de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, con los ingresos que obtenga solventará sus obligaciones de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para tenerlos bien alimentados y así ofertarlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  José es un padre trabajador y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus  hijos en un futuro tengan otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
José is a 58 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in his own home.  His home does not have basic services and is located in the rural area of Lambayeque department.  The main businesses in this area are farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

José has been raising and selling sheep for some years.  His pen is located outside his home and he feeds his animals with balanced feed and natural pasture.  Once they have reached an ideal size and weight, he offers them for sale to the people in his area or he sells them in the markets in Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  He uses the income he makes to meet his household's financial needs.

José has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more balanced feed so that he can keep his animals well fed and thereby sell them for a better price to his customers.  This will enable him to repay his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  José is a hard-working and responsible father and the only thing he wants is to provide his children with other opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy more feed for his sheep

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 31 years old. He is married with one child and takes care of 12 relatives. He has owned a studio business for the past two years. His business is well-organized and he works daily from 7am until 6pm. He currently employs 2 people to help him.

Janvier has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more cameras for his studio. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business, to save for his future and to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more cameras for his studio.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is a seamstress. People bring their cloth to her, choose a style from the catalog, and she sews items to suit their tastes. She wishes to also display some cloths and to buy other sewing materials in order to sew for her customers and later take the money from them. She is single. The loan will be used to acquire sewing materials. Her increased profits will be used to acquire electrical machines.

loans.use: to acquire sewing materials.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 41 years old and supports four members of his family. His spouse, Philomena, is a poultry farmer. They are blessed with children whose ages range from 7 to 13 years old. Francis has owned and operated a dairy farm in Ngejek for the past seven years.

Francis is borrowing a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, this being his fifth loan, having repaid the previous one successfully. He wishes to use the money to purchase a dairy cow for KES 30,000 and dairy feed for KES 10,000. The profits will be used to look after his family's welfare and to improve his dairy farm. Francis hopes to prosper in his dairy farming and live a better life.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and dairy feed

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 45 years old and married with three children, aged between 12 and 30. She runs a provisions store in Grassfield, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also takes care of three relatives--those relatives also help on the housework. 

Kadiatu has been in this business for three years and sells milk, packet water, sugar and sardines at her store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and bags of rice. Kadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her profit and save more. In the future, she would like to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and bags of rice.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Genelyn has a retail shop that sells fruits such as mangoes and apples. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy a variety of fruits to sell.
Genelyn is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 17-years-old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years Patricia has been working hard to manage her boutique shop, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Patricia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Patricia to generate greater profits and expand her business and take care of her family. Patricia hopes that in the future she will be able to pay school fees for her young siblings. 

Patricia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Patricia's future prospects by teaching her life planning skills.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: La señora Dionicia es cliente antigua que esta retornando después de un pequeño descanso de cuatro meses, es una de nuestras clientes bastante puntuales en sus pagos, ella vive en la zona de Cota Cota, su actividad es la venta de leche,  su esposo trabaja como transportista con taxi trufis  y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, la Sra.  Dionicia es bastante activa en su trabajo tiene tres vacas lecheras, dos toros, dos terneras preñadas y dos pequeños terneros, además de la venta de leche ella elabora bordados de labores bolivianas quienes les paga la mano de obra y le entregan todo el material los manteles son exportados al exterior, Ella realiza estos mismos manteles individuales y los vende muy aparte ya que tiene clientes que le realizan pedidos, El préstamo que ella esta solicitando lo utilizará para la compra de motor para el vehículo de su esposo. Razón por la cual  solicita el crédito.
texts.en:
Dionicia is an old client that is returning after a little rest of four months. She is one of our clients who always makes her payments on time. She lives in the area of Cota Cota. She sells milks and her husband drives a taxi trufis (a taxi which has a number on it which indicates the established route assigned to it.) They have three children of school age. Dionicia is actively engaged in her work. She has three dairy cows, two bulls, two pregnant heifers, and two young calves. 

Besides selling milk, she is paid to make handmade embroidered Bolivian tablecloths that are exported out of the country. She also makes individual tablecloths and sells them to her own customers who place orders. This loan that she is asking for is to buy an engine for her husband’s vehicle. This is the reason she is asking for credit.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Luz Marina sigue con el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad ósea sigue con la pequeña  tienda de abarrotes. Luz María con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y es por eso desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Luz Marina requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más.   

Luz Marina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Luz Marina still sells basic staples in her small grocery store.  Luz María did very well with the previous loan and this is why she wants another one because it helps her very much with her business.

On this occasion Luz Marina needs the loan to buy basic staples like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and other things.  Luz Marina is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase more food products such as bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. 

She lives with her brother and 4 children; 3 sons and a daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education except for her eldest son who works in a factory. Her brother also works in a factory. 

Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine doesn’t produce quality work. The new machine will help her to finish the orders on time and increase her profits. 

She is very confident that this investment will help her improve her income and enable her family to live a better financial life.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been working in construction for 16 years, especially in the electricity sector.

He is a hard worker, liked by most of his customers who admire his work a lot and his good personality. Ali is a clever man who works hard to improve his business as much as he can, through updating his tools and machines.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools for his business, in addition to closing his house's porch with special glass curtains to give extra space for his kids to share at home. He has received an Al Majmoua loan before, and it had a positive effect on both his social and financial situations. This time he hopes that through the requested loan, he will be capable of handling big projects requested of him. He also hopes he can provide his family with the best living ever.

loans.use: to buy new and improved tools necessary for his business

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 30 years old, an industrious husband and father. He is blessed with one child. To support his family, he has built and manages a cell phone accessories and repair shop. His business also provides jobs to two employees who repair cell phones. In order to pay them, he needs to upgrade his service as well as his profit. 

Pablo is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy quality cell phone accessories and cell phone materials. He will save additional income for his parents and especially his family.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories and materials.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is engaged in agriculture. As the harvest mostly depands on climate, the current harvest Edgar has received is not enough to sell and get sufficient income. Besides, Edgar wants to purchase seeds to cultivate his land. This loan will allow Edgar to get additional income from the sales of fruit and develop his farm. Agricultural development means sustainable and prosperous future for Edgar's family. Edgar lives together with his wife, mother and one child.

loans.use: to pay for fruit and seeds

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 37-year-old man from the South Rift Valley in Kenya. He is married to Mary and they have four children aged 14, 12, 7, and 3 years.

Wilfred operates a barber shop and has been doing this for seven years. This is his his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more electric razors and shaving shampoo. He intends to channel the profits back to his business to ensure it grows and makes enough income.

His hope is to make enough income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy electric razors and shampoo.

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a una de las miembros quien se motivo por querer ayudar a cada una de ellas ya que todas tienen ganas de salir adelante por todo el esfuerzo que están realizando. El comité cuenta con 17 integrantes en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican.
Una de las miembros es la señora Dionicia, quien nos comenta que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante y con la ayuda de su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando con los gastos de la casa y la manutención de la familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece la oportunidad que se le está dando, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
This Committee formed thanks to one of the members who was motivated by the desire to help each one of them, since all want to do well in the work that they do.  The committee includes 17 members.  All have a small activity to which they are dedicated.  

One of the membres is Señora Dionicia, who tells us that with a lot of sacrifice and the aid of her business, she is doing well.  She is dedicated to the sale of clothing of all types, such as sweatshirts, shirts, pants and other things.  One of her dreams is to be able to continue growing and in that way to be able to continue helping with the household expenses and the maintenance of the family.  She requests the loan to purchase summer clothing, with which she will be able to be supplied and comply with the demand of her clients.  She is thankful for the opportunity that she is being given, since it will be of great aid to her.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes for later sale.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando de 53 años es un hombre viudo, Tiene 2 hijos que ya lo hicieron abuelo. Él vive en su casa propia con su hija y su nieta en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Rolando es agricultor. Desde niño aprendió estas labores ayudando a sus padres en el campo. Ahora que el tiempo ha pasado su experiencia se ve reflejado en la producción y ganancias que su actividad le genera. En sus 3 cuadras de terrenos cultiva café, plátanos y yucas; obteniendo buenos ingresos para su familia.
Sus cosechas las expende en las ciudades de Yurinaki y Pichanaki.
Al mismo tiempo se dedica a otro negocio, que es la crianza de mariposas, para eso recibe el asesoramiento de una empresa. “Criamos mariposas para velar por su preservación, por eso me gusta esta labor”, dice.
Rolando ya es un hombre mayor pero no se queja de su trabajo, para avanzar y evitarse fatigas contrata personal. Así limpia y cosecha el café y no descuida sus ventas.
Aún tiene motivos por los que trabajar y son sus hijos y nietos, por eso seguirá cogiendo las herramientas del campo. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, que recibiría gracias a su apoyo. Por eso muestra firmeza al mencionar que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los Productores Yaneshas”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que se siente contento. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar 8 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de café, plátanos y yucas.
texts.en:
Rolando, 53, is a widower.  He has two children who have already made him a grandfather.  He lives in his own house with his daughter and granddaughter in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in Chanchamayo Province.  Rolando is a farmer.  He learned this occupation while still a young boy helping his parents in the fields.  Now that time has passed his experience is reflected in production and profits that his activity generates.  He grows coffee, banana and cassava on his 3 cuadras [unit of land measurement] of land obtaining good income for his family.  He sells his harvests in the cities of Yurinaki and Pichanaki.

At the same time he has another business which is raising butterflies and for this he gets advice from a firm.  “We raise butterflies in order to watch over their conservation and this is why I like this work,” he says.

Rolando is already an older man but he does not complain about his work.  To get ahead and avoid becoming exhausted he hires workers; this is how he cleans and harvests the coffee and does not neglect his sales.

He still has reasons to work: his children and grandchildren.  Because of this he continues to wield the work tools.  This will be his first MFP loan that he’ll get thanks to your support so he is firm in mentioning that he will be punctual with his installment payments.  “Los Productores Yaneshas” (Yanesha Producers) is the name of his communal bank that he’s very happy about.  With the money from the loan he will be able to buy 8 sacks of organic manure for his coffee, banana and cassava crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Santos Hermenegildo

texts.en:
My name is Santos Hermengildo and I have a bicycle business, I sell and repair new and used bicycles. I have had ,y business for several yearq and it generates an income to cover family expenses and other obligations, I am in need of a vehicle to transport my merchandise.

Loan Use: Purchase bicycle tires, rims, tires for mountain biking, handles, hand brakes, replaceable parts and other items

Mi nombre es Santos Hermenegildo, cuento con un negocio de de venta de repuesto de bicicleta, barberia y balconeria, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente me es necesario un vehiculo para transportar la mercaderia.

loans.use: Compra de llantas para bicicleta, nehomaticos,rach para montañesa,cadenas, manubrios, juego de frenos, cambiadores y otros

loans.name: Enite

texts.en: L. is from the village of Utualii.  She runs a small retail shop.  She is improving her business, and she has no doubt about running her business.   L. said that all she is doing is focusing on her business. L. is working hard to have every different type of merchandise available to sell in her shop to satisfy her customers, so that she can earn profits to improve her business.  L. will use her loan to buy goods to sell at her shop and also to buy paint, woods, and corrugated roofing iron to renovate her shop if it is damaged.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her retail shop and building materials to improve her shop

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia was born in Zacatecas. She is married and has four grown children, the youngest of them 19. Alicia used to work in a department store but her hours didn't give her time with her children and her pay was insufficient so she decided to open her own business buying and selling ceramics. A friend invited her to a ceramics showcase and Alicia decided that this could be a good business for her. Alicia is asking for a loan of $475 to buy a greater variety of merchandise. She says this is a good time of year for selling ceramics because many tourists come to Zacatecas now. She promises to repay this loan in 6 to 12 months and thanks you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Alicia nació en Zacatecas, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos mayores, el menor de ellos tiene 19 años. Alicia ante trabaja en un departamento de compras y su horario de trabajo no le permitía estar con sus hijos y no le daba el ingreso suficiente para poder ayudar en la economía del hogar, por ello Alicia decidió abrir su propio negocio, el cual es la compra y venta de cerámica. Cuando inició fue por la invitación de una amiga que la llevo a una demostración de cerámica y vio que podía ser un buen negocio y se decidió a iniciarlo.

Alicia esta solicitando un préstamo de US $475 para comprar mercancía y tener un mayor surtido en su negocio, ella comenta que esta es una buena época para la venta de cerámica por que van muchos turistas a Zacatecas en esta temporada. Alicia promete pagar este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, y agradece tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: For twelve years, Irina has operated a footwear sales kiosk in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has an outstanding reputation for consistently providing high quality footwear. A diligent worker and business owner, Irina’s husband has joined her in her work to help develop the business. Polite, respectful, and responsible, Irina has repaid all past loans through Nadiya Ukraine with a perfect credit history. Irina’s business is the sole source of her family’s income, supporting her daughter’s college tuition as well as her elderly parents. Currently, Irina is seeking a loan for $1000 to restock her footwear inventory. With her profits, she plans to expand her business and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung has already proven a reliable business partner.  She has repaid 3 previous loans from Mekong Plus, one of which was funded by Kiva.  Her last loan from Kiva increased her daily profits to 10-15,000 VND.  With the increased profits, she bought was able to buy a refrigerator.  Dung would like another loan in order to continue to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: buy more capital for grocery store

loans.name: Ylemis Jean

texts.en:
Ylemis, 34 years old, is a very dynamic and ambitious woman. She is married, with four children (3 girls and a boy). She is from Haiti, the neighbor country of the Dominican Republic and has been living in our country for more than fifteen years. Ylemis is member of a group called Mujeres Inmigrantes de San Cristobal. The group is formed of women and young girls who all are professionals in the area of sewing. They have rented a locale where they run their workgroup.

Recently, Ylemis has gotten a contract with a small company which needs some uniforms for the employees. The entrepreneur needs a loan in order to buy cloth, thread and other raw materials so that she can satisfy her new client's demand. That way, Ylemis will increase her income and will be able to continue improving her family's life.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of cloth, thread, zippers and other raw materials to continue producing clothes for her business

loans.name: Shahrabonu

texts.ru:
Shahrabonu N. started her business by purchasing two bulls. After that her family kept up to 11 cows and raised bulls for sale. They have been doing this for 8 years. Having 8 years of experience, she continues to expand her business and plans to work with MLF MicroInvest in the future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шахрабону Назарова начинала все с приобретения двух бычков. Затем уже сами, своей семьей, держали до 11 коров и выращивали бычков на продажу. И так, с переменным успехом, 8 лет. Имея 8 летний опыт за спиной, она продолжает развивать свой бизнес и планирует сотрудничать с Микронвест в будущем.

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia is a 55 years old mother of seven. Four of her children are allready married and independent, the other three are students living at her home.

With the savings from her previous employer as a seamstress, she opened her own shop 10 years ago. Her micro business is generating a good income thanks to a loyal clientele but she needs to offer a greater varity of product. Mrs. Virginia´s dream is to expand her business and eventually create her own label of apparel.

The loan will be used to purchase blouses, pants, shirts, shoes and underwear to expand her product line.

loans.use: Purchase blouses, pants, shirts, shoes, underwear

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina lives in the district of Santiago D. Pischa, which is one hour outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. Marcelina is 67 years old. She is a widow and has eight children, five of whom still depend on her.

Marcelina is a member of the community bank “Inti”, which means "sun" in Quechua, where she learned to be punctual, responsible, and to save. With her savings she was able to buy a second car. Marcelina raises animals such as cows, pigs, and chickens. She sells them either directly from her farm or at different markets around the region. In addition, Marcelina has two cars that her children use to transport people between small towns in the area. Marcelina needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy cattle.

An important aspect of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Marcelina plans to use her savings to pay for her children’s education. Her dream is to build a house for her children, buy a motorcycle taxi that one of her children can drive, and see her children become professionals.

loans.use: Marcelina needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy cattle.

loans.name: Karomatoy

texts.en:
K. Karomatoy was born in 1965 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. The Asht region is the high-mountain region where livestock is well developed and most women are engaged in milk production, yarn- making and making warm yarn socks.

Mrs. K. Karomatoy is applying to MicroInvest for her first business development loan. She works in a collective farm, but it is the seasonal work, so yarn-making, and making and selling warm yarn socks are the primary sources of family income. Now Mrs. K. Karomatoy is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 8 months to by special yarn dye.

loans.use: To buy special yarn dye

loans.name: Moqim

texts.en:
Moqim lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with one son. He operates a clothing stand in a good area of Kabul.

Moqim needs to complete his inventory, so he has requested an individual loan to buy more new clothes. He hopes to expand his business and make a good income to support his family. He appreciates this loan process that helps people in his country.

loans.use: To buy more new clothes.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is a diligent and exemplary mother of 10 children, 4 of them still minors and dependents. Like her husband, she persistently works hard in her daily activities so that their children do not experience economic limitations; thanks to the good example that they inculcated in their children they work hard in their studies and in their free hours they help their parents in their respective economic activities. While her loyal husband works raising cattle, Alejandrina diligently and patiently makes crafts and creates decorations from sheep skin with her children’s help. Everything was going fine in her family and her daily activities when unfortunately one unexpected day her youngest daughter had a tragic accident. Since then, her entire family has worked to pay for the medications that her daughter requires. At this time, Alejandrina turns to your heart and solidarity to ask for a loan to purchase the raw materials required to continue creating her excellent crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina, es una diligente y ejemplar madre D. 10 hijos, 4 D. ellos aún menores D. edad y dependientes, ella al igual que su esposo se esfuerza persistentemente en sus actividades cotidianas, con el fin D. que sus retoños no pasen limitaciones económicas; gracias al buen ejemplo que inculcaron en sus hijos les corresponden debidamente en sus estudios y en sus horas libres les apoyan en sus respectivas actividades.Mientras su fiel esposo se dedica a la ganadería doña Alejandría diligente y pacientemente con apoyo D. sus hijos se dedica a la artesanía y elabora hermosos adornos a base D. cuero D. oveja.Todo marchaba bien en su familia y en su actividad diaria, desafortunadamente un inesperado día la menor D. sus hijas sufrió un trágico accidente, desD. entonces con apoyo D. toda su familia se desvela trabajando para cubrir los medicamentos que requiere su querida hija.En estos momentos, doña Alejandrina recurre a tu solidario corazón para pedirte un préstamo con el propósito D. comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando sus excelentes trabajos.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of raw materials.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina started the business because of economic need when she was widowed and did not have the pension that she needed for her 6 children. She began 2 years ago selling cosmetics, initially her relatives supported her with her merchandise and in this way she was able to start her business.

She requests a loan of $200 that will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and to be able to supply some pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernestina inició el negocio por la necesidad economica, cuando enviudo, como no tenia pension necesitaba ingresos para sus 6 hijos. Comenzó hace mas de 2 años con la venta de cosmeticos, inicialmente sus familiares la apoyaron con mercancia y asi pudo iniciar su negocio.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $200 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y poder surtir algunos pedidos pendientes.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas I Group

texts.en: Altagracia and her husband live in a very poor community called Mancorneta, which is on the outskirts of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Altagracia operates her own `fritura´, a small business that makes homemade snacks such as empanadas and minced meat. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more flour, oil, pork and chicken so that she can meet the demands of her customers. After preparing the food in her house, she goes out into the community to sell. In the Dominican Republic, it is very common for people to buy a snack on the street corners as they walk to work, their homes, or simply when they are out and about. Altagracia has continued to grow since her first loan of $100.  Her loan amounts and ability to repay have increased over the years and she is now on her 7th loan in the amount of $900. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more stable with the help of this loan. In her free time, Altagracia enjoys spending time with her 8 grandchildren.  On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Altagracia herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as pork, chicken, flour, and oil

loans.name: Melanio

texts.es:
Melanio is 62 years old, he lives alone as he never married, although he has four children. None of them live with him. Melanio comments that he couldn't access a good education and so he only received a basic primary education. For this reason he had to help his father from when he was very small in the 'oleria' (a brick-making site). With time, the business passed down to him and today he still manages the brick-making business.

He assures that the business is going well as he has a well formed customer base and constant work. He has thoughts of opening a business selling construction materials in the future, such as: stones, rocks, rods, lime and cement.

In this case, he will invest the loan in the purchase of firewood in large quantities, which is used in the manufacture of his products.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Melanio tiene 62 años, vive sólo porque nunca se casó aunque tiene 4 hijos. Ninguno de los mismos vive con él. Melanio comenta que no pudo acceder a una buena educación ya que solo pudo cursar la educación básica primaria. Por tal motivo tuvo que ayudar a su padre desde muy pequeño en la olería (lugar donde se fabrican ladrillos). Con el tiempo el negocio pasó a ser de él y hoy día ya lo administra el mismo.

Asegura que le va muy bien debido a que tiene clientela ya formada y el trabajo es constante. Tiene pensado en el futuro abrir un negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como: piedras, ladrillos, varillas, cal y cemento.

En esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo en la compra de leñas en grandes cantidades, las cuales son utilizadas en la cocción de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina, 45, is married to Migdonio Medina with whom she has 3 school-aged children. She works as a cleaner for two families, one of whom she's worked for 3 years, cleaning in the morning, and the other for 4 years, cleaning in the afternoon. Migdonio started a business raising and selling pigs, a business he's been operating for 8 years. Agustina used to help him with the business but then had to find other income. Thanks to the efforts of both, they were able to finish building their house and keep their children in school. With this loan, she wants to buy more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Agustina tiene 45 años, esta casada con el Sr. Migdonio Medina con quien tiene 3 hijos adolescentes estudiantes. La Sra. Agustina es empleada domestica de dos casas particulares, uno de ellos trabaja a la mañana hace 3 años y el otro a la tarde hace 4 años. El Sr. Migdonio es el responsable del negocio de la compra cría y venta de chancho, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace 8 años, anteriormente también la Sra. l ayudaba en el negocio pero luego tuvo que buscar otros ingresos extras, gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pudieron terminar de construir su vivienda y seguir manteniendo el estudio de sus hijos. Con el actual crédito solicitado desea comprar mayor cantidad de porcinos.

loans.use: Buy pigs.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., age 55, is a wedding chef who resides with his wife and one child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He typically makes around US$4 each day. His wife, Phoung Soeun, 53, for whom he will use this loan, is a true entrepreneur and has had a business selling rice and porridge from her home since 1999. On average, she brings in US$8.5 per day. This couple also has support from their child who works as security officer.

Phoung Soeun's business selling rice, noodle and porridge is making more profits to improve the standard of living. There are a few vendors who operate the same business as her, so to attract more customers she needs to expand her business by purchasing more chairs and more utensils and building a bigger stand.

loans.use: To purchase more tables, chairs and utensils.

loans.name: Faridon

texts.en:
This is Faridon, 32, who lives in Jalalabad city and is married and the father of five children. He has experience in the spare parts business because he is a shopkeeper of five years' experience in Jalalabad city. He also likes body building and he exercises in a club.

Now he needs some money because his expenditures are too great and he needs to buy some things: oil, food, electrical equipment. His income is not enough for his whole household and he has a wish to become a good businessman in the future.

Therefore he has requested to take a 50,000(AF) loan from AFSG for 18 months and he wants to realize his dreams and purchase some oil, food, mobile Simcards, etc. He wants to became a good businessman in the future. And he is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva and to AFSG.

loans.use: buying some oil, food, mobile simcard, etc.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Fredy G. me dedico a la venta de ropa clasificada, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, este negocio me ha permitido ayudarle a mi esposo con todos los gastos de nuestro hogar y gracias a Dios hemos salido adelante, yo soy una persona muy dedicada a mi negocio y tengo muchas ganas de salir adelante, le doy graias a Dios por todo lo que tengo y lo bueno que ha sido con mi familia. en estos momentos necesito el credito para poder incrementar mi inventario ya que en esta espoca las ventas soy muy grandes y necesito tener bien surtido mi negocio para complacer todas las exigencias de mis clientes.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Fredy G.. I sell brand name clothing, a business I have been running for many years. It has permitted me to help my husband with the household expenses and thanks be to God that we have pulled through. I am a person very dedicated to my business and I have a great drive to be a success. I thank God for everything that I have and all the good that has come to my family. Currently I require a loan so that I may replenish my inventory. Especially during this season when sales are so high I need to have my business wel stocked to fulfill the demands of my clientele.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Dame A. Juliette est née le 30/07/1974 d'un père ,agent de l'ASECNA (agence panafricaine de gestion du transport aérien) et d'une mère ,revendeuse de maïs, elle est originaire de d'AZOVE dans le département du COUFFO.Elle fréquenta jusqu'au CM2 et elle abandonna suite à la grève générale  qui paralysa le système éducatif béninois en 1989. Elle apprit à faire la couture et eut son diplôme de fin de formation en 1999.Elle s'installa à son propre compte pour exercer son métier dans un atelier de couture.Parallèlement à son métier ,elle fait de petit commerce .C'est pourquoi elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 120000fcfa pour s'approvisionner en pagne et chaussures .Mariée ,elle a 2 enfants Géronime et Jean Didi
texts.en:
Mrs. Juliette A. was born on July 30, 1974 to a father who worked for ASECNA (the Pan-African air traffic control agency) and a mother who sold maize (corn). She comes from Azove in the county of Couffo. She went to school up to grade 5 and left off because of the general strike which paralyzed the Benin education system in 1989.

Juliette learned to be a seamstress and obtained her diploma at the end of her studies in 1999. She set herself up to work in her chosen field in a little workshop. At the same time, she sells odds and ends. This is why she is requesting this third loan of 120,000 F CFA to stock up on "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored cloth used to make clothing, turbans, and to carry babies) and shoes. Married, she has two children: Géronime and Jean Didi.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 8 lengths of "pagnes" and 5 dozen pairs of shoes

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr: Dame A. Anne est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est originaire de Ganvié, village lacustre dont elle est née. Très jeune, elle aida sa mère dans la vente d'huile rouge et de boissons sucrées. Après son mariage, elle s'est mise à son propre compte en vendant de poissons frais avec l'aide financière de son mari. Ensuite, elle a ajouté la préparation et la vente d'akassa. Aujourd'hui, elle a maintenu ces diverses activités en prenant le soin d'y ajouter la vente de fagots de bois et la distribution-vente de pagne. Elle a sollicité ce 3ème prêt d'une durée de 10 mois pour renforcer ses activités. Mariée à BADJO Samuel, elle a 5 enfants.
texts.en:
Madam Anne A. is 38 years old. She is originally from Ganvié, a waterside village where she was born. When very young, she helped her mother sell red palm oil and soft drinks. After she was married, she started off on her own selling fresh fish, with financial help from her husband. Next, she included the making and selling of “akassa” (a thick porridge). Today, she has maintained these diverse activities, carefully adding the sale of bundles of wood and the distribution of “pagnes” (colorful West African cloth). She is requesting this third 10-month loan to boost her commerce. Madam A. is married to Samuel BADJO and has five children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For supplies: 2 boat-loads of wood, 2 sacks of corn, and 9 lengths of pagnes

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is married to Lucas Che, and they are blessed with two children. They live in a three-room house in the Alabukam, district in Mankon, Bamenda, NW region in Cameroon. Mama Julia has decided to work extra hard to assist her husband in catering for such a big family. She has faced many challenges in life such as the death of so many members of her family, inadequate funds to sustain her business project, and ill health. These challenges made life uncomfortable for her, until December 12th 1999 when she discovered GHAPE and became a member. In that same year, Julia received her first loan of 15,000 FRS and her repayment was successful. The profit she made was used to pay her children's school fees.

Given her loan, she plans to buy yam seedlings, cassava seedlings and proceed with the clearing of farmland. She will start repayment from the fourth month after loan disbursement. She is convinced that she will succeed because she already has a fertile piece of farmland where she will carry out her farming. And she already has experience in the activity. With the profit from the business, she plans to pay her children's school fees, using part to expand her business. She prefer to receive loans from GHAPE because of the social education GHAPE offers, and the method of repayment is convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and a strong bond of trust has developed between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of yam seedlings, cassava seedlings and clearing of farmland

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando P. tiene poco tiempo que  adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental pero le está haciendo falta la barda al frente de su casa, ya que tiene hijos pequeños y quiere la seguridad de ellos.
   Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder llevar acabo la mejora lo más pronto posible y plana pagarlo con los ingresos de su trabajo como jefe de una tienda en el aria de carnicería. Cuando fuimos a ser la visita de su casa el señor Armando no se encontraba estaba en su trabajo, quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Karent Carranza y uno de sus hijos quien son los que aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
Mr Armando P. bought his house thanks to a government loan a little while ago but he needs to build the wall at the front of his house, since he has small children and he wants them to be safe. He is requesting a loan to be able to finish his project as soon as possible, and plans to repay the loan with the income of his work as a chief of a butcher's shop. When we went to do the visit of the house Mr Armando was not there, he was at work, we meet with his wife Karent Carranza and one of his children who are the ones in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in the front of his house.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đinh ThịThảnh năm nay  50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Thời gian đầu chị Thảnh vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, đến nay ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị Thảnh còn có thêm nguồn thu từ công việc kinh doanh hàng ăn. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay  với thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để mua thêm thực phẩm , bia, nước ngọt... để đầu tư vào hàng ăn nhằm phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn yêu cầu của khách hàng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh Thi T. is 50 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 1996. Initially, Mrs. T. borrowed money to invest in raising livestock. Currently, apart from income from livestock raising, Mrs. T.'s family gets extra income from running a restaurant. These are the businesses that bring the income for her family which is VND6,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000 to buy additional foods, beers and beverages to invest in the restaurant to serve the needs of the customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for the restaurant

loans.name: Ghulam Habib

texts.en:
Ghulam Habib is the son of Abdullah. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives in a ten-member family. He is a farmer and a very hard working Afghan man. He has worked as a farmer in the land since he was a child. For better improvement of his business and to purchase the required tools, he wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months.
He is happy that there is an effective process for the support of Afghan entrepreneurs in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy required tools

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria Esperanza A. Z., vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador. Maria es una mujer con 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo de 60 años. Esta pareja se dedica a la elaboración de especies que son utilizadas para dar sabor, olor y color a una gran variedad de alimentos .El negocio consiste en la elaboración de cada una de las especies y también en la venta de las mismas;  el esposo de Maria sale de casa y la vende de manera ambulante por las calles. Maria solicita un crédito para compra de insumos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza A. Z. lives in the San Salvador region. She is 59 years old and lives with her husband of 60 years. The couple sells spices, which are used in cooking to add flavor, aroma, and color to a variety of foods. The business consists of making and selling the spices; Maria's husband sells the spices door-to-door. Maria is requesting the loan to buy supplies for their business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ni Ketut Siarni

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Siarni (DNR.M-0674) is a 61-year-old woman living in the town of Brawantangi - Melaya. Married and the mother of six adult-aged children, Ni Ketut Siarni owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Siarni has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Ketut Siarni joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI, used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Ni Ketut Siarni is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 1,500,000 IDR to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir esta en el segundo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendadoras de Fundacion Paraguaya.  Ellas tienen un ahorro de Gs.550.000.  Todas son señoras muy trabajadoras y responsables, que viven en el barrio San Luis de Capiata.  Ayudan a su barrio con actividades quincenales y también a las personas que necesitan dentro del comité.

Las integrantes son: 

Evarista G..	Venta de chipas.
Nancy L..	Venta de carteras.
Placida Ferreira.	Venta de joyas .
Lorena A..	Venta de frutas.
Sonia G..	Venta de comidas.
Marta G..	Venta de comidas.
Julia R..	Venta de artesanias.
Benicia Nuñez.	Costurera.
Del Pilar M..	Venta de ropas para niños.
Rumilda G..	Venta de comidas.
Fraxedes R..	Despensa.
Basilica C..	Venta de comestible.
Norma O..	Trabaja en una fruteria, venta de cosmeticos.
Mabel V..	Venta  de bebidas.
Celina R..	Venta de ropas.
Victoria M..	Venta de ropas.
texts.en:
The Porvenir committee is in its second loan cycle with the Entrepreneurial Women program of Fundacion Paraguaya. They have saved Gs. 550.00 and they are all hardworking, responsible women that live in the San Luis neighborhood of Capiata. They help their neighborhood by holding activities every 15 days and they also help out other committee members when needed. The members are: Evarista G.. Sells chipas (cheese bread) Nancy L.. Sells wallets. Placida Ferreira. Sells jewelry. Lorena A.. Sells fruit. Sonia G.. Sells prepared food. Marta G.. Sells prepared food. Julia R.. Sells handicrafts. Benicia Nuñez. Seamstress. Del Pilar M.. Sells children’s clothes. Rumilda G.. Sells prepared food. Fraxedes R.. Grocery store. Basilica C.. Sells food. Norma O.. Works in a fruit stand and sells cosmetics. Mabel V.. Sells drinks. Celina R.. Sells clothes. Victoria M.. Sells clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: various: food, jewelry, supplies, drinks, etc

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Исоев Шухрат – мужчина 30 лет. Женат пока не имеет детей. Жена новая невеста и сидит пока дома. Шухрат занимается переоформлением  автомобилей. Каждый день у него  есть 1-2 машины на ремонт. Таким образом у него есть постоянный  доход. Также он продает машины которые ему приносят клиенты. Он их ремонтирует и выносит на рынок. Но такой бизнес требует много времени. Поэтому ему более подходит работа оформление и ремонт машин. Кредит получает для покупки красок и необходимых оборудования для ремонта машин.
texts.en:
Shuhrat I. is a 30 years old man. He is married and does not have children yet. He has a young wife and she stays at home for now. Shuhrat remodels cars. Everyday he has one or two cars that need repair. This way he has regular income. He also sells cars which his customers bring to him. He repairs them and gets them out to the market. But this business takes a lot of time. This is why his car remodeling work suits him more. Shuhrat is taking a loan to buy paints and necessary equipment to repair cars.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint and necessary equipment

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Adolfo V.,  tiene la edad de 46 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa es comerciante  vende ropa y le tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad,  todos estudian. Don Adolfo tiene un taxi que trabaja desde hace ocho años dando sus servicios de transporte a los usuarios. Con este crédito es su séptimo ciclo y lo quiere para compra repuestos para darles mantenimientos a su taxi y poder dar a sus clientes una mejor atención. Sus planes es lograr adquirir otra unidad de taxi para y poder tener mejores utilidades, a si como hacer mejoras a su vivienda y poder dar educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adolfo V. is 46 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is married, his wife sells clothing and they have four minor children who all study. Don Adolfo has a taxi which he has been working for the past eight years, providing transportation services to his clients. With this loan, which is his seventh, he will buy replacement parts for maintenance of his taxi so that he can provide better service to his customers. His plans are to buy another taxi so that he can have better profits, make improvements to his home and be able to provide his children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en: Pinky P. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Pinky owns and operates a specialized retail shop, primarily selling personal products such as towels, T-shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Pinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lucrecia Angel

texts.es:
La señora LUCRECIA ANGEL O. M. D. A. , tiene 48 años, vive en el distrito D. Moche , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco SEÑOR D. LA PIEDAD II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene  hijos D. 4 y solo 2 dependen  económicamente D. ella.
LUCRECIA se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en la tienda D. su casa.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertio en la compra abarrotes, tales como: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, fideos, jabones, detergentes.
Este crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles lo utilizara para comprar mas productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. y ampliar su tienda.
 LUCRECIA  sueña con tener un bar en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucrecia Angel O. M. D. A. is 48 years old. She lives Peru in the department of La Libertad, province of Trujillo, and district of Moche. She is a member of the Bank Senor D. la Piedad II.

This business woman has an education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has four children, of which only two depend on her financially. Lucrecia sells groceries in her home-based store. Her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles was invested in the purchase of groceries like rice, sugar, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate, beans, soap, and detergent. This loan of 1200 Nuevos Soles will be used to expand her store and buy more food products like rice, sugar, beans, etc.

Lucrecia dreams of having a cafe in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more food products and expand her store

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona L. is from the village of Sibula. She is 41 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Chona owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Chona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Chona is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lilian Jackeline

texts.es: La señora Lilian Jackeline, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 33 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Lilian Jackeline, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida. Ahora se encuentra mas superada y con ganas de salir adelante sola, con sus propios medios. Se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de la línea Unique, Esika y Avon y hoy en día le están dando muy buenos resultados y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo invertirá comprando una vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Lilian Jackeline, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Lilian Jackeline is a member of the Communal Bank “Amistad y Paz” (Friendship and Peace), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 33 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. Lilian Jackeline is a woman who has overcome many difficulties in life. She is currently separated and had to find her own means of supporting herself.

She began selling cosmetics from different lines such as Unique, Esika, and Avon. She has experienced excellent results to date and feels very good about what she has achieved. With this loan 1000 soles, Lilian Jackeline will buy beauty products to add to her inventory such as perfumes for women and men, crèmes, pressed powders, lipsticks, and nail polishes. In addition, she will purchase a display case so that she can showcase her products.

Lilian Jackeline thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & a display case

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijas: Nataly de 15 y Francesca de 3 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En el colegio de ciencias “Alfred Nóbel” de la ciudad de Juliaca, Juana tiene su kiosco escolar, su negocio es muy concurrido por los alumnos, ya que siempre tiene cosas muy deliciosas que ofrecer, además de mucha paciencia para atender, motivo por el cual los profesores del colegio confían en ella. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite cuidar a su pequeña hija mientras trabaja, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir. Para el futuro espera reunir el dinero necesario para tener una tienda de abarrotes.
Este es el sétimo préstamo de Juana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada, ya que siempre es muy puntual en sus reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su kiosco y así ofrecer a los alumnos y maestros una mayor variedad de productos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Jadia

texts.en:
Jadia M. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at the resturant  and is requesting a loan to extend the floor of her resturant .  Jadia is 32 years old and is Married with a husband that is a clerk in the World Food Programme. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: extend the floor of her resturant

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita, 41, is a seaweed farmer. By God’s grace, she was able to save from her income from seaweed farming and bought her own pump boat. She uses the boat to transport passengers from her place to the town of Talibon. She was also able to open a small store at her house. This makes her happy because she can provide for her family’s needs. 

She is married and has four children. Her oldest is 12 and goes to school. Anecita still hopes to succeed in her business life so she could send all her children to school and give them a proper education. She asked to borrow 25,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, which will be used to fund her business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa T. is not just concerned about her family's way of life, but she is also concerned about the way of life for many people in their village. Through her small variety store business, she hopes to make it more convenient for people to access their basic needs, especially food. Their village is very far and is inaccessible to transportation, markets and hospitals. These concerns led Teresa to think of a business that would help people in their village. Therefore, when she had access to a loan through her membership in ASHI, she put up a small variety store. From then on, her business has not only been helping her own family through her profits, but also other families through the access to goods that she has introduced.

Teresa wants to develop her business further through the loan she is requesting. She hopes that the time will come when her business will become sustainable and profitable to be able to achieve her personal dreams of educating her only child at college.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for the store.

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesús Group

texts.en:
Ana, 39, is a borrower from Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Caminando con Jesús (Walking with Jesus), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Ana and her husband live with their four children, ages ten to nineteen. They live in a simple house near Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic with a population of over a million people. Life around the city can be difficult with little access to reliable electricity and running water. Despite any difficulties she may face, Ana runs a successful shop from her home selling clothes. She plans to use this loan, her third from Esperanza International, to purchase new blouses for women and pants for both men and women. She will then sell the clothes to her friends and neighbors at a small markup.

Ana is very grateful for her newfound access to financial services such as loans and savings, as well as health services for her family. She hopes to continue expanding her business, and she hopes to own her own shop one day. With a house full of growing children, Ana also hopes to send them all to university with the extra profits from her business. With your help, Ana will be able to achieve these goals. Thank you for lending to Ana and the Caminando con Jesús group!

loans.use: To buy blouses and pants

loans.name: Manh

texts.en: Manh L. is 47 years old and currently lives with her four nephews in a rural area of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a single woman and makes a living by catching fish to sell. All four of her nephews assist her in catching fish. They normally fish in and around the Tunle Sap River. They sell their fish to middlemen who then take them to sell in the market. Recently, many of their fishing tools were ruined, and their income has been effected. Because of that, Manh L. decided to ask for a loan of $600, which is her second loan. She will buy more equipment for her fishing activities.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her fishing activities.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El señor Wilfredo P. vive en casa en anticretico, en la zona  de Pura Pura, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su hijo.
El señor Wilfredo y su esposa trabajan como empleados en una institución privada de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la ampliación del anticretico, ya que solo cuentan con una habitación siendo un ambiente  muy estrecho para su familia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Wilfredo P. lives in an anticrético house. [This is an agreement where the tenant pays rent up front, in full, at the beginning of the rental contract--but then recieves it back in full at the end of the rental period. It is essentially a loan from the tenant to the owner of the property but, in the end, the tenant lives "rent-free"]. He lives in the Pura Pura neighborhood, an area on the outskirts of the city of La Paz, with his wife and son. Wilfredo and his wife work for a private business in this city, and their income supports their family. The requested loan is for building an addition to thier anticrético house, because it only has one room and this is very tight living quarters for the family. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and the background analysis that has been done shows him to be qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an additional room onto his anticrético house

loans.name: Bigando C Doreen Kalisa Group

texts.en:
Doreen K. is thirty-eight years old and married with five children who all go to school.

She owns a grocery store that she has been running for over eleven years, although there were some ups and downs in her business due to lack of capital. She is using the loan to input more capital into her business by purchasing and stocking grocery items for sale such as cassava flour, tomatoes, beans, maize, and so forth.

She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Intiwara 2 Group

texts.es:
La mesa directiva del Banco D. Emprendimiento esta conformado por la señoras:
