La Sra. Justina quien tiene como actividad la Venta D. Dulces y punto Viva en su Kiosco  ubicado en La plaza arandia Villa Fátima, ella quiere ampliar su puesto D. venta para mejorar sus ingresos ya que tiene hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. 

La Sra. Silvia es la tesorera quien se dedica a la venta D. dulces en el colegio Hernando siles, es tambien portera del establesimiento tiene hijos que se encuentran en la misma escuela donD. ella trabaja.

La señora Natividad es la  secretaria  D. actas, se dedica a la venta en diferentes ferias D. la P. D. acuerdo a temporada y con Capital para la Ocación por ejemplo la feria D. Alasita ella ya cuenta con un puesto fijo durante esta feria y así trabaja durante todo el año.  Estas tres personas son la cabeza del banco D. emprendimiento conformado por Diez  personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas porque se conocen  y  saben que no fallaran a su garantía solidaria, como Banco. 

Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio fijo el otro 10% trabajan con mercaderia en su domicilio y lo acomodan en clientes fijos que ellos tienen y no cuenta con domicilio propio, son muy trabajadoras, el negocio es el unico ingreso con el cual mantienen el hogar son  responsables con su credito ahora se encuentran el  cuarto credito con nuestra institucion sin ningun problema. Se conocen muy bien y se colaboran entre ellos.

El destino del credito es para la compra D. mercaderia y en algunos casos para el incremento D. capital D. trabajo.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The executive board of the Banco del Emprendimiento is composed of the following women: Señora Justina, sells sweets and knit items for her business. She lives in her sales kiosk, which is located in the Plaza Arandia Villa Fátima. She wishes to expand her kiosk so that she may increase her income, now that she has children of school age. Señora Silvia is the treasurer, and she sells sweets in the Hernando Siles school, where she is also the door-woman. She has children who are attend the same school where she works. Señora Natividad is the secretary, responsible for taking minutes of the board's proceedings. She works selling various items at different fairs throughout La P. depending on the season and how much capital she has at the time. For example, she has a regular post at the fair of Alasita that she can rely on working; in this manner, going from fair to fair, she supports herself throughout the entire year. These three people are the head of the Banco D. Empredimiento, which is maD. up of ten people who, because they all know each other, form a guarantee amongst themselves that they will not miss their payments, making the bank a reliable institution. A majority of the members rely on their own fixed place of business to earn money. The other 10% takes merchandise to peoples' homes, delivering goods to a regular group of customers, since they do not own their own homes from which they could work. All the members are very hard-working, and their businesses are their only source of income, which they rely upon to maintain their homes and families. They are responsible with their loans. Currently, they are working with their fourth loan from Kiva and have not had a single problem. They all know each other very well and work together to assist each other. The loan they now request is to be used for purchasing merchandise and, in a few cases, to increase capital to put towards improving work places. All of the members are very thankful to both Emprender and Kiva for the confidence those groups have displayed to them in offering loans to the members to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
A primera vista es claro que Rosa Mercedes E. R. es una persona muy emprendedora. Tiene 40 años, vive en el barrio Villa del Carmen de Soledad y tiene dos hijas de 11 y 2 años de edad. Se dedica a muchas cosas para seguir adelante, sobre todo a la confección y al comercio. Ha estado vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante 3 años y este es su tercer crédito, el cual invertirá en la compra de mercancías, especialmente en útiles escolares, en productos de belleza y en telas e insumos para la confección.
Aprendió a coser empíricamente e inició su negocio hace 10 años elaborando colchas, sudaderas y ropa encargada por sus amigas. Como iba obteniendo experiencia, obtuvo ganancias que usó para comprar una multifuncional que le permite ofrecer fotocopias a sus vecinos y tambien para comprar una vitrina en la cual vende productos de belleza y píldoras naturales para la salud. Es más, es una conocedora de la comida: ofrece comida frita como deditos, empanadas y papas en horas de la tarde y hallacas los fines de semana,todo esto lo prepara con la ayuda de su mamá y una cuñada. Dice que con los créditos microfinancieros ha logrado desarrollar su negocio y que no contaba con recursos económicos antes de acudir a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
A raíz de su separación hace dos años, ha tenido que enfrentar sola los desafíos de su familia y su meta es comprar una casa propia para ella y sus hijas. También quiere montar un restaurante ofreciendo comida colombiana tipo afro-caribeño que incluye mucho pescado. Con este fin a la vista, realiza actualmente un curso en el SENA de Técnico en Cocina. El horario desde las 10 de la noche hasta las 5 de la madrugada es duro, pero se muestra entusiasmada con el sueño del restaurante.
texts.en:
At first glance, it's clear that Rosa Mercedes E. R. is a very entrepreneurial woman. She is 40 years old, lives in the Villa del Carmen de Soledad neighborhood, and has 2 daughters, ages 11 and 2. She holds several jobs to improve her life, mostly tailoring and retail sales. She has been a client of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 3 years and this is her third loan, which will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, specifically school supplies, beauty products, fabrics and supplies for tailoring. She taught herself how to sew and started her business 10 years ago, making bedspreads, sweatshirts, and custom clothing for her friends. As she gained experience, she earned more income that she used to buy a multifunctional printer/copier that allowed her to offer photocopy services to her neighbors, and a display case to sell beauty products and herbal supplements. Rosa is also a connoisseur of food: she makes fried foods such as deditos (cheese roll), empanadas, and french fries in the evenings and hallacas (meat and vegetables wrapped in cornmeal and banana leaves) on the weekends. She prepares these foods with the help of her mother and her sister-in-law. She says her micro-loans have helped her develop her business because she never had access to financial resources before working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Since her divorce 2 years ago, Rosa has had to face many challenges alone while caring for her family. Her goal is to buy her own house for her and her daughters. She also wants to open a restaurant offering Afro-Caribbean food, which consists of a lot of fish dishes. With this end in mind, she is currently taking a culinary course at SENA de Técnico, a technical college. The schedule, 10:00 at night until 5:00 in the morning, is difficult, but she is motivated by her dream of starting a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and supplies for tailoring and purchase of merchandise, specifically school supplies and beauty products.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad, 32, lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Ziad has owned a mobile phone for almost two years. He sells all type of new and used mobile phones and he also repairs them. He also sells mobile accessories like chargers, earphones, covers and more. He decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties because his clients are his friends and neighbors. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise to sell. This is the first time that Ziad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He hopes to expand his work in the future.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  vive en la zona Villa Copacabana, de la ciudad de La Paz
	
Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, puesto que sus hijos son mayores de edad y por lo tanto formaron sus propias familias y se fueron a vivir en otras zonas.

Es propietario de un bus y es miembro del sindicato Eduardo Avaroa linea 2.


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de llantas para su movilidad y para la venta de llantas a medio uso, que es su otra actividad.
 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in the Villa Copacabana area of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife; his children are grown, have formed their own families, and moved to other locations. He owns a bus and is a member of the Line 2 Eduardo Avaroa syndicate. The loan is to get tires for his vehicle and for his other activity, selling used tires. This is his second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires for his bus and for his business of selling tires

loans.name: Amistad 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Santa, 40, lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her loan group, Amistad (Friendship), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Santa is a single mother who lives with her children in a simple home in Samana, a mountainous rural peninsula in the northeast of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Santa runs a successful business making housing crafts, embroidery, and home decorations. With this loan, she plans on purchasing a sewing machine, fabric, and other sewing supplies for her business.

This is Santa’s seventh loan with Esperanza International. With her access to capital, she hopes to continue the growth of her business. Santa has used her profits from her sewing business to help pay for food and medicine that would otherwise be too expensive. Santa also has been able to use profits to pay for school supplies, including backpacks, notebooks, and shoes for her children. With her continued income, she hopes to one day purchase a computer for her family and build her own home — two very important symbols in the climb out of poverty. Santa looks forward to taking out larger loans with Esperanza, and is content in knowing that, with her work stability, her children will receive a great education so that they can become professionals in whatever they choose.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families from poverty through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Santa and the Amistad group!

loans.use: A sewing machine, fabric, and thread

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Flor de María M. P. es comerciante de este mercado tiene un salón de belleza ubicado en el sector salones tiene 6 años de tener su negocio tiene dos hijos en edad escolar que es por lo que ella se esfuerza grandemente para sacarlos adelante.
Su negocio lo inicio con un capital de  $ 500 dólares aporte de su esposo, el financiamiento lo solicito  para comprar unos tintes y unas pinturas que le vendian, es su primer crédito pero espera que no sea el último ya que le ha gustado la modalidad de estos créditos y la gentileza con que se le ha atendido.   En la fotografía  la señora M. P. es la que viste de café la otra muchacha es trabajadora de ella y la señora que esta sentada es clienta de ella le estan haciendo un corte de cabello
texts.en:
La Señora Flor de María M. P. es comerciante de este mercado tiene un salón de belleza ubicado en el sector salones tiene 6 años de tener su negocio tiene dos hijos en edad escolar que es por lo que ella se esfuerza grandemente para sacarlos adelante. Su negocio lo inicio con un capital de $ 500 dólares aporte de su esposo, el financiamiento lo solicito para comprar unos tintes y unas pinturas que le vendian, es su primer crédito pero espera que no sea el último ya que le ha gustado la modalidad de estos créditos y la gentileza con que se le ha atendido. En la fotografía la señora M. P. es la que viste de café la otra muchacha es trabajadora de ella y la señora que esta sentada es clienta de ella le estan haciendo un corte de cabello

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para acondicionar mi negocio realizarle mejora

loans.name: Omolabanke

texts.en:
Omolabanke is a faithful LAPO client and has been a member for some years with good record. She buys and sells drinks in wholesale and retail price and has been in the business for over 10 years.  
She hopes for more capital into the business in order to meet the demand of her numerous costumers in her locality. She is requesting for a loan of NGN70, 000 to purchase more drinks to sell and maximize profit. 

Omolabanke is 55years old, married and bless with four children. Her husband is into welding and they work hard to cater for their family.  She expresses her gratitude to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia del Carmen A. D. R. D. 53 años D. edad, una señora muy alegre y amable, la cual posee muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus amigos y vecinos, ya que se destaca por ser alguien responsable y respetuosa, la cual siempre ha trabajado junto a su esposo por sacar adelante su hogar y a sus dos hijos, los cuales a pesar que son mayores D. edad, se dedican a estudiar en la universidad, y aún no poseen trabajo, por lo que dependen D. sus padres. El esposo D. Cecilia se dedica a la venta D. carne D. res, y así mismo a una venta D. productos varios como shampoo, pasta dental y otros más. Cecilia posee una tienda en la cual comercializa todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, en la cual ha trabajado durante años para poder surtirla y D. esta forma obtener todos los beneficios posibles D. su negocio. Es por esto que Cecilia, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con los recursos necesarios para comprar muchos más productos comestibles como: pan, golosinas, huevos y otros más, D. los cuales son los que más se venden, así mismo comprar productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar. Todo esto es con el fin D. mejorar las ganancias obtenidas por la tienda y así poseer un negocio más rentable, el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa D. habitación en el departamento D. Sonsonate.
texts.en:
Cecilia del Carmen A. D. R. is a cheerful and friendly woman who is 53 years old and has excellent references from her friends and neighbors. They consider her to be someone who is responsible and respectful. She and husband work together to move their household forward and support their two children. Even though they are adults, one child is a university student while the other does not have a job, so they are still dependent on their parents. Cecilia’s husband sells beef while she sells various products such as shampoo, toothpaste, and other items. She has a store where she sells all types of basic necessities. Throughout the year, she works to keep her store stocked so that she can reap all the possible benefits from her business.

In this instance, Cecilia is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary resources to buy more food products such as bread, candy, eggs, and other items that sell very well. She will also buy products that are basic necessities in the home. Everything she does is with the purpose of improving her earnings so that her business will be more profitable. She manages her store out of her house, which is located in the Department of Sonsonate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba E. makes and sells coconut oil. She also sells cassava and plantain in Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Her husband is in farming. She provides a helping hand to her husband by clothing the children. She is confident that this loan will help boost her business. She plans to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell and coconut to make the oil. She hopes to reinvest her profits into the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell and coconut to make oil

loans.name: Urroz Gonzalo

texts.es:
El señor Urroz Gonzalo L. M., tiene la edad de 40 años habita acompañado de su pareja de vida, moran en un barrio de la capital conocido por los altos índices de delincuencia que amenazan el diario vivir de sus habitantes, tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad. El señor se dedica a la reparación de tragamonedas (juegos de casino).

Él inicio reparando 3 tragamonedas que se ubicaban en pulperías locales, hoy en día con la proliferación de este negocio la demanda ha crecido y estima que él realizan reparaciones a más  de 30 maquinas mensualmente, gracias a Afodenic con los fondos de Kiva, es que el señor López, ha logrado mejorar de sobremanera su hogar con la edificación y reparación de varias áreas del mismo, ahora solicita un préstamo con la intención de construir un  bajarete y componer el baño principal de su hogar, este apoyo les ayudara a tener mejores condiciones sanitarias, comodidades para todos los miembros del hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Urroz Gonzalo L. M. is 40 years old and lives with his wife in a neighborhood in the capital city. The neighborhood is known for the high crime rate that plagues its residents. They have two young children. This gentleman works as a slot machine repairman (casino games). He began by repairing three slot machines that were located in small local stores, but with the proliferation of this business, the demand for repairs has grown and he estimates that he repairs more than 30 machines each month. Thanks to AFODENIC and the Kiva funds, Mr. L. has managed to make improvements to his home by repairing various parts. He is asking for this loan so that he can build a porch and repair the main bathroom in his home. This will allow them to have more sanitary conditions; a comfort for all members of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair and improvement

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
The five members who make up this group loan are located in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Y., who was born in 1964, is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Srey Y. cooks and sells rice at her local market where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Oeurn Uy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to grow a crop to sell to support his family.

Since her business is going well Mrs. Srey Y. wants to expand it. So, to improve her business, she is applying for a loan to buy more rice to cook and sell.

Mrs. Srey Y. is the mother of two children, one of whom is a vegetable seller, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Vicenta Irene

texts.es:
Vicenta de 48 años, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene un restaurante, utiliza su casa para cocinar los platos típicos.   

Ella comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de ingresos, y para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Invirtió sus ahorros en víveres y comenzó a hacer comidas en su casa y venderlas a sus vecinos y amigos. Desde esos tiempos hasta ahora ella ha vendido almuerzos y meriendas desde $ 1.25 hasta $ 1.50.

Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar una cocina con el préstamo y mesas para mas comida. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 48 years old and lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants). She cooks typical dishes in her house. She started this activity because she did not have income. She started in order to be able to support her children because she is a single mother. She invested her savings in ingredients to make her dishes at her house and sell them to her friends and neighbors. Ever since she started she has been selling lunches and snacks for $1.25-$1.50. In order to continue in the business she wants to use the loan to buy a stove and tables for more food. In the future she wants her business to grow and her children to finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plastic tables and a stove

loans.name: Bushra Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Bushra perveen lives in a small city called Borewala which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She came to Borewala after her marriage to A. who runs a business selling towels and handkerchiefs.

Bushra is 39 years old and a caring lady who stays at home to manage the household chores. She also helps her husband in arranging his towels and handkerchiefs in an appropriate way so he finds them easily to meet the orders of his customers.

Bushra has four sons and two daughters. Two of her sons are illiterate and operate their businesses separately. Her other two sons are receiving an education and are in 2nd and 5th standard respectively. Her two daughters are also attending school and study in grade 7th and 10th standard.

Bushra lives with her family members in a small house of two rooms. She has converted her house into a home with her excellent management qualities.

Bushra has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to expand his business of selling towels and handkerchiefs. With the loan amount he will buy towels and handkerchiefs in bulk and increase his sales. Bushra is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business with this loan investment.

loans.use: To purchase more towels and handkerchiefs in bulk for her husband's business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: El Sr.Alexander, Mecánico de Oficio, biene desarrollando esta actividad desde hace 10 años atrás y de forma independiente desde hace 2 años aproximadamente, claro que esto no hubiera sido posible sin la ayuda de su familia los cuales son su impulso diario en esta muy dificil labor. En los ultimos meses y gracias a su desempeño y entrega constante a su trabajo Don Alexander empezó a incrementar su clientela, desde clientes comunes hasta transportista del sector urbano (Micros y Taxis), motivo por el cual se acercó a nuestras oficinas ya que el todavia no contaba con algunas herramientas necesarias e impresindibles en su taller tales como una tecla y un caimán lo suficientemente grandes como para poder trabajar con micros y camiones pequeños. Don Alexander no cuenta con Créditos en otras Instituciones y biene trabajando fielmente con nosotros desde hace ya un tiempo atráz, además de aquello cuenta con domicilio conocido por la Parada final de las lineas 48  Valparaiso, motivo por el cual no se le negó dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Alexander, a mechanic by trade, has been doing this type of work for the past ten years. He has had his own business for the past two years. Of course, this wouldn’t be possible without the help of his family, who motivate him each day in this difficult job. In the last few months, thanks to his work ethic and ability to deliver his customer requests, Mr. Alexander has begun to increase his customer base. From common customers to commercial transportation owners (microbuses and taxis), they all have come to his business. He still needs some necessary and essential tools for his auto shop such as a hydraulic floor jack and a block and tackle system that are large enough to allow him to work on microbuses and small trucks. Mr. Alexander has no loans with other organizations and has loyally committed himself to our community bank for a long time. Even though he has never had a loan, he has a well-known auto repair shop at the final bus stop of the Valparaiso 48 bus line. This is why his request for a loan was accepted.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General tools for his auto repair shop and he will buy a lift.

loans.name: Thomas Messanvi

texts.fr: cet monsieur est âgé de 50 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants,l'activité qu'il  exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille est le commerce de articles de quincaillerie, il détient sa propre boutique qu'il appelle "ETS GAMATO". il s'approvisionne à Lomé. la demande de sa clientèle est élevée. il souhaiterai s'approvisionner pour répondre convenablement aux besoins de sa clientèle raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 80 boîtes de colle, 1800 barres de fer et 25  bidons de carbure.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is 50 years old, married, and a father of two children. The work he does which enables him to support his family involves commerce in hardware. He has his own shop called "ETS GAMATO". He gets his supplies in Lomé. The demand from his customers is high. He would like to stock up in order to respond suitably to their needs. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 80 cans of glue, 1,800 iron rods, and 25 containers of fuel.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hardware items

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Victoria es viuda, tiene 6 hijos y solo 1 estudia, Victoria compra cereales que procesa en su casa, productos que lleva a la ciudad D. cañete para ser comercializados.
Victoria solicita un crédito D. 1500 soles para la compra D. cereales.
Los sueños D. Victoria son tener capital propio y su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Villa Huatatas Community Bank.  She is a widow; she has six children, and only one of her children is in school.  

Victoria buys cereals, which she processes in her house and then takes to the city of Cañete to be sold.  She is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles for the purchase of cereals.

Her dreams are to have financial capital of her own, and that her son can finish his studies.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon N. is a 56-year-old married mother who presently lives in the best province of Kompong Chhnang. She is a local farmer and also a tailor in her village. Thon N. currently generates an income of approximately US$ 2 per day by sewing clothes.  Thon N. is always hired by neighbors to sew new clothes for their wedding parties and other ceremonies. She also shares her sewing knowledge with her trainees for a fee. The family includes five devoted children, three of whom are single and two are married.

N.'s business has been running well for many years now but she still requires more materials to support her service. Thon N. is taking out her loan to buy more cloth, and with the remainder of the  funds to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and with the remainder to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, de 30 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 36 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. La actividad a la que Marisol se dedica es el cultivo de plátano y café. Es así que todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, comienza con el cuidado de sus chacras, ya que sabe que mientras más cuidadosa sea con sus cultivos, mejores productos obtendrá el momento de la cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de La merced, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marisol, 30, is a cheerful, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, José, 36, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better future.

Marisol is a banana and coffee farmer so very early, every day she tends to her fields because she knows that the more care she provides her crops the better her production will be at harvest time.

What she enjoys the most about her work is planting her fields, something she does with much patience.  She has been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport her products all the way to market in the city of La Merced which is where she sells them.  In time she hopes to buy more land to increase production.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she knows that she must be punctual with her repayments if she wants to be able to obtain other loans in the future.  She is a responsible member of her communal bank which makes her highly respected by her fellow members.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for crop improvement.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.   Jackline has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jackline hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  

In the future, Jackline hopes to become a teacher.Jackline is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. He has been working as a farmer for the past fifteen years and in 2000, he started working independently on his own land, raising cattle. He produces dairy products such as milk, yogurt, etc. he is thankful for his business income; he is able alone to cover the household expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fertilizers and feed for the cattle to give a good quality of products for the coming season, knowing that in Lebanon the majority of housewives prepare home products to use all through the year. In the future, he is planning to purchase more cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn T. (in the photo), 38, is a widow with three sons and two daughters. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 


Yorn is a rice farmer, and she slso sells steamed corn when she is not busy at her farm. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit H. and her family receive the bulk of their income by working in agriculture. She has applied for a loan in order to increase the number of livestock they own. This will increase their income and will help the family get through the winter.

Margarit and her husband have two children. Margarit’s father-in law lives with the family as well and has great influence in children’s upbringing; his dream is to see his grandchildren well-educated and happy.

loans.use: To increase livestock

loans.name: Bundan

texts.en:
Bundan M. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a house in Har-Horin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His oldest son attends a local kindergarten and his wife works for the local museum.

Bundan has been operating a public transport service between Har-horin and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, since 2001. After many years of owning this business, he has built a stable operation and has gained not only much experience but also a positive reputation among his customers. With his business profits, he was able to build a house in his enclosure where the family currently lives. For the future, Bundan plans to start saving money for his children's future. He is a very business-minded and clever man and is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase parts and tools for his mini-bus.

loans.use: to purchase parts and tools for his mini-bus

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. is a married lady with two children, whom she hopes to educate to the university level. Her business is located at Changamwe estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites and the white beaches of the Indian ocean. 

Lucy sells charcoal to the local people, a business she has been engaged in for the last two years. She also sells shawls to augment the income she gets from the charcoal business. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

Lucy is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy charcoal to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She describes herself as an ambitious lady.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Luis Alberto; el tiene 48 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de repuestos de carro, el vende en forma independiente y también trabaja como cheff en un restaurant, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de repuestos de carros.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a member of the "HATUN RUMIYOC" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Luis Alberto is 48 years old, single, and has one child.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business buying and selling car parts.  He makes his sales independently and also works as a chef in a restaurant.  He would like to expand his business buying and selling car parts.  He is requesting this loan for personal use.

Luis Alberto is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es:
La Señorita Maria Deysi C. V., es una persona de 22 años de edad, soltera, bachiller en humanidades, vive con sus padres, es agricultora produce papa, haba, arveja, maíz (choclo), cebada y realiza la transformación de la papa en chuño aprovechando la época de invierno en la comunidad de Manzana Rancho - Tíraque que está distante aproximadamente a unos 70 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. Sus padres son personas trabajadoras por ejemplo; el padre recientemente ingreso a trabajar en una empresa constructora en calidad de excavador y la madre trabaja junto a ella en la actividad agropecuaria, pero aprovechando sus tiempos libres especialmente los días de feria de la población de Sacaba - Cochabamba, realiza la reventa de papa y otros productos por los cuales genera un ingreso económico adicional y de tal forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia. 

Asimismo la clienta y sus padres manifiestan tener el deseo de comprar otro terreno agrícola para poder incrementar su producción y a partir de esto mejorar sus ingresos económicos; para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión  para adquirir en calidad de compra el mencionado terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Miss Maria Deysi C. V. is 22 years old, single and has a Bachelor of Humanities degree.  She lives with her parents and is a farmer raising potatoes, lima beans, peas, corn and barley.  She also makes freeze-dried potatoes in the winter months in the Manzana Rancho - Tíraque community which is about 70 kms. from the city of Cochabamba.  Her parents are very hard workers.  Her father recently started a job as an excavator for a construction company.  Her mother works with her in the farming activity and also uses her free time to travel to the market in the town of Sacaba - Cochabama where she sells the potatoes and other products which generate even more income allowing the family to improve their living conditions.

Maria Deysi and her parents wish to buy farmland to increase production and income and so plan to use the loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah N. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Isaiah has a clinic, which he has had for less than one year.

To help expand his business, Isaiah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Isaiah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Isaiah hopes to expand his clinic business to become bigger than it is.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Miss Uma N. lives with her father, mother and brothers in Tangal, Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses selling groceries, ready-made items, vegetables, utensils of different metals, and so on. The area is a very busy shopping center.
Seven years ago Miss N. opened a beauty parlor to improve her family's standard of living. She undertook six months of training for beauty parlor work from a local training institute. Her service is for ladies only. Now she is requesting a loan of 30,000 NPR to buy various types of make-up supplies for her work. She wishes to use her income to further raise the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy make-up supplies for her business

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara K. is the leader of this group. She is 29 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband she is bringing up two sons and a daughter. The daughter studies at school and the sons are preschool age (under seven). 

Gulnara works as a nurse in the hospital. She also sells milk every day to make additional money, and she earns an additional 2,000 KGS per month. 

She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase 800kg of potato seeds. In the near future Gulnara plans to sow wheat and potatoes, and she wants to get a good harvest.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Desmond

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Desmond K.. He is married and has three children aged four, seven, and eight. He has five additional dependents who live with him because they help him with his business; he also assists some of them with their education. 

In 2003, Desmond established his drinks business. He began his business because he needed to get a means of livelihood for his family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more stock for his business for more profit. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 100,000 SLL. 

In the future, Desmond plans to educate his children, and open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks and pure water for his business

loans.name: Jemama

texts.en:
Jemama is 28 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She has two children who are three and seven years old. Her children live with her and also attend school. Jemama was only able to complete eighth grade. 

For the past seven years, Jemama has been selling both clothes and charcoal. She makes more of a profit during the rainy season than in the dry season. Jemama is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes, charcoal, and rice for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, charcoal, and rice to sell

loans.name: Gemelos Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "GEMELOS", PORQUE GRACIAS AL NACIMIENTO DE UNOS GEMELOS DE LA HERMANA DE UNA DE LAS INTREGANTES LES TRAJO BENDICION A SU ACTIVIDADA LABORAL Y DECIDIERON LLAMARLO ASI PARA TRAER ESA MISMA BENDICION PARA EL GRUPO. ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA BRENDA T. ES LA TESORERA  DEL GRUPO. ELLA TIENE 27 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA EL SEXTO AÑO DE PRIMARIA, VENDE ZAPATOS Y TIENE UN PUESTO DE GORDITAS. LA SEÑORA BRENDA TIENE 2 HIJOS (UN HOMBRE Y UNA MUJER). ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GORDITAS (MASA RELLENA DE FRIJOLES COCIDA EN UN COMAL CON SALSA Y QUESO) EL CUAL LO INICIO HACE 3 AÑOS SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER RENTAR UN LOCAL Y COMPRAR UN PAR DE MESAS PARA DARLE MAS SANIDAD YA QUE TRABAJA EN LA ESQUINA DE SU CASA Y MESAS PARA DARLE UNA MEJOR IMAGEN Y MAYOR COMODIDAD A SUS COMENSALES LOS CUALES LA HAN FELICITADO POR EL CAMBIO QUE PIENSA REALIZAR Y POR PENSAR EN ELLOS Y TENER MAS VARIEDAD DE ANTOJITOS. ELLA SE SIENTE EXITOSA Y AGRADECIDA POR LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE SE LE BRINDA. TAMBIEN ESPERA CON ESTE MEJORAMIENTO SEGUIR AYUDANDO A SU ESPOSO YA QUE EL ES ALBAÑIL Y NO TIENE UN INGRESO ESTABLE.
TAMBIEN DESEA DARLE UNA MEJOR EDUCACION A SUS HIJOS YA QUE ELLA NO LO TUVO.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Gemelos' (Twins) because when the sister of one of the group's members gave birth to twins, it brought a blessing to their business activities.  For this reason, they decided to give their group the same name so that it might receive the same blessing.  The group is located in the State of Puebla, Mexico.

Brenda T. is the group's treasurer.  She is 27 years old, studied up to the sixth year of elementary school, and sells shoes.  She also has a stall where she sells 'gorditas' (stuffed corn cakes).  Brenda has two children (a son and a daughter).  She started making her 'gorditas' three years ago.  Her 'gorditas' are stuffed with beans that have been cooked on a special hotplate with salsa and cheese.

Brenda is requesting this loan so that she can rent business premises and also pay a couple of months' rent so that she can work more hygienically as she currently works in the corner of her home.  In addition, she would like to buy tables so that she can present a better image and provide more comfort to her diners who have congratulated her on the change that she is planning to make and for having thought of them.  She would like to also offer a wider range of snacks.

Brenda feels successful and grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.  She hopes that, with this improvement, she will be able to continue helping her husband since he is a construction worker and doesn't have a stable income.  She would also like to provide her children with a better education as she didn't receive a good education herself.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Trésor Plus Group

texts.en:
Wongudi is the leader of the Community Bank named “Trésor Plus” which is composed of 10 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Wongudi is 37 years old, married and has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2005.  He operates a general store to the north-east of Kinshasa.  He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a larger store in Kinshasa. 

He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him $70 per week.  He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals.  Wongudi is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having obtained loans five times and promptly repaid them.  He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, some sacks of rice, soaps, sugar and milk and reselling them at profit.  Wongudi has five children aged between 4 and 14 years old.  Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying cans, some sacks of rice, soaps, sugar and milk and reselling them at profit.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. For the past ten years, Emma has operated a retail shop where she sells fish such as sardines and milk fish. 

Emma is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Fotima's Group

texts.en:
Fotima, 37, is the leader of this group. She was born in Aravan and has two kids. Fotima’s husband is presently employed in a construction firm in Russia, so the children were left in Fotima’s care. “If there ever was a guiding force in my life, it is my children,” Fotima explained. Fotima does her best to help her children achieve their goals in life. 

With the help of savings from doing farming, Fotima started selling grocery products in a local market in 2008. The groceries include tea, pasta, sugar, salt, etc. Currently she earns 8 000 soms monthly while having 20 000 soms in goods circulation. The past three years have brought enough help for buying livestock and furniture for the house. Fotima knows that success does not come easily, you have to work hard. She believes that the hard work in business will help her successfully repay the loan from Kiva, which she requests for investing in goods circulation. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María Angélica tiene 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija mayor de edad, ellas viven en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayalti en la provincia de Chiclayo.aría Angelica cuenta con casa propia la misma que cuenta solo cuentan con los servicios básicos.

María Angélica se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos desde hace diez años, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general, además de comida ella ofrece bodoques y refrescos El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comida. María Angélica cuenta con una experiencia de6 años en este negocio, lo que le permite contar con clientes fidelizados a su negocio.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos al por mayor como arroz, menestras, azúcar, para que le genere menor costo y así lograr más ingresos de modo que pueda incrementar su preparación de alimentos y pueda crecer su margen de ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María tiene buen caracter, y muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello desea trabajar y ampliar su negocio para lograr una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Angélica is 64 years old and lives in her own home with her grown daughter.  The live in a community located in the District of Cayaltí in Chiclayo Province.    Her home receives the basic services.  

María Angélica has been preparing and selling food for 10 years.  She prepares the food at home and then offers it for sale to the general public.  In addition to food, she sells popsicles and soft drinks.  Her business has earned a good reputation among her customers because of the great flavor in which her food is prepared.  María Angélica has six years of experience in managing her business, which has allowed her to build up a loyal customer base.

She wants to expand her business by purchasing supplies in bulk such as rice, dried vegetables, and sugar so that she can get a lower cost.  This will allow her to generate more income by preparing more food and increasing the profit margin from her sales.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

María is of sound character and has tremendous desire to get ahead.  For this reason, she wants to work and expand her business so that she can achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients in bulk such as rice, dried vegetables, and sugar.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is 35 years old, married and they have three children aged between fifteen years and three years old. She bakes and sells cakes to local people at Makongeni area in Nairobi. Besides the bakery she also operates a salon. She has been in this business for ten years now and hires one employee. She says the major challenge she has is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and others to grow her bakery business. She hopes to grow her business and in future open a big bakery. She describes herself as hardworking, outgoing and humble.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 33-year-old married woman.  She has been working as a beauty therapist for 8 years. Mirvat is a hard worker and a loyA. wife, she works hard to help her husband with their living in order to provide their child with the best life.

Mirvat is well-known in the region.  She is recommended by most of her customers because of her good customer service and talent.  Mirvat is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua-Kiva partner for the fifth cycle, in order to buy new beauty cosmetics necessary for her business. 

Mirvat is trying to buy a new bedroom for her child.  She  hopes to provide her child with the best education and with good health.  She hopes to expand her business more and more through adding new and different services for her customers.

loans.use: buy cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 59 years old and the widowed mother of two school-going children. She has been selling clothes (her primary business) and a clinic (her other source of income) for the last four years, making a monthly profit of KES 20,000. She has been loaned KES 50,000. She plans to use KES 25,000 to purchase more clothes to sell and KES 25,000 to purchase laboratory equipment.

With the anticipated profits made, she will build a nursing home for her community. In the future, she hopes to expand to neighboring communities.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and laboratory equipment.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 52 and lives with his family of eight children in the Kitale area of western Kenya. Three of his children are still of school-going age. 
John has been in farming for ten years and currently employs one farmhand on his farm. His farm produces milk, maize and yoghurt, which he processes himself for the local market.
John has made a second loan request of 92,000 KES with Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo. He will use the loan to purchase and insure a dairy cow at 52,000 KES and use the remaining 40,000 KES to construct a modern dairy unit for his dairy animals. He says the loan will increase his income and enable him to educate his children.
John mentions the high cost of animal feed and fluctuations in milk prices as the challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 33-year-old hardworking business man. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last four years, he has been selling clothes to earn a living. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to have a permanent business premise. His dream is to establish a wholesale business. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy trousers for resale.

loans.use: To buy trousers to resell

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es:
Rosa de 47 años, una mujer muy trabajadora y honrada, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Suburbio”.
Su negocio de venta de comidas lo inicio hace 3 años, con el apoyo de su vecina que la impulso a  poner  este  negocio. Ya que se di cuenta que tenía el  arte de la cocina en las manos.
El horario de ella es de lunes, miércoles y viernes desde las 8:00am hasta las 22:00pm.
Los días martes, jueves, sábado es empleada domesticas y el domingo descansa.
La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia, hace 5 años que se separó de su esposo.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y para la compra de cocina, arroz, azúcar, etc.
El sueño de ella es ampliar su negocio y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 47, is a hardworking and honest woman. She lives in a suburban area called “Suburbio”. Rosa started selling food three years ago after a neighbor convinced her that she should go into business. At that point, she realized that her hands were blessed with the art of cooking.

Her schedule is Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays from 8am to 10pm. On Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays she works as a housekeeper and on Sundays she takes a rest. The difficulty she faces is dealing with crime. Rosa and her husband have been separated for five years.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business and to buy a stove, rice, sugar, and other items. Her dream is to expand her business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a stove, rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Danelia Justina

texts.es: Danelia Justina tiene 60 años, su actividad es una librería, desde hace más de 5 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella inicia todas las mañanas con gran alegría su trabajo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, la mayoría de sus clientes saben muy bien este negocio. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como cuadernos, lapiceros, hojas, borradores, crayones, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Danelia Justina is 60 years old and she has supported herself through her book store for more than 5 years. She begins her work every morning with great happiness, working from 7:00 am until 9:00 pm. The majority of her customers know this business very well. That's why she is requesting this loan, intended for the purchase of merchandise such as notebooks, pencils, paper, erasers, and crayons, among other products.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, paper, erasers, and crayons, among other products to sell.

loans.name: Mayrambubu

texts.ru: Майрамбубу 57 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи,   в 1991 году Майрамбубу с мужем начали свой бизнес в разведении и перепродаже скота, вложив при этом начальную сумму 50,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день,  хозяйство Майрамбубу насчитывающее 5 коров,1 теленка, 45 овец и одну кобылицу, приносит ежемесячный доход в сумме 13,500 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кобылицы и коз. Доходы от кредита Майрамбубу планирует направить на реконструкцию сарая для скота.
texts.en: Mayrambubu is 57 years old, married, and has four children. In search of additional income for the family, in 1991 Mayrambubu and her husband started their business, raising and selling animals, initially investing a sum of 50,000 KGS. Today, Mayrambubu's farm has 5 cows, 1 calf, 45 sheep, and 1 mare , bringing in a monthly income of 13,500 KGS. To further develop their business, Mayrambubu has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy a mare and goats. Mayrambubu plans to use the income from the loan on improvements on the barn for the animals.

loans.use: to purchase a mare and goats.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is single, and she has been a seamstress at Kokoado in Elmina for six years. Cecelia uses her income to pay her utility bills. Cecelia will use the loan to purchase materials for sewing. With the new profits, Cecelia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase materials for sewing.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuna Pyapy Mbarete tiene el total D. 14 integrante . Son mujeres trabajadoras y muy responsables formaron su grupo entre vecinas y amigas y ya hacen parte del Comité D. Mujeres Rurales D. la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas se encuentran muy felices trabajando dentro D. la fundación por lo que les gustaría poder llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
Berta es una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora, ella es una mujer que lucha por el sustento D. su familia, ya que desea darles lo mejor, puesto que no quiere que ellos pasen por las mismas privaciones que ella. Comenta que se dedica a la cría y posterior venta D. animales, como ser gallinas y cerdos. Le va muy bien con su trabajo, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir creciendo. Una D. sus metas es llegar a tener una granja llena D. animales.
Solicita la ayuda D. fundación paraguaya y D. kiva para la compra D. animales pequeños y alimentos para estos.
texts.en:
The Kuna Pyapy Mbarete communal bank has 14 members. The members are hardworking and very responsible women who are neighbors and friends. This group makes up part of Fundación Paraguaya’s Rural Women Communal bank (Comité D. Mujeres Rurales). They are very happy be working in the foundation because they would like to reach the highest level of the program. 
Berta is a very sacrificing and hardworking woman. She is a woman who fights to support her family in order to give them the best. She does not want them to deal with the same hardships she has had. She raises and sells animals like chickens and pigs. Her work is going very well and she would like to continue growing the business. One of her goals is to have a farm full of animals. 
She is requesting help from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to purchase small animals and food for those animals.

loans.use: buy small animal and food for those animals.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 46-year-old woman from Al-Hashmi-Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to do maintenance work on her house. Amal is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on her house.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 28 years old and married with 3 children. With 3 children in school, Amy works very hard to provide for them.

Amy runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Amy has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as spices, canned goods, eggs, etc.. 

In the future Amy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Francisca; tiene 59 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 10 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de platos,ollas,tazas y adornos de material de loza,la socia trabaja desde las 8.00 a.m hasata las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de loseria . La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tazas,platos,ollas y adornos de loza para implementar su tienda.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member's name is Francisca. She is 59 years old, married and has 10 children. She still has her business selling china plates, bowls, cups, and decorations. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. and with this business she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to expand and improve her her china selling business. She is asking for this loan to buy china cups, plates, bowls, and decorations to stock her store. 

Francisca is grateful for the loan she has asked for and she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy china cups, plates, bowls, and decorations to stock her store.

loans.name: Huyen's Group

texts.en:
Ms  Huyen is twenty years old with two small children.  She has a shop selling gas.  Her business started one year ago.  Seeing that it will develop more, she has used loans to buy more gas and sell gas cookers.  She joined the credit program in 2010 and she used her first loan effectively to expand her business.  Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy gas to invest in her gas shop.

Ms Chanh is fifty-three years old.  Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises pigs.  Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy gas to invest in her gas shop.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara  a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a la adquisición de materiales agrícolas para el cultivo. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios universitarios y a apoyar a su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar  abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther I. is a 40 years old is married with three (3) children. She has been doing her business for five years and would like to expand her business with $350 if she is given the loan.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients for sale

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.en: Afiwa lives in Abokobi, Accra, Ghana. She operates a business that sells soft drinks and beverages with alcohol. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation (KSF) and has benefited from the organization's training programs and funding opportunities for several years. A loan of $750 from Kiva will enable her to increase her inventory and sales.

loans.use: Buy more beverages to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. is 56 years old and lives with her three children and her nephew in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S.'s husband passed away, so she must support the family herself.  S. works as a tailor and can generate about $3.50 on the average day.  She hopes to use this loan to expand her garment business by purchasing mobile phones so that she can more easily coordinate with her clients.  Additionally, S. hopes to open a stall in the local market to increase her business activity. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones to help expand business

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta García lives in the city of El Alto. She is from a family with few economic resources. At 16 years old, she was working as a street vendor selling used tools in the city market. This was not a very profitable business and she had to walk long distances in order to sell and support her family.

Now Marta is the mother of two children, is married, and is the owner of a shop selling nuts and bolts in the July 16 Market. Among her immediate goals are expanding and remodeling the physical space of her business, in order to expand into other markets with the goal of improving her family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marta García, vive en la ciudad de El Alto, proviene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos; a sus 16 años trabajó como vendedora ambulante de fierros usados en la feria de esta ciudad, un negocio poco rentable que la obligaba a caminar grandes distancias para poder vender y llevar el sustento hasta su hogar. En la actualidad Marta es madre de dos niños, casada y dueña de un puesto de venta de pernos y tuercas en la Feria 16 de Julio. Dentro de sus metas inmediatas, tiene la firme intención de ampliar y refaccionar su negocio, para poder abarcar otros mercados con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To expand and remodel the physical space of her business.

loans.name: Bisharofat

texts.ru:
Bisharofat S., 36 is married and has 2 children. She has high school education. Bisharofat S. began her business by selling clothing for men and children. In 2004, she joined MicroInvest lending program with a loan of $60. Since receiving the first loan, Bisharofat S. changed her business specialty—she now sells dried fruits. Bisharofat S. also moved her business to another place. Now, Bisharofat S. has $230 in business assets. She plans to expand the assortment of goods sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сулаймонова Бишарофат – 36лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей, образование среднее. Муж занимается строительством, дети учатся в школе. Начала она свою деятельность с продажи детской и мужской одежды. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2004году, тогда её активы составляли 60$. После получения займа и неоднократного использования она перешла на другой вид бизнеса стала продавать сухофрукты, изменила место деятельности. Сейчас её активы составляют 230$. В будущем планирует увеличить ассортимент товара.

loans.use: To increase assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
After becoming unemployed, and with one son and a wife to support, Rodolfo Qiuñon, decided to go to work as a taxi driver and to sell shoes door to door. Four years later and after much hard work, Rodolfo has gained many clients and has found a way to make a better life for his family.

Today is he is asking for a loan to establish his business in a central market location. This way he will be in a set location where old clients can find him, and new clients can get to know him and buy from him. With your help Rodolfo will continue to help meet the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Después de quedar desempleado y con un hijo y esposa que mantener Rodolfo Qiuñon, decidió salir a la calle como taxista y a vender zapatos casa por casa. Cuatro años después y con mucho esfuerzo, Rodolfo ha ido ganando clientes y buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su familia.

Hoy está solicitando un préstamo para poder establecerse en con un local en un mercado rodante. Para así tener un punto en donde lo puedan localizar sus clientes y que pueda atraer más clientela. Con tu ayuda Rodolfo podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell (shoes)

loans.name: Alihon

texts.en: Alihon and his wife make a living by preparing and selling shish kebabs and baked pies. They have been doing this for 7 years. They have no other permanent jobs and their business is the only source of their income. Alihon and his wife travel among all markets in the region so they have to work every day of the week. Selling at a single market brings them $100 in earnings. He plans to take another loan to increase the volume of their business. The Mamajonovs are in the photo.

loans.use: To increase the volume of business

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
“I live in Lahore, Pakistan with my husband and five children. Three of them attend school and the youngest two will attend later. I hope that my eldest son will become a doctor.

My husband purchases old computers and fixes them or sells the spare parts from those that can't be fixed. He needs a loan to purchase computers.

My husband’s work slows down due to shortage of money as capital for this little business. Last night we obtained a new order but due to lack of money, we cannot meet the demand for old computers.

Last year we took a loan from the microfinance institution Asasah to start this business. Before this, we were not doing well as we did not even have warm blankets to sleep under. With profits from the business last year, we are now doing better and have even bought new blankets. We hope to do even better in the future.”

loans.use: Buy and re-sell old computers

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha Alicia has a family of her own, however, her mother gets sick frequently. For that reason, Alicia is working extra to make enough money to take her mother to a doctor and to cover her household’s expenses. Two years ago, she was offered a business with merchandise, and thanks to her persistence, they gave her the opportunity to pay for it in small installments. Little by little, Alicia, with her charisma and her desire for self-improvement, has been expanding her business and currently has many loyal customers.

However, the demands of the clientele are what should be tended to first in a business, and her clients are currently requesting a bigger variety in her merchandise. For that reason, Alicia is requesting a loan for $300. She is willing to repay it in a 4-month term, and she will be able to purchase more merchandise to earn a higher income. With your help, Alicia and her family, especially her mother, will receive a great benefit and she will be able to give them the best so that they are healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha Alicia, ya tiene su propisa familia. Sin embargo su mamá se enferma constantemente. Es por eso que Alicia está trabajando extra para poder sacar dinero para poder llevarla a un doctor a su mamá y para sacar para los gastos en su casa. Hace dos años le traspasaron un local con mercancía, gracias a su insistencia le dieron la posibilidad de comprarla en pequeños pagos. Poco a poco Alicia con su buen carisma y sus ganas de salir adelante, ha ido creciendo su negocio actualmente tiene clientes frecuentes.

Sin embargo las exigencias de la clientela es lo que primeramente se debe de atender en un negocio. Y sus clientes actualmente están solicitándole más surtido en su mercancía. Es por eso que Alicia está solicitando un crédito de US $300. Alicia está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía para poder obtener mayores ingresos. Con tu ayuda Alicia, su familia, en especial su mamá podrán verse beneficiados para que ella pueda brindarles lo mejor para que estén sanos.

loans.use: Restock her business.

loans.name: Ndigwake

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Ndigwake M., who is widowed with two children, aged 13 and 19.

Ndigwake owns a general store, and requests a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria Hernández is a single mother of two daughters ages 5 and 11. Faced with the need for a source of income in order to pay for her daughters’ expenses, she started a business one year ago, a general store in her home, in order to give her little ones a better life. Nonetheless, it has been hard work making her business grow.

She is currently requesting a loan of US $250, to be repaid over 3 months, in order to invest in more merchandise and to be able to offer her customers a greater variety, which will depend on her choices and increase her sales. Let’s support Gloria, an enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria Hernández es madre soltera, tiene dos niñas de 5 y 11 años, ante la necesidad de una fuente de ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de sus hijas, hace 1 año emprendió un negocio, una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para así brindarle una mejor vida sus pequeñas. Aunque ha sido una tarea difícil ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para invertirlo en mercancía y poder ofrecer as sus clientes una mayor variedad, contando así con su preferencia e incrementando sus ventas. Apoyemos a gloria una mujer emprendedora.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Economic hardship and hunger have motivated Maritza to work hard and persistently all her life. Her efforts have resulted in operating a notions store, which also has enabled her to increase her income and provide for the education and well being of her children.

A selfless and diligent mother, Maritza sells notions (e.g., buttons, thread, ribbons, etc.) at local fairs in towns neighboring her hometown of Juliaca. Her business activity has improved her quality of life. Unfortunately, a week ago a large part of her merchandise was stolen. The incident has jeopardized her children’s future, as Maritza is no longer able to earn an income to support her family. For this reason Maritza is turning to your generosity and asking for your support in recovering from this horrible incident.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

La necesidad y el hambre la incentivaron a esforzarse y a perseverar en su actividad de toda la vida. Su negocio de venta de mercería fue posible gracias a su esfuerzo y le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos económicos, la educación y el bienestar de sus queridos hijos.

Esta abnegada y diligente madre vende sus mercaderías los días de feria en los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal Juliaca, gracias a ello ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida, desafortunadamente hace una semana sufrió el robo de una buena cantidad de mercadería, en estos momentos sus hijos se ven perjudicados con este incidente, porque ya no está logrando obtener buenas ganancias para el sustento de su hogar, es por ello que doña Maritza recurre a tu generoso corazón para solicitar tu apoyo y recuperarse de este desagradable suceso.

loans.use: Infusion of capital to relaunch her business

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Suhrob R. lives in the town of Yavan with his family. He is married and has six children. But in order to be able to provide for his family, he has to work in animal breeding. He has a small farm where he breeds great cattle. Currently, he wants to add another room to the barn in order to create more space in the cowshed. This is why he's planned to take out a loan which he'll be able to repay within six months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Раджабов Сухроб пароживает в городе Яван. Живет со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Работает водителем .Но для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семьюему приходится заниматься животноводством.Он имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. В данный момент хочет пристроит еще одну комнату в сарае для того чтобы увеличить прострнство в коровнике. Для этого он запланировал получить кредит , который сможет погасить в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Enlarge a barn.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank.

She lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Teodora has a well-stocked store-restaurant, where she sells groceries and in the same place sells a variety of food. She also has photocopying services and in the afternoons sells drinks. These businesses are run by her with help from her young daughter. Her store is located near the city of Ayacucho´s municipal cemetary.

Teodora needs a loan for 3,000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, pastas, mile and drinks.

Teodora´s dreams are to have her own home, buy a car, expand her business and to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.

Es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Teodora tiene un tienda - restaurante muy surtida donde vende abarrotes, en el mismo local vende comida variada, también brinda servicios de fotocopiado, además por las tardes vende bebidas, estos negocios son administrados por ella con el apoyo de su hija pequeña, su tienda esta ubicado cerca del cementerio general de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Teodora necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, leche y bebidas.

Los sueños de Teodora son tener casa propia, comprar su carro, implementar más su negocio y seguir creciendo.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, pastas, milk and drinks.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa is 38 years old, single and lives with her parents, she has an eight year old son in school.
