Since she was very young she went to Argentina where she worked for 10 years, when she returned to her country she started her business with her savings and in order to stay with her parents to take care of them.

Her dream is that her son finishes his studies and be a professional one day, Rosa works 15 hours each day to help her parents and son, her business is located 10Km from the city in front of a school and next to a soccer field, thanks to her good attention her sales have increased considerably.

She needs the loan to buy a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Rosa tiene 38 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres, tiene un hijo de ocho años quien está en la escuela.

Desde muy joven fue a la Argentina donde trabajó durante diez años, al regresar al país utilizó su ahorro para empezar su negocio y poder quedarse con sus padres para cuidarlos.

Su sueño es que su hijo culmine sus estudios y asi ser profesional, Rosa trabaja 15 horas diarias para ayudar a sus padres e hijo, su negocio está ubicado a 10km de la ciudad frente a una escuela y al costado de una cancha de fútbol, gracias a su buena atención ha aumentado considerablente sus ventas.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de una congeladora.

loans.use: To buy a freezer / Compra de una congeladora

loans.name: Faida's Hatutaki Shari Group

texts.en:
Faida is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children; one is 4 years old and one only 9 months. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 125 from her sales.

Faida is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with firewood & charcoal sales, shoes, juice, and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz is 32 years old. He has been in this business for 3 years. This man is single and lives in Khachmaz town.  Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy furniture to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy furniture for re-sale

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que su esposo tiene un trabajo poco redituable porque traba jane la construcción y no siempre tiene trabajo, por lo que en ocasiones se complica el poder hacer los pagos de servicios y demás, es por eso que ella decidió vender ropa usada.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar pacas de ropa. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Alicia started her business to support her husband with the household expenses since her husband has as a job is not very profitable because he works in construction and he doesn't always have work, which on occasions complicates being able to pay bills and everything else. For this reason she decided to sell used clothing. She needs a loan of $275 that she will repay in 4 months to buy packages of clothing. With your help she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of packages of clothing

loans.name: Guadalupitas Group

texts.es: LAS  PERSONAS QUIENES CONFORMAN EL GRUPO "GUADALUPITAS" ESTAN REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA MARI LUZ, TODOS LOS INTEGRANTES SON PERSONAS DEDICADAS AL COMERCIO Y  ADEMÁS  SE CONOCEN HACE MUCHOS AÑOS YA QUE RESIDEN EN EL MISMO BARRIO. TODOS LOS SOCIOS SON GENTE RESPONSABLE, SOLIDARIA Y SE COMPROMETEN A SER PUNTUALES EN LOS PAGOS D. LAS CUOTAS. LOS SOCIOS SE DEDICAN A VARIADAS ACTIVIDADES COMO SER: VENTA D. ROPA, PRODUCTOS COSMESTICO, VENTA D. COMIDA, D. VERDURA, FRUTAS, LICORERIA, ABARROTE. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO POR LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA EN ESPECIAL EN LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS, PERO LOS SOCIOS TIENEN EXPERIENCIA Y ANTIGUEDAD EN SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA POR LO QUE NO TIENEN MAYOR DIFICULTAD CON LA COMPETENCIA. TODOS ELLOS DESEAN SUPERARSE Y SALIR ADELANTE CON SUS FAMILIAS ES POR ESO QUE TODOS TRABAJAN DURO PARA MEJORAR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA. EL FINANCIAMIENTO OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACION AGROCAPITAL SERÁ DESTINADO PARA AUMENTAR INSUMOS A SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA Y MEJORAR EN LA CALIDAD D. SUS PRODUCTOS.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Guadalupitas" are represented by Maria Luz. All of them work in sales and have known each other for years because they live in the same area. They all are responsible, caring, and committed to make their payments on time. Their businesses incluD. the sale of clothing, household products, food, vegetables, fruits, groceries. The "Guadalupitas", like everyone else in sales, face competition in the market, but they are all experienced and hard working, and have no trouble doing well. All of them wish to do better and make a better life for their families. The loan requested will be used to restock their businesses and to improve the quality of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Fany

texts.es: Fany tiene 29 años, es soltera y vive sola. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas en su pequeña tienda que implementó hace 6 años. Fany siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora y todos los esfuerzos que ella hace son para forjarse un mejor porvenir, pensando en conformar una familia más adelante. La venta es muy buena, ya que con su carisma se gana a la clientela, logrando que regresen a su negocio. Fany no le encuentra dificultad a su trabajo, más todo lo contrario, se siente muy feliz realizándolo. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas para incrementar sus ingresos económicos y así realizar todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Fany is 29 years old, single, and lives alone. She dedicates herself to selling sodas in her small store which she started six years ago. Fany has always been a very hard-working woman, and all the efforts she puts forth are so she can forge a better future for herself, with thoughts of starting a family going forward. Sales are very good, since her charisma attracts customers who help her business to grow. Fany doesn’t have any difficulties with her work, on the contrary, she feels very happy realizing it. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual with her payments. She will use the requested funds to purchase a greater quantity of beverages to increase her income and in that way make her goals a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more beverages to sell.

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
N. is 27 years old and runs a laundry service in Pursat Province. She started the business in 2004 and currently can earn around US$ 3 per day. She is married to Ra, 30, who is a construction worker. He can carve marble and wood statues beside construction work. The couple has one son, who is a teenager and attends school.

Because marble carving is one good source of extra income for the family, N. would like to ask for a loan for her husband to purchase marble and wood to carve for sale. Her husband is in the photo because she was not available for photographing.

loans.use: to purchase marble and wood to carve for sale

loans.name: Timinandia (Persévérance) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Timinandia au nombre de cinq (05) ont en moyenne 27 ans et 3 enfants. Elles sont toutes mariées  et vivent dans des familles monogamiques dans le village de Sebougou  préfecture de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage et sont tous membres  de l’association traditionnelle d’entraide de l’ethnie bobo de Sebougou. Le besoin d’entre prendre des activités génératrices de revenus les a amené à chercher un appui ; Ainsi, elles ont été informées par l’association Djamadjigui de Sebougou sur les activités que mène Soro Yiriwaso avec les femmes. Elles intégrèrent de cette façon le programme du crédit l’institution avec qui elles sont à leur 1ier  prêt pour un montant de 250 000FCFA. Ce montant sera utilisé pour acheter 25  chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 20 cartons de savon de marque hypo et un sac de savon à fabrication locale >. Elles sont ravitaillées en bois de chauffe permanemment à domicile par les exploitants et en  savon lors des jours de foires hebdomadaires de la ville de Ségou. Le bois de chauffe est fendu en morceaux et est vendu en tas à domicile au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Quant au savon il est vendu par morceau de porte en porte dans le quartier au comptant et parfois à crédit payable quotidiennement.
Elles  envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 66 670FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  rembourser les intérêts du prêt, épargner et acheter des trousseaux de mariage pour leurs enfants. Leur objectif est d’avoir une charrette et un âne qui leur permettra de générer plus de ressources.
texts.en:
The members of the group Timinandia are five in number and average 27 years of age and three children. They are all married women and live in monogamous families in the village of Sebougou, Ségou prefecture (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of marriage and community and are all members of the traditional mutual aid association of the Bobo ethnicity of Sebougou. The need to work to earn an income has brought them to seek support; and so, they were informed by the Djamadjigui association of Sebougou regarding the work that Soro Yiriwaso is doing with women. In this way, the women joined its loan program and are now on their first loan in the amount of 250,000 francs CFA. This money will be used to buy 25 cart loads of firewood, 20 boxes of Hypo brand soap, and a sack of locally-made soap. Supplies of firewood are continually gotten at home from producers; and the soap is gotten at the weekly fairs in the city of Ségou. The firewood is split into pieces and sold in piles at home, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed for the most part of women. As for the soap, it is sold by the piece door-to-door in the district, for cash and sometimes on credit payable the same day.

The group members envision realizing an average monthly profit of 66,670 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, to save some money, and to buy wedding items and accessories for their children. Their objective is to have a cart and donkey that will enable them to generate more resources.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and soap

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila got married at an early age. Although her husband has a stable job she is not relying solely on her husband's salary since the payroll is always delayed and the take-home pay could not fully support their basic needs. So she looked for other means to earn an income to help her husband meet their day-to-day needs. When she heard of HSPFI offering loans to their community, she immediately applied and availed a loan amounting to PHP5000 to finance her ala carte food business (grilled meat either pork, chicken and beef). Laila was happy with the loan she got from HSPFI because she was able to earn and help her husband in raising their child. As the sales of her ala carte food business grew she needs a loan amounting to PHP8,000 to buy additional stocks and food containers to preserve the meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase container to store raw meat  for her foodstall

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Huyền năm nay 41 tuổi.Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2002. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu và chăn nuôi. Sau 7 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương với việc sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả và được vay mức vốn lớn dần hiện tại  gia điìn chị đã  đầu tư  mở được một xưởng đúc đồng nhỏ với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ  để đầu tư mua nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Duong Thi H. is 41 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2002. Initially, she borrowed money for scrap material collection and livestock raising. After 7 years of participation to the Fund, with the effective use of the loans and the increase in credit limit, her family has set up a small bronze casting workshop with an income of VND 4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 10,000,000 to buy more materials for the family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for bronze casting business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. is a 40 year-old mother of seven. Her husband is a farmer. Her eldest daughter Ma. Rosemarie stopped schooling after graduating from her secondary education. Her second daughter Kristine, and third son Eduardo, are already in secondary school. Mea Vita and Sharmie Zandra are in elementary grades while Verna Cattlia and Edmer still need to be fed. The couple's income is not enough to sustain the basic needs of the family.

Myrna heard about ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), who provide loans to the poor, from her friend. She was motivated to join and she got capital to start a business. She applied for a loan to buy assorted foods for her variety store. She hopes that, with her new venture, she can save enough money to support the needs of her seven children. She dreams of expanding her store in the future through the able support of her husband.

She is very grateful to the lenders who will support them in achieving their dreams.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for her variety store

loans.name: Mafia Group

texts.en:
Fatuma M., age 40, is married with children.  She has a tailoring business which she started some years ago.  She works daily from 8am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $274. 

This will be Fatuma’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants to increase her tailoring business by buying two more sewing machines.
	
Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Mafia, which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma is third from left, second row, in white dress and white head covering.

loans.use: To purchase two more sewing machines

loans.name: Nasibahon

texts.ru: Худойкулова Насибахон- женщина 28 лет. Замужем мать имеет одного ребенка. Занимается переработкой пряжи и вязанием шерстенных носков. Она имеет 3-х летный стаж. По специальности Насибахон- швея . Она принимает заказы шьет национальные платья. На полученный займ она хочет купить пряжу. Муж Насибахона работает колхозником. В сезон сбора хлопка она выходит на сбор и подрабатывает таким образом.
texts.en:
Nasibahon H. is a 28 year old woman. She is married and a mother of one child. She processes wool and makes wool socks. She has three years of experience. Her profession is a seamstress. She takes orders and makes national dresses. She wants to use the loan to buy wool. Nasibahon's husband works as a farmer. During the cotton collection season she goes out to collect it and makes additional income this way.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of wool and socks

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.es: Cheryl tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, y tienen un pequeño hijo que ya va al colegio. La casa donde están viviendo por el momento, es de su suegra. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de “juanes”, platillo típico de la selva peruana, hecho a base de carne de pollo, arroz, aceitunas y huevo, envueltos en una hoja especial. Este platillo lo vende en la parte de afuera de un aserradero, donde sus principales consumidores son las personas que trabajan allí. Para esta labor, Cheryl cuenta con el apoyo de su suegra, y le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se relaciona con todo tipo de personas, y sobre todo, porque le es muy rentable, ya que todas las porciones que hace, se venden fácilmente. Para más adelante, Cheryl quiere alquilar un local e instalar un restaurante que se especialice sólo en platos regionales, como el juane. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque sus compañeros y compañeras son solidarios y muy responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará los ingredientes e insumos necesarios para incrementar su producción y venta de juanes.
texts.en:
25-year old Cheryl lives with her husband who works in transportation. They have a small son who attends school. The house they live in at the moment belongs to Cheryl’s mother-in-law. For the last two years Cheryl has been selling ‘juanes’, a dish traditionally eaten in the Peruvian rainforest. It’s made from chicken, rice, olives, and eggs and wrapped in a special leaf. She sells the juanes outside a sawmill so the majority of her customers are the people who work there. Her mother-in-law also helps with the work. Cheryl enjoys her job because she gets to meet lots of people, and most importantly, because it’s a very profitable business—the juanes that she makes sell easily. In the future Cheryl wants to rent premises and open a restaurant specializing in local dishes like juanes. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner, MFP. She enjoys working with the group because her fellow members are supportive and reliable with their repayments. She will use the loan to buy the ingredients and supplies needed to increase production and sale of juanes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make juanes, a local delicacy

loans.name: Chhlorm's Group

texts.en:
This small loan has been requested by a group of four borrowers. Mrs. R., 28, has been selected to be the leader. She is a local vendor, selling a few grocery items out of her home and earning an average of $2.50 profit a day. She is married with four children who are still young and under her care. Her husband works in construction. 
R. is a fantastic woman who has been managing her investment well and bringing in a lot of income. She will be using this loan to grow her business by buying additional groceries to sell. 
The other borrowers are:
L., who will use the loan to repair her old house.
S., who will use this loan to build a restroom for her family's hygiene.
P., a motor taxi driver, who is asking for a loan to repair his broken motor.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Exilda

texts.es: La señora Exilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años, 02 hijos que son Independientes.Exilda, es una mujer que a su edad, se siente capaz de seguir a delante y trabajar hasta donde Dios le de fuerzas, se siente muy bien con lo que hace, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad y sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Nos cuenta que se inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras en su misma casa y se dio cuenta que no vendía mucho; así que decidió implementar su negocio en el mercado. Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con lo que hace, también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden al Mercado a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita, para preparar sus comidas y refrescos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa, que día a día, regala a sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, desea invertirlo comprando sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. Exilda, se siente una mujer luchadora, y contenta por haber cumplido algunas metas que tenia trazada en su vida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Exilda belongs to the Siempre Unidas (United Forever) Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 47 years of age, married and has two children who are no longer dependent on her. Exilda is a woman who at her age feels able to keep going and working for as long as God gives her the strength. She feels good about what she does, which is selling fruits and vegetables in the Central Market of the City. Her sales are going very well since she is well known by her customers. Exilda says that she began selling fruits and vegetables in her own house but she realized that she wasn't selling very much. So she decided to open her business in the market. She still has the same business and is very satisfied with how it's going. She also has the support of her children. She now has a loyal clientele who come to shop every day in the market, where they have everything the the lady of the house needs to prepare meals and refreshments. She personally takes care of them with the smile which she gives her customers day after day. This loan of 1,500 Sols will be used to buy sacks of oranges, mandarins, lemons, citrons, taperibá (Fruit of the Tapir, or Hog Plum; a close relative of the mango) and all different varieties of fruit to provide better service to her customers so that they will find what they need. Exilda seems to be a hardworking woman who is pleased with having reached the goals that she has set for herself in life. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to set up her business and also helping many other women who want to develop themselves personally as well as in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna M. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao Camiguin. Lorna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting, harvesting, and selling green bananas. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 55 años D. edad, estado civil casada y madre D. 6 hijos, solo uno esta con ella. Juana estudió primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en centro poblado D.  Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 02 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que lo utilizó como capital para la elaboración D. sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir cabuya en Desaguadero luego fabrica sogas que los venD. en las ferias D. ganadería.

Su deseo es comprarse  chanchos para engorD. y dedicarse a ese negoico que genera mayores ingresos.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the community bank “Chijuyo Copapujo”, located in the village of Chijuyo Copapujo, district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children, only one of which lives with her. Juana studied in school until 2nd graD., and lives in the village of Chijuyo Copapujo.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 2 years. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used for the production of ropes. Currently, she requires an additional loan, which she is requesting for the sum of 500 soles. With this amount, she will purchase cabuya (a natural fiber used to make ropes) in Desaguadero. Then she will make ropes, which she will sell in the cattle markets. Her wish is to buy herself pigs in order to fatten them and sell them in order to generate higher income. She likes the easiness of the loans, and saving.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cabuya (material to make ropes).

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira sells plastic rubber and baby things; she has been in the business for a long time now and she is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more plastic rubber and baby things to sells. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic rubber and baby things

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: La señora MARIA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “señor cautivo II”, Distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es casada, tiene 55 años, tiene 02 hijas,  a su cargo y en etapa de estudios.Es una mujer luchadora y con una capacidad innata para los negocios, las dificultades económicas en el hogar le motivaron a buscar alternativas de trabajo para mejorar la situación económica en casa y gracias al apoyo de su esposo y su  facilidad de desempeñarse en este tipo de trabajo, le ayudo a iniciarse en la venta de abarrotes, ella empezó vendiendo condimentos y con el pequeño capital que consiguió, instalo su tienda, la cual cada día esta mas surtida y mas grande y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad tiene una clientela fija, que le compran de manera constante, ella brinda una buena atención y  trata con amabilidad a sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/.  700.00, comprará un exhibidor para poner las golosinas y artículos pequeños, además arroz, azúcar en saco, aceites grandes y pequeños y gaseosas de diversos tamaños y sabores, también verduras que le sale del diario,  quiere tener surtido y bien presentable su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes para que ellos encuentren lo que necesiten y sientan que son bien atendidos. MARIA, se siente con mucha energía y ganas  de seguir trabajando, y  aportando en su hogar, esta muy contenta, con la labor y el apoyo que le brinda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y seguir creciendo como personas.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth D. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old and married with one school-age child. To make a living, Maribeth sells personal home products like soap and bathroom cleanser in her  community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $87 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba E. is currently in the business of selling local sudanese bread cooked by frying in the cooking oil and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.  Aba is 43 years old and is Widowed.   She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees of her children and provide them with necessary scholarstic materials like uniforms, books, pens etc.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Lornn Nuon  Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Lornn N. is the group leader of four members who all live in Daeum Rues village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a seller in the local school, selling cakes and sugar juice. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing a variety of cakes and sugar canes to resell and earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Eh Chiv An, is employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Kim Lornn N. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to either work or study.

loans.use: To buy various cakes and sugar canes to resell and earn more income.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night S. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use. Night is 28 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to use.

loans.name: Aïssa

texts.fr: Madame Aissa M. est une monitrice dans une garderie d'enfant ,elle est âgée de 48 ans et mariée .Pour arrondir sa mensualité elle exerce une activité de vente de produits cosmétiques et de parfumerie.Le but du prêt consiste en l'acquisition de nouvelles gammes très convoitées pour le revendre dans les maisons en faisant du porte à porte. ainsi elle pourra arrondir ses revenus et aider son mari dans la ration familiale
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïssa M. is a monitor in a day-care center. She is 48 years old and married. To supplement her monthly income, she sells cosmetics and perfume. She will use her loan to purchase whole ranges of new products which are in high demand. She will sell them hawking from house to house. Thus she can supplement her income and help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 52 years old. Francisco is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Francisco owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Francisco has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Francisco joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Francisco from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Estela Ofelia

texts.en:
Estela Ofelia M. M. sells fruit in the Mayoreo market in Managua. She initially started the business using personal savings and has been selling fruit from her stall for twenty years.

Estela is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more papaya and passion fruit.

Estela and her partner have four children living at home, only one of whom is school-aged.

Estela has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. In that time the loans have helped her maintain her inventory and expand her working capital, she said.

loans.use: To buy papayas and passion fruit to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali was been working as a contractor for the past 30 years. Working on a freelance basis, he manages projects in his town and the neighboring villages. He's 46 years old and married with five children. Four of his children are still unemployed so he works hard to take care of his family. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy wood to assure the quality of the construction of his projects.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Luafitu

texts.en:
Luafitu T. is 40 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, making clothing.  Luafitu has 4 years of experience in this business.  Luafitu needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & threads.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 1000 talas or US $417 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of sewing lavalavas and puletesis, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at: http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SewingLavalavasAndPuletesi#

In 2007, Luafitu joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Luafitu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Luafitu T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & threads

loans.name: Uzoma

texts.en:
Uzoma is 27 years old and the mother of two. She lives with her family in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Uzoma sells crayfish and palm oil. Crayfish is a seafood that is used in cooking and palm oil is also used for cooking. Before now she sold cooked food by way of hawking from place to place but this was really stressful to her and earned little profit.

Uzoma joined LAPO micro-finance and changed her line of business to this present trade. Her greatest joy is that she can help her husband, who is also a trader, in providing the children’s needs.

Uzoma is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more crayfish and palm oil in large quantity to sell. This, she said, will enable her to meet the demand of customers. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO micro-finance.

loans.use: To purchase more crayfish and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Igbinosun

texts.en: Igbinosun has a farm where he plants cassava, yams and plantains. He is a hard-working man. He loves his farming business and he hopes to excel in his business. He has been in this farming business for a long time. He needs the loan amount of NGN 60,000 to hire laborers to clear his farm. He is 42 years old, married with 4 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to hire laborers to clear his farm

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is an individual loan client, and her story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally. She lives in a rural, agricultural area near El Seibo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Ramona is excited to be taking her third loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a "colmado" or small general store by purchasing rice, sugar, coffee, sauces, fish and pasta to stock the store. She will use the profits to invest in her home and to save to replace the roof. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Martin Felix

texts.es:
MARTIN TIENE 31 AÑOS Y ES UNA PERSONA BASTANTE RESPONSABLE Y CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN. 
CUENTA CON UN AUTOMOVIL QUE ALQUILA PARA LA RUTA DE MANCO CAPAC- SANTA BARBARA – ICA. 
DICHA UNIDAD LA ADQUIRIO CON SUS AHORROS, YA QUE TAMBIEN TRABAJA COMO VIGILANTE DESDE 
HACE MAS DE 10  AÑOS, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA CON SU CONYUGE Y DOS MENORES HIJOS. REQUIERE EL CRÉDITO PARA REGULARIZAR DOCUMENTACION DE AFILIACION A UNA EMPRESA DE COLECTIVOS DE LA ZONA. SU ESPOSA SE 
DEDICA A LAS LABORES DE SU HOGAR Y AL CUIDADO DE SUS DOS MENORES HIJOS. ELLOS SON PERSONAS MUY AMABLES   
Y  CORDIALES, QUE DESEAN BRINDAR BUENA EDUCACIÒN A SUS HIJOS Y UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA, POR LO QUE HAN 
INCREMENTADO SU FUENTE DE TRABAJO.
texts.en:
Martin is 31 years old. He is quite responsible and wants to improve his situation. He owns a car that he rents out as part of a taxi service for the route from Manco Capac to Santa Barbara and Ica. He bought this vehicle with his savings, as he has also worked for ten years as a security guard. Martin lives in his own home with his wife and their two youngest children. He needs the loan to formalize the paperwork to join a collective taxi company in his area. His wife works at home and cares for the two children. Both Martin and his wife are very friendly people who want to offer their children a good education and a better quality of life. This is why they have found ways to supplement their work income.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Documentation to join a collective taxi company

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock more alcoholic brands in her pub

loans.name: 03.1.6 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
"Nang T. T. (28) is a 48 year old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Nang is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03.1.6 Nam Ngan (02.03.1.6 Nam Ngan).


Nang is married and has 4 adult aged children.  To making a living, Nang owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Nang has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Nang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nang has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Mui (L. T.) is a 56 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising crops.

2.  Hanh (N. T.) is a 54 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3.  Loan (N. T.) is a 27 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a manufacturing business.

4.  Thao (P. T.) is a 68 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To support her business selling food products

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia de 40 años que vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el sector Luis Alva Castro del distrito de Paiján, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la fabricación y distribución de pan, cuenta con un horno artesanal instalado en su domicilio, allí prepara su pan y luego lo distribuye en el distrito donde vive, en los caseríos aledaños y en el cercano distrito de Puerto Malabrigo. El ha sabido ganarse un lugar en el mercado y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fiel. Como esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingresos Segundo trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantener su negocio de la mejor manera posible.

Segundo desea comprar mas insumos como harina, azúcar y leña para preparar mas pan e incrementar sus ventas, esta acción le generará mas ganancias con las cuales pueda entregarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Segundo es alguien bastante trabajador y con muchas ganas de superación. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 40-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the Luis Alva Castro sector of the Paijan district, a zone belonging to the Ascope province in the La Libertad region, two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than ten years he has baked and sold bread. He has a traditional oven in his home where he prepares his bread and later distributes it in the zone where he lives, in the surrounding villages and the nearby district of Puerto Malabrigo. He managed to gain a spot in the market and now has a loyal customer base. Since this activity is his only source of income, Segundo is trying to give it his best in order to make it the best possible. Segundo wants to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar and firewood to prepare more bread and increase his sales. This will generate him more income with which he can offer his family a better quality of life. In order to achieve his goal he has found it necessary to request a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alterniva. Segundo is a very hard-working person with a great desire to succeed. He has worked previously with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for bread baking

loans.name: Sandra Alina

texts.es:
Sandra pertenece al Banco Comunal Buena Suerte hace 15 años, lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y las reuniones amenas, es casada y tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando, uno en la universidad y la otra en el colegio.
Sandra vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas en mayor proporción son al crédito. Además Sandra realiza trabajos manuales de corospum, que sirven para la decoración de salones, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos en su casa. También Sandra trabaja en el nido que tiene su familia.
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que invertirá en la compra de corospum y pegamento.
Los sueños de Sandra son que su hijo viaje de promoción e ingrese a la universidad.
texts.en:
Sandra has belonged to the Good Luck Communal Bank for 15 years. What she enjoys most are the enjoyable trainings and meetings. She is married and has 2 children that are in school, one in university and the other in high school.

Sandra sells makeup by catalogue to her friends and family, most of her sales are on credit. She also does crafts with plastic foam that help to decorate halls, something that she does with the help of her children at home. Sandra also works in the nursery that her family has.

Sandra needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be used to buy plastic foam and glue.

Sandra’s dreams are that her son travel and go to university.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic foam and glue.

loans.name: Sam Art's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of six people who live in Lekh Bei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sam Art K. is the group leader, selected by the other members. Each group member will use his or her portion of the loan for a different purpose.
Mrs. Sam Art K. was born in 1965. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family while her husband, Mr. Sokun Sok, is employed in a private company and earns a low salary to support his family. They support four children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other attends a local school. Although they all try to work hard, they do not earn sufficient income. So to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Sam Art K. is seeking a loan to buy some groceries for resale to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy some groceries for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Grace has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Grace is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be her second from HSPFI.  Grace plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

-----------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She wants to expand and progress her business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida L. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old and is married with two adult children. Nida owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Nida plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Don Felix Pedro M. es un señor emprendedor que se dedica la venta de peroles, ollas, caserolas, freideras, tiene su puesto en el mercado de chlouteca desde hace 12 años.
Felix es padre de 4 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en una escuela publica.
Felix se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir a su puesto en el mercado de Choluteca para vender sus productos.
junto con su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia. 
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar a la iglesia de su comunidad.  
el prestamo lo nesecita para comprar mas utencilios de cocina y asi incrementar sus ventas para tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Pedro Martínez is an enterprising man who sells casseroles, pots and pans. His stand has been in Choluteca’s market for 12 years. Félix has 4 children who go to public school. He gets up at 4am to go to his stand in the Choluteca market to sell his products. Together with his wife he works hard for his family’s wellbeing. He spends his free time visiting his community’s church. He needs the loan to buy more kitchen utensils to increase sales and have better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy casseroles, pots and frying pans.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 35-year-old married woman and mother. S. and her husband have always earned a living by growing crops on their own farmland next to their house. This couple have two young kids who are employed. As S.’s cow is getting old, she can't use the cow to plow her land. Because of that, S. would like to purchase a new cow but she has no enough money to buy one. Therefore, S. requests a loan to make that possible.

loans.use: To purchase a new cow.

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en: Edna A. is from the village of Baybayog, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 41 years old. Edna is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Edna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Edna operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Edna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “The Pink Women” located in the district of Ilave, the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. She has an education up to the fourth year of secondary school. 

Juana has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN which she used to increase the capital of her business fattening livestock such as bulls, sheep, and pigs. 

Juana is asking for a loan of 500 PEN to purchase of young livestock for fattening. Her dream is to continue her business and to have a tractor for agriculture. Juana’s favorite thing about working with Manuela Ramos is sharing happiness among bank members.

loans.use: To buy livestock for fattening

loans.name: Jesmen

texts.en:
Jesmen S. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 27 years old. Jesmen is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Jesmen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Jesmen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jesmen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products sell. Jesmen is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jesmen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en:
Hadidja is 28 years old and married, and she has 2 children who are 7 and 3 years old. Hadidja is known as a proven entrepreneur who sells charcoal wholesale and retail. This is her 10th successful year in this business which she runs from 6 am to 8 pm every day.  Hadidja is pictured here with her sacks of charcoal, which have been stuffed and then covered with eucalyptus leaves, ready for sale.

Hadidja has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company to expand her business by creating many sources of income from the same charcoal business, and to provide jobs to the people of her community. With this loan, Hadidja hopes that her revenue will increase so she can save for her future and do her best for her children.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald M. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Ronald has a garment shop, which he has run for less than a year.
To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 1,800,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Ronald hopes to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. In the future, Ronald hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Yann

texts.en:
Yann Y., 50, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own farmland for many years. In addition, she raises a few pigs in a stall at her home.

She is married to Chouk Heang, age 51, who assists her in the business. Yann Y. and her young kid are pictured in the photograph. This couple has seven children, all of whom are single. Two of them are working in the construction field, earning an income of approximately $50 per month. 

To improve her livestock, Yann Y. is taking out a loan to purchase a small pig to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a small pig to raise

loans.name: Meng's Group

texts.en:
In Kampong Svay village, in the province of Kandal, there are seventeen members making a village bank loan. Mr. Meng S. is 45 years old, and he is the village bank president selected by its members. Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living standards.

Mr. Meng S. and his wife, Mrs. Chheng Siebly, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice for a living. For their farm, Mr. Meng S. would like to ask for a loan to buy farming supplies for cultivating rice. He wants to use the rest of the loan to support his fishing. Aside from farming, they also earn their living through fishing. 

This couple works hard with their carriers to support their six children, two of whom are fisherman while the others are students who help their parents with their businesses.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for cultivating rice

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata O. O. is fifty-two years old and married.  Her husband works for National Social Security Fund.  They have six children, aged between twenty-five and sixteen. She owns a second hand clothes business where she also sells curtains and bedsheets. Her business is located at the busy Kibuye market in Kisumu.

Consolata has been in business for seven years. Her business is profitable, but her major challenge is the high cost of operation in terms of money needed to move to and from the market. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Consolata plans to use her loan of 80,000 KES to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She sees herself owning a wholesale clothes shop in the future. She describes herself as very resilient and God fearing.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, es taxista, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa, aun no tienen hijos.
Él inicio como taxista hace 5 años, compro su propio vehículo y desde entonces labora al servicio de los clientes, con un horario de 5:00am a 7:00pm, actualmente su taxi presenta problemas por lo que él necesita darle mantenimiento y solicita un préstamo para poder realizarlo, con la reparación que se deba hacer al taxi, Rigoberto estará más seguro cuando deba trasladar clientes, además de ofrecer un mejor servicio y la salvedad de que pueda ocurrir un incidente.
Para Rigoberto su fuente de empleo es el taxi por lo que también su objetivo es mantenerlo en las mejores condiciones, ya que de su trabajo mantiene a su familia y cubre los gastos mensuales.
texts.en:
Rigoberto lives in the city of San Miguel; he’s a taxi driver.   He’s 28 years old and lives with his wife; they do not have children yet.

He started out as a taxi driver five years ago.  He bought his own vehicle and since then works providing service to customers on a 5am to 7pm schedule.  Currently his taxi is experiencing mechanical problems so he needs to provide maintenance and is asking for a loan to make the necessary repairs on his taxi.  Rigoberto will then feel more secure while transporting customers both for offering an improved service and for feeling safer from having an accident.

The taxi is Rigoberto’s source of income so his objective is to maintain it in the best possible working conditions since he supports his family and meets monthly expenses through this work.

loans.use: For taxi repairs and purchase of replacement parts.

loans.name: María  Laura

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores  y aves de corral, los cría en un corral situado posterior a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora en su domicilio desde hace tres años y lo ofrece a los vecinos de la zona.

El desea adquirir más animales porque ha aumentado su demanda y así percibir mayores ingresos, además desea comprar insumos para seguir preparando la chicha de jora que posteriormente le permitirá seguir con su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old, married, and lives together with her husband and two dependent children in Mochumí district, a relatively commercial agricultural area in Lambayeque province which is located more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

María's business is raising and selling small animals and poultry.  She raises her animals in a pen which is located behind her home.  She feeds them grains and natural pasture.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders who often visit her area.  María also prepares and sells 'chicha de jora' (a corn-based drink) from her home.  She has been doing this for three years, selling to her neighbors.

María would like to acquire more animals because demand has risen.  In this way, she hopes to make more profits.  She would also like to buy supplies so that she can continue preparing her 'chicha de jora'.  This will allow her to continue in her business.  She has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy more animals

loans.name: Salmi

texts.es:
La Sra. Salmi tiene 43 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, esta actividad lo viene realizando desde hace más de 10 años, la compra lo realiza en el mercado de Abasto desde las 4 de la mañana y a las 7 le espera a su hijo en la parada de bus para luego ir a vender los productos en los negocios de su Barrio (Mariano Roque Alonso).
Utilizaría el crédito para poner rejas en su casa pues le falta poco para terminar y luego para la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras en general.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Salmi is 43 years old.  For more than 10 years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables, which she buys at the Abasto market from 4 am.  At 7 am, she takes her son to the bus stop and then goes to sell her products in the businesses of her neighborhood (Mariano Roque Alonso).

She will use the loan to buy grilles for the house, which is almost finished, as well as to buy a larger amount of fruit and vegetables.  She thanks microfinance partner Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity.

loans.use: to improve her home and to raise capital to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van V. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Van sells groceries, earning an income of USD 9 per day. Her husband is an electronics repairman, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Van is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a thirty-four-year-old single mother with three children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the children and her family dream is to educate them and also build a permanent house for residence.

Six years ago, Claire separated from her husband and she realised that she could not raise children without a stable income, so she decided to trade in used shoes. The venture has facilitated her in providing the basics to her family. Her initial capital was 400,000 but she has now accumulated up to 3,400,000 shillings in working capital. She has challenges of irregular sales and delayed payment of her debtors and her dream is to own a boutique. Claire needs the loan facility to buy shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino tiene 45 años D. edad. Vive en casa propia con su esposa en L. parte rural del caserío San Bernardino ubicado cerca el distrito D. Túcume en el norte D. Perú. Se dedica a L. agricultura, específicamente el cultivo D. payar. Después D. cosechar su producto, lo comercializa en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado granD. con mucho movimiento comercial. Solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo D. payar. Esta inversión lo ayudará cosechar un mejor producto que podrá vender a un mejor precio. Con sus ingresos, Faustino pueD. seguir solventado sus gastos familiares y cuidando a su esposa.
texts.en: Faustino is 45 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife in the rural area of San Bernardino, a hamlet located in the Túcume district, in the north of Peru. He engages in agriculture, specifically in growing beans. After harvesting his product, he sells it in the Moshoqueque market, a big market with a lot of business. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers for his bean crops. This loan will help him in harvesting a better product which he will be able to sell at a better price. Thanks to his earnings, Faustino can continue paying for his family expenses and caring for his wife.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his bean crops

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, 5 of whom are in school.  Sauda  has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Sauda has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and cooking oil. She also generates additional income by selling bananas. 

The main business challenges for Sauda include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and to own her own house.  Sauda lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Huitzililla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Huitzililla se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Huitzililla, en México, está conformado por la señora Margarita va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos, galletas, cloro etc. Para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la señora Maribel va a compra zapatos de dama, caballero y niños para surtir sus pedidos, el joven Santiago va a comprar Refrescos y la señora Juana va a comprar  ingredientes para preparar pasta de mole rojo.  

La señora Juana tiene 35 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos Elizabeth tiene 16 años de edad ya no estudia le ayuda a su mamá en la casa, Luis Damián tiene 14 años de edad estudia la secundaria, Analitzi tiene 10 años de edad estudia la primaria, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar los ingredientes para preparar la pasta de mole rojo va a comprar chile ancho, mulato, pasilla, guajillo, ajonjolí, cacahuate, almendra, pasas, semilla, cominos, pimienta, clavos, chocolate, aceite, plátanos etc. Ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años, como prepara muy sabroso el mole rojo su tía le dijo que vendiera pasta de mole y le prestó dinero para comprar los ingredientes, es así como ella y su hija salen a vender por las calles de Huitzililla su pasta de mole con las señoras ama de casa, a ella también la contratan en las fiestas para preparar el mole es por eso que le gusta tener en existencia los insumos para preparar el mole rojo. 

Este negocio es importante porque le ha ayudado a su familia cuando más lo necesita con los gastos de la escuela, las inscripciones, los uniformes, también puede cubrir los gastos de su casa como la luz, el gas y la comida. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que le valla mejor en la familia y en el negocio y a sus hijos dejarles algo y enseñarles como tener su propio negocio. 

Huitzililla es un pueblo donde siembran sorgo, maíz, cebolla, celebran el 21 de diciembre a Santo Tomas hay misas, procesión, primeras comuniones, toros. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por la confianza que nos dan que aunque ganamos poco somos personas que si nos gusta pagar y que sigan teniendo confianza para seguir ayudando a más personas que lo necesitan”.
texts.en:
This community bank is called Huitzililla.  It is located in the community of Huitzililla, in Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  The group's members are: Margarita, who will use her loan to buy soft drinks, cookies, bleach, etc. with which to stock her grocery store; Maribel, who will buy men's, ladies' and children's shoes to fill some orders; young Santiago, who will buy soft drinks and Juana, who will buy ingredients for making red 'mole' chili paste.

Juana is 35 years old.  She has a common-law marriage and three children: 16 year-old Elizabeth who no longer attends school but helps her mom around the house; 14 year-old Luis Damián who is in high school, and 10 year-old Analitzi who is in elementary school.  Juana requested her loan to buy ingredients for making red 'mole' chili paste.  She will buy dried Poblano chilis, Mulato chilis, Pasilla chilis, Guajillo chilis, sesame seeds, peanuts, almonds, raisins, seeds, cumin, pepper, cloves, chocolate, oil, plantains, etc.  She started her business three years ago.  As she makes very tasty red 'mole' chili sauce, her aunt said that she should sell red 'mole' paste and loaned her the money to buy ingredients.  Juana and her daughter go out to sell their 'mole' paste to local housewives.  People also hire her for parties so that she can prepare their 'mole' sauce.  For this reason, she likes to have in stock the supplies she needs to prepare her red 'mole' paste.

Juana's business is important because it has helped her family, when they have most needed it, in covering school expenses, registration fees and uniforms.  It has also helped to cover household expenses such as electricity, gas and food bills.  Juana's dreams and hopes are for her family and her business to do better and for her to be able to leave her children something and teach them how to run their own business.

Huitzililla is a village where people grow sorghum, corn and onions.  They celebrate San Tomas on December 21st each year and there are masses, processions, first communions and bullfighting.  The group's members would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "thank you for the trust that you have placed in us.  Although we are people who don't earn much, we are also people who like to pay back our debts.  We hope that you continue trusting and continue helping more people who need it".

loans.use: to buy dried Poblano chilis, Mulato chilis, Pasilla chilis, Guajillo chilis, sesame seeds, peanuts, almonds, raisins, seeds, cumin, pepper, cloves, oil, chocolate and plantains to make red mole chili paste.

loans.name: Rakiyatou

texts.fr: Le premier crédit que Mme Rakiyatou  sollicite lui servira à acheter des bijoux au BENIN (pays voisin). Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et ils ont 01 enfant en charge. Depuis 2004 elle se donne à cette activité en faisant sa vente à domicile. Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à son enfant et aider son mari  et avoir sa propre boutique pour installer ses marchandises.
texts.en:
This is the first loan that Madame Rakiyatou is seeking, and it will serve to buy jewelry in Benin (a neighboring country). She is married to a driver, and they support one child. 

She has been in this business since 2004, selling from her home. She wants to ensure a bright future for her child, help her husband, and have her own shop to set up her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is a 32-year-old single mother who lives with her daughter and mother in a small house in the outer ger (Mongolian yurt) districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her mother stays at home while her daughter attends public secondary school.
Odgerel started a business in 2006, at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, selling underwear and slippers, with 750,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) of working capital. Since then, her business has expanded and her current working capital has increased to 1,080,000 MNT.

With her business earnings, Odgerel started building a new small house as the old house is damaged and close to collapse. She bought cement, sand and other necessary materials with 3,500,000 MNT.  Odgerel is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more necessary building materials such as, windows, doors etc., to finish her housing project before the end of this summer. Ogderel is a high-motivated and responsible woman who wants to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to finish the the building of her house

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan comes from the village of Kekhijvari, Khashuri District.  He is 52 years old and lives with his wife, Elene, and two daughters (22 and 21 years old). 
Levan works as a car mechanic in the village. He is master of engines. Along with this job, he is actively involved in family farming. The family has 2 milk cows whose milk is used for cheese production. Approximately 50 kg of cheese is sold at the local market. Also, the family has 1.6 hectares of land where they grow tomatoes, haricot beans, garlic, cherries, strawberries, corn and nuts. Levan and Elene sell the harvested products in Khashuri and neighboring districts’ open markets. Total average monthly income of the family is approximately 700 Laris.  

With the requested loan, Levan plans to purchase 7 piglets and pig feed.  He will raise and sell them in the fall for a higher price. He has some experience in pig farming, as in the past the family ran a pig farm. 

From the additional profit, Levan and Elene plan to renovate their house, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seven piglets

loans.name: Yeri Dios Proveera Group

texts.en:
Lidia Amparo is a member of the "Yeri Dios Proveerá" Group. She is 50 years old, married and has 8 children. She lives in the Guamilies community. She has been selling clothing in part of her home for the last 14 years. Her advantage is that she stays in her home all day, so that she can work with clients at any hour. She learned the work as a young child, married young and needed to help her husband with family expenses. 

She needs this loan to buy a load of new clothing.
