Her economic stability has changed drastically since she began receiving loans from FAMA, even though right now sales are down, along with her income. She hopes that the situation will improve because the the price of basic products is rising and she needs to be able to afford them.

Her goal is to teach her children to be honest workers, since it is the best inheritance she can leave them. Lidia has taken more than 40 loans with FAMA and belongs to one of the first solidarity groups ever formed.

Translated from Spanish:

Lidia Amparo, es miembro del Grupo Yeri Dios Proveerá, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 8 hijos, y reside en la Comunidad de Guamiles. Desde hace 14 años trabaja vendiendo ropa en una parte de su casa, su ventaja es que permanece todo el día en su hogar y puede atender a su clientela a cualquier hora. Aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven, ya que se casó a temprana edad y necesitaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar un fardo de ropa nueva. La vida económica de Lidia ha cambiado grandemente desde que recibe el apoyo de los préstamos de FAMA, aunque en estos momentos las ventas han bajado bastante y sus ingresos también, ella espera que la situación mejore porque el precio de los productos de la canasta básica es elevado y necesita cubrirlos. Su meta es enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar de forma honesta, ya que es la mejor herencia que puede dejarles. Lidia tiene más de 40 ciclos de trabajar con FAMA y pertenece a uno de los primeros grupos solidarios conformados.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, tiene varios años de dedicarse al negocio, lo realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo varias calles ofreciendo la mercadería.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frutas como manzanas, sandia, jocotes, papayas y piñas, esta compra le ayudara para tener suficiente productos para continuar vendiendo y generando ganancias para su familia.
El sueño de Ana es que algún día pueda su propia vivienda, donde llevar a sus hijos para que crezcan cómodamente y tengan una vida digna.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and two children.  Her business is selling fruit and vegetables.  She has been in this business for several years and makes her sales as an itinerant vendor, walking through several streets selling her merchandise.  She is requesting a loan to buy fruit such as apples, watermelons, jocotes (hog plums), papayas and pineapples.  This purchase will help her to have enough products to continue making sales and making profits for her family.

Ana's dream is to some day be able to own her own home where her children can grow up comfortably and have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, watermelons, jocotes, papayas and pineapples

loans.name: Asiki

texts.en:
Asiki is 35 years old and married with three children and with no other dependents, living in a permanent house which he owns in Masindi, Uganda. His family goal is to start a business for his wife to add on to the family income and educate his children up to university. He deals in taxi transport and he has been in the business for 12 years. 

Asiki started by driving someone's taxi and later bought his own through loan borrowing. Hardships met in the business are bad roads that lead to break-downs and high fuel prices. In spite of these, he longs to own four taxis.

Asiki intends to use the loan facility to add on his savings and purchase a taxi.

loans.use: To  add on his savings  and purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: Таварали проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Таварали откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Tavarali lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 50 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Tavarali earns his living by breeding cattle.  He fattens up and sells livestock, and has been involved in this type of business for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of several calves.

loans.use: to purchase several calves

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru:
Толибджон умный, целеустремленный и добрый человек. Он женат и у них 6 детей. Так как у него очень большая семья ему необходимо было зарабатывать много денег, чтобы он мог обеспечить свою семью и содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Он много думал и решил, что выращивание сельскохозяйственных культур и скотоводство принесет ему хорошего дохода и более 30 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. В основном он выращивает ячмень для откорма своего скота. В настоящее время он имеет 3 голов коров и 20 голов барана. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и прибыль, который он планирует от данного бизнеса, он хочет, заплатить за учебу своего внука и внучки, кого он так сильно любить. Толибджон хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота и корм для них. Он заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поощрения.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Tolibjon is a smart, goal-oriented and kind person.  He is married and has six children.  Because he had such a large family, he needed to earn a lot of money in order to support his family and provide good living conditions for them.  He thought a lot and decided that growing agricultural crops and animal husbandry would earn him a good income, and he has now been involved in this business for over 30 years.  He primarily grows barley to feed his livestock.  Currently, he has three cows and twenty sheep.  He wants to expand his business and increase his profit, which he is planning to receive from this buisness, and wants to pay for his grandchildren, who he loves very much, to go to school.  Tolibjon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of livestock and livestock feed.  He thanks you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. 

Jerry has a barber shop that provides hair cutting. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the barber shop.

Jerry is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jerry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the barber shop.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.fr:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mwanajuma has operated a food café business for the past ten years, selling at the quarry site to miners in the area. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to become self reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, wheat flour, cooking fat oil and utensils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mwanajuma has operated a café business for the past ten years, selling at the quarry site to miners in the area. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to become self-reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, wheat flour, cooking fat and utensils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, rice, wheat flour, cooking fat and utensils.

loans.name: Futuro En Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Futuro en Desarrollo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. El coordinador es José Dolores de 38 años quien tiene un taller de ebanistería desde hace 8 años el cual inicio poco a poco ahora cuenta con 5 trabajadores. 
Él es casado tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años respectivamente. 
Los otros integrantes son Miguel de 46 años quien se dedica a la venta de leña desde hace 10 años y Martha Raquel de 22 años vende ropa desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The group “Futuro en Desarrollo” (Future in Development) consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals. The coordinator is José Dolores, age 38, who has a cabinetmaking workshop. He started this business eight years ago with very little and now he has five workers. José is married and has two children, ages 16 and 14 respectively.

The other members are Miguel, who is 46 years old and has been selling firewood for 10 years, and Martha Raquel, who is 22 years old and has been selling clothes for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the outstanding balance owed on his secondhand pickup.

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.ru:
Юлдузхон 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает  2-х  сыновей и дочку. Муж работает сварщиком.
7 лет тому назад, Юлдузхон решила заняться торговлей на центральном рынке г. Кызылкия, вложив  деньги в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS), заработанные тяжелым трудом в России, куда она с мужем  ездили на заработки. Сначала Юлдузхон пришлось нелегко, ей не хватало  средств и поэтому приходилось брать деньги в долг. Из-за такого положения дел, муж продолжал ездить на заработки, помогая Юлдузхон поставить бизнес на ноги.  
 На сегодняшний день, Юлдузхон активно работает и в настоящий момент имеет в обороте около 150,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Юлдузхон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на пополнение оборотных средств и расширение ассортимента товаров. Это также позволит Юлдузхон работать вместе  с мужем, избегая в будущем поездок на заработки.  Мечта Юлдузхон – расширить бизнес и построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Yulduzkhon is 35 years old, married and is raising two sons and a daughter.  Her husband works as a welder.  Yulduzkhon decided to become involved in retail sales at the local market seven years ago, after investing a sum of 25,000 som (KGS) - money that she earned through hard labor in Russia, where she and her husband used to travel for work.  Times were hard for Yulduzkhon at first because she did not have enough money and had to borrow it.  Due to this, her husband continued to travel for work, thus, helping Yulduzkhon to get her business off from the ground.  Today, Yulduzkhon actively works and currently has a revolving capital of about 150,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase her revolving capital and expand merchandise assortment.  This will also allow Yulduzkhon to work together with her husband and avoid future travels for work.  Yulduzkhon's dream is to expand her business and build a big house for her family.

loans.use: to broaden merchandise assortment and increase revolving capital

loans.name: Loukiatou

texts.fr:
Loukiatou est une femme de 35 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant. Elle 02 enfants.
Loukiatou prépare et commercialise des jus de fruits et du yaourt depuis 1996. Elle vend à toute personne dans son petit stand sis au premier étage du marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Loukiatou a requis son deuxième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter 02sacs de lait, 02sacs de riz, 01carton de Milo, 01 boîte d’arôme à la vanille. 
Dans les prochaines années, Loukiatou voudrait infiltrer d’autres points de vente et avoir une situation financière imposante.
texts.en:
Loukiatou is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a shopkeeper. She has two children. Loukiatou has been making and selling fruit juices and yogurt since 1996. She sells to everyone in her little stand located on the 1st floor of the Hédzranawoé market. She buys the products in Lomé. 

Loukiatou asked for her second loan with WAGES to buy 2 bags of milk, 2 bags of rice, 1 box of Milo, and 1 bottle of vanilla flavoring. 

In the next few years, Loukiatou would like to start selling in other locations and have an impressive financial status.

loans.use: to buy bags of milk, sugar, and flavoring

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is applying for another loan to start a new poultry selling business. She will use this 100,000 Kes loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her new poultry business. In the future, Pauline aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Pauline has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed for her new poultry business.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is 33 years old. She is a housewife and a mother to four children. 

Her husband Nashaat works in one of the Jordanian ministries, following specific working hour shifts. Sanaa and her husband work together in their small food products store, they also have a section in the store that sells cleaning products that are used in homes. 

Now Sanaa has applied for a loan to buy new products for the store to attract more customers in their area. 

Because Sanaa is a conservative person, her husband Nashaat has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy new products for the food store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and works hard to support her family. She buys and sells curtains in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now and earns additional income from her sari-sari (general) store as well.

Jocelyn has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more curtains, towels, etc. to sell to customers. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more curtains, towels, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael solicita el crédito para poder surtir su tienda de mercancías tanto de abarrotes, como comprar refrescos al mayoreo.
El señor lleva con su negocio aproximadamente 3 años, anteriormente tuvo una ferreteria pero la tuvo que cerrar porque ya no estab rindiendo lo suficiente pero como es un hombre muy emprenderor abrio un pequeño abarrotes el cual con el paso de los años ha ido creciendo y el deceo del señor ismael es que se vuelva mas grande; por lo cual este credito sera de mucha ayuda para que el pueda cumplir con este objetivo.
texts.en:
Ismael is requesting the loan in order to be able to stock his store with merchandise like groceries and soft drinks in bulk.  He has been in this business for approximately three years.  Previously he had a hardware shop, but he had to close it because it did not produce enough income.

However, as he is an enterprising man, he opened a small grocery store.  As the years pass it has been growing.  Isamael’s wish is for it to get bigger.  This loan will be of great help so that he will be able to meet his objective.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: For the past 5 years, Halima has been selling waakye (rice and beans cooked together), which she serves with egg, meat and  fish stew. She is single and so uses her income to pay her utility and accomodation bills. Halima will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare waakye to sell. Halima wants to use the new profit from this loan to save to continue her education.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, meat, fish and other ingredients

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with four children between the ages of 3 years and 12 years. He produces vegetables, groundnuts, hot pepper, and sugarcane, which he sells to the local market. He has been in farming for four years and currently employs two farmhands. He also operates a taxi business.

Micah has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the venture into dairy farming will provide the family with milk for their daily consumption as well as income for other family needs. He aspires to own a canter to transport other farmers' produce to the market for a fee. He says animal diseases remains a challenge to many farmers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abadahigwa Cb Group

texts.en: Laurence is a group leader, aged 45. She is married and has seven children between 24 and 5 years old. Four of them go to school. The group is called ABADAHIGWA and means "best performers" in English. She sells food stuffs and has been in a business for the past 26 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale

loans.name: Rita Dixi

texts.en:
Mi name is Rita F. and I buy ans ell new clothing. I sel a variety of clothing items for men and women. I have been doing this for four years. My son helps me sell the clothing. I am a single mother and am able to support my family with this business. My goal is to increase my inventory so I can have an increase in sales and profits that will allow me to improve my business location and pay for my son\\\'s education.

Loan Use: Purchase clothes and shoes for men and women

Mi nombre es Rita F. me dedico a la compra y venta de ropa nueva, vendo de todo tipo de ropa para damas y caballeros como ser camisas formales, camisetas, pantalones, jeans, blusas, faldas, shorts, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años y tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la venta de la ropa, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, ya que soy una madre soltera, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para poder tener mayores ventas y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio, mantener a mi familia y darle estudio a mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de Ropa para dama y caballero, zapatos para dama y caballero.

loans.name: Margerete

texts.en: Mama K. lives in Abokobi, Accra, Ghana and sells cassava and plantain. She buys from a farming community and transports to her community for sale. She lacks supporting capital to boost her sales. She is seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to enable her to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elmir

texts.en:
Elmir is an IDP from occupied Djebrail district of Azerbaijan. (IDP stands for Internally Displaced Person: Someone who has had to leave their home, but has not crossed an international border)

He fled to Baku in 1993, and started his business in 2000.

When he started his business, he borrowed two Normicro loans from the Baku branch totaling $1,000. Now he would like to borrow $1,000 for new equipment.

loans.use: To buy some new equipment for his shop

loans.name: Vilma Aracely

texts.es:
Vilma Araceli M. lives in the village of Cajobal, Patzún, Chimaltenango. She is married and has three small children. Her husband works in another town as a guard at a business and his income is very low. This is one of the reasons that Vilma is looking for help in order to meet some of the many household costs that they incur daily. Her dreams are: to see to it that one day her children will excel in a profession; to own a nice, comfortable house; and to have a stable business.

She is happy to be able look for help from institutions and organizations that give support to people who want to improve their quality of life. Her business doesn’t have a name because she sells in the informal market in the town of Patzún, and in other places where she says her business is feasible. She makes embroidered blouses and belts. She also gives the opportunity to other women to help her make the things she sells. She thinks that this loan will be enough to buy the raw materials she needs to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma Araceli M., vive en la aldea Cajobal; Patzún, Chimaltenango, es unida, tiene 3 hijos pequeños, el papá de sus hijos trabaja fuera de la comunidad en una empresa como guardián y sus expresiones en cuanto a sus ingresos económicos son muy bajas y esa es una de las razones por la que ella busca ayuda para poder suplir algunas de las múltiples necesidades familiares que atraviesan diariamente y sus sueños son: Ver algún día que sus hijos sobresalgan profesionalmente, como también tener una casa bonita con todas las comodidades, con un negocio ya estable y así ella se siente satisfecha por los esfuerzos que realiza por buscar ayuda con instituciones y organizaciones que brindan apoyo hacia personas que quieren superar la calidad de vida que llevan. Su negocio no tiene nombre porque solo vende en el mercado informal del municipio de Patzún, y en otros lugares donde dice ella que es factible su negocio, ella se dedica a elaborar güipiles y fajas, como también les da la oportunidad a otras mujeres a ayudarla en la hechura de las telas que ella vende, ella piensa que Dos mil quetzales Q2,000.00 le alcanza para comprar materia prima para ampliar mas su negocio.

loans.use: To buy materials to make embroidered blouses, belts, and other crafts

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 38-year-old mother of 3 and runs a restaurant in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam city. She has been in this business for the past ten years. At her restaurant, she sells all sorts of soft drinks and ready-made food ranging from breakfast, lunch and supper. Most of her clients are business men around the Buguruni area.

She is a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation organized business management and entrepreneur skills. Her dream is to build a bigger permanent housing for her restaurant, open up a charcoal store and sell the locally made clothing known as "vitengi". She is therefore in need of USD 450 to help her at least accomplish any one of the above dreams.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is 40, married with five children and one dependent child. She is the owner of the Shina Shina Salon. The women in the villages take great pride in getting their hair done and the styles vary greatly. Annette's clients value her professionalism and knowledge of hair styles and cosmetics. Salons serve an important role in the community as a place of social gathering and keeping up self-esteem.
 
Annette has been in business at this location for ten years. She will use her loan to buy mores shampoo, braids, dyes and cosmetics. This will be her fourth loan and she never had a problem with repayment. Annette dreams of one day owning her own plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more shampoos, braids, dyes and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
“I have lived in Riawind, a small city, since my marriage many years ago. I have six children and my eldest son is also married and working. The other son are also working, one in a factory, one provides transport services, and one works with his father. My daughter just finished her Masters and is teaching in a school. My youngest daughter is in ninth grade. Since I am too old to work, I need a loan to purchase a buffalo so I can sell milk. My son who works with his father will take care of the buffalo. I will invest the profits to purchase another animal.

Since my group members and I have borrowed before from a local microfinance institution, we know each other well and can guarantee repayment. Zubaida has a grocery store and needs a loan to stock up. Shazia runs a laundry business and Safia runs a clothing business.”

loans.use: Purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Thi Nhat

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nhât, 40 years old, is a quick and handy woman. She has two children. One is a wood sculptor and the other is still in school. Everyday she goes out to her neighborhood collecting scrap material then sells back to depots. Her husband, Mr. Thất, is a laborer. The family’s income is stabL.. She is applying for a loan of 150USD to use as capital for her scrap material business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nhât, năm nay 40 tuổi, là người phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn, tháo vát. Chị có hai con: 1 còn đang đi học còn một thì đã đi làm đồ gỗ mỹ nghệ. Hàng ngày, chị đi thu mua phế liệu tại các vùng lân cận rồi đem bán cho các hộ thu mua tại thôn. Anh Thất, chồng chị thường đi làm thuê để phụ chị chăm sóc gia đình. Vì vậy, thu nhập gia đình chị khá thường xuyên và ổn định. Chị đã tham gia chương trình Tài chính vi mô binh minh cdc với mức vốn 2006000đ để bổ sung vốn đi chợ hàng ngày.

loans.use: Buy scrap material

loans.name: Dorah Sinza E Group

texts.en:
Dorah N., age 42, is married and has three children (ages 23, 18, and 16). She sells bed sheets from door-to-door, a business which she began two years ago. She works from 8am to 4pm daily making a monthly profit of around US$ 129.

Dorah hopes for a loan to increase her business capital. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who sells chips.

In the picture Dorah is the lady.

loans.use: to increase her business capital

loans.name: Dulia

texts.es:
While Dulia recovers from her recent gallbladder operation she plans how she will continue working without moving around too far from her home. She currently works as a conductor for a public transportation company and at the same time has been renting a small public transport omnibus (Couster) for seven years. Her dream and long term goal is to have a restaurant in her home but for now she works to help her husband who is a mechanical engineer to provide for the education of their children who are twenty and thirteen years old.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Mientras Dulia se recupera de su operación a la vesícula a la que fue sometida hace una semana planea el modo de cómo seguir trabajando sin movilizarse tanto fuera de su casa. Actualmente ella trabaja como cobradora de una línea de transporte y a la vez alquila desde hace siete años un ómnibus pequeño (Couster) para que sea trabajado como transporte público. Más adelante le gustaría tener un restaurante en su casa, ese es su sueño y objetivo a largo plazo. Por ahora trabaja para ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como técnico mecánico, con la educación de sus hijos de veinte y trece años.

loans.use: Pay the first payment for the purchase of a Couster (omnibus)

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Florinda is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. She belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso (“Progressive Women's Community Bank”) and sells foodstuffs from a site in the central market, Yungay District and Province, Ancash State. The income she and her husband earn enables them to educate their children.

With this loan, repayable over four month, she plans to buy 2 cans of oil, 2 sacks of rice, 32 packets of noodles, and 1 kilo of meat.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Florinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta de alimentos, su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 latas de aceite, 2 sacos de arroz, 32 paquetes de fideos, y 1 kilos de carne. Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food preparation and sales

loans.name: Gaur.

texts.ru:
Gaur R. lives in Varzob. He is 43 years old, married, with 4 children. He has a post-secondary education, is a teacher by training. He teaches in a middle school. Gaur also breeds animals, since a teacher's salary is very small. The client buys calf-bulls at the local market, fattens them up, and sells them at a profit. This enterprise allows him to support his large family. Right now the client wants to buy two young bulls for grazing and fattening up. Which is why he needs money. This is the reason for his decision to take out a loan with a repayment period of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva translator.

Ризоев Гаюр житель района Варзоб. Возраст 43 года, женат , имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности учитель. Клиент работает учителем в средней школе. Так же Гаюр занимаетмя животноводством. Так как заработная плата у учителей очень маленькая .Клиент покупает на рынке молодых бычков откармливает их и продает на рынке по выгодной ему цене. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ему содержать его большую семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить двух бычков для откормки. Для чего ему нужны деньги. Поэтому Гаюр решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of two calf-bulls.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa A. Z. is 28 years old, married and has one child. He lives with his family in a village near Tyr in south Lebanon. Moussa makes a living running a grocery store, and has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy more goods to sell to his customers. This is the first time that he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María Antonia began her business out of economic need when she could not find work and had nowhere to leave her two children (ages 6 and 10 years) during the day. For that reason, she decided to help a friend of hers to sell cosmetics by catalog. Little by little, she began earning customers, and she decided to go out on her own and sell by herself.

She needs a loan for US $500 that she will repay in six months to purchase merchandise so she can continue in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

María Antonia inicio el negocio porque tenia necesidad económica ya que no encontraba trabajo y además no tenia donde dejar a sus 2 niños (6 y 10 años) por lo que decidió ayudarle a una amiga a vender cosméticos por catalogo poco a poco fue haciendo clientes por lo que prefirió independizarse y vender ella sola.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Atash

texts.en: Atash was born in 1965. He is married. He does not have a child. Atash is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Gubadli region in Azerbaijan, settled in Khirdalan Town. He has transported loads for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare part for his truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Mrs. Sharon M., 30, is a rice farmer. She has been farming for 18 years and earns $1 USD per day. She lives with two young children, both of whom stay in the family's home. Her husband, Mr. Thy Noy, 31, sells chopped wood. Sharon needs a loan of $900 USD to buy two buffaloes to help with the labor of growing rice and to help her husband transport  his chopped wood to sell.

loans.use: To buy two buffaloes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.

Julia es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hija de 19 años, Julia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en una calle céntrica y cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende útiles de escritorio, mercerías como betunes, cepillos, juguetes, actividades que realiza con su esposo, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y en algunas oportunidades de distribuidores locales. Además Julia en época escolar viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región llevando útiles escolares, libros. También Julia vende ropa en el mercado 12 de abril, este negocio es atendido por su hija.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes variados, cepillos, betún. Los sueños de Julia son tener un capital propio, su negocio prospere y que su hija culmine sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Julia is a partner iin the Alborada Community Bank.

She 49 years old and is married with a 19 year old daughter. Julia has a store in a rented location on a main street near the central market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells school supplies, shoe polish, brushes, and toys together with her husband. She purchases her products in the city of Lima and occasionally from local distributors. During the school year Julia also travels to different markets in the region to sell school supplies and books. She also sells clothing in the 12 de abril market through a business run by her daughter.

Julia is requesting a loan of 1250 soles which she will use to purchase various toys, brushes, and shoe polish. Her dream is to maintain her own capital, have a prosperous business, and to see her daughter finish her university education.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia is requesting a loan of 1250 soles which she will use to purchase various toys, brushes, and shoe polish.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva is a member of community bank, Violeta. Genoveva is married and has 7 children who are all in school. With the help of her husband, Genoveva has her business selling dried goods and vegetables. She travels to the rainforest to sell her goods. With her loan, she will invest in her business by purchasing wheat, corn, flour, carrots and limes.  Genoveva is saving to be able to continue working and fulfill her dreams of owning her own truck to haul her products to sell at various locations.

loans.use: Buy wheat, corn, flour, carrots and limes

loans.name: Glendise

texts.en:
Glendise is a member of the Tulipanes (“Tulips”) Village Bank.  

Glendise is 38 years old and married with three children. Glendise travels to different regional markets (she used to travel to two different markets, but now travels to four) to sell various fruits and to buy cheese, grains, garlic and chickens. She grinds the grains into flour, which she then sells wholesale in different markets in the city of Ayacucho. She sells the other products door-to-door. Glendise needs a loan of 2000 Soles to buy wheat, broadbeans, quinoa and garlic. 

Glendise’s dreams are to build her own home, to buy a car to transport her wares, and to send her children to school. 

---
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Glendise es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes. 
Glendise es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Glendise viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, anteriormente viajaba a 2 ferias y actualmente viaja a 4 ferias, en donde vende frutas variadas y de las ferias compra quesos, cereales, ajo y gallinas, sus productos los vende de casa en casa y los cereales los procesa en harinas y lo vende por mayor en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad. 
Glendise necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, haba, quinua y ajo. 
Los sueños de Glendise son construir su casa, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Buy wheat, broadbeans, quinoa, and garlic

loans.name: Mathias

texts.fr: Originaire de Porto-Novo le capital politique du BENIN, monsieur K. Mathias est né à Adjohounn le 29 Juillet 1978. Il est marié à HOUNNOU Rose qui lui a fait deux enfants de sexe différent. L’aînée est au CI et le benjamin n’a pas encore l’âge d’être scolarisé. Il est menuisier de profession. Il a son atelier de menuiserie à Midombo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou  où il fabrique et vend des meubles de toute sorte. Il va acheter le bois (principale matière première qui rentre dans ses fabrications) à Savè ou  Parakou deux villes du nord BENIN. Il est à son troisième crédit et sollicite maintenent un crédit.
texts.en:
A native of Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin, Mathias K. was born in Adjohounn on July 29, 1978. He is married to Rose Hounnou, who has given him two children, a son and a daughter. The eldest girl is in pre-school, while the youngest boy is not yet school age. Mathias is a carpenter by trade. He has his workshop in Midombo, an area on the outskirts of the city of Cotonou, where he manufactures and sells furniture of all sorts. He goes to Savè or Parakou, two towns in northern Benin, to buy wood, the primary material with which he works. The loan he is now seeking will be Mathias’ third.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and hardware

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en:
Hidoyat and her husband believe that education is the most important inheritance they can give their children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school. That is an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more bills than she can afford. Therefore, she would like a loan in order to buy more cattle and increase their capital. Hidoyat and her family are waiting for your quick response.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. Its history includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
M. is 55 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. She has four children: one is single and under her care, and the other three are married and lived separately. M. is a widow and earns her living by owning a grocery store selling cooked ingredients, sweets, plastic, etc. To help M.'s business, Sokhan, M.'s daughter, stays with her and prepares the store for her.

M. is a responsible and helpful mother. She has earned a better income from her clients by having her store. M. recently faced a problem with transportation. M. is applying for a loan of $400 to buy a motorcycle for her and her family. The loan will help the family earn a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her and her family

loans.name: Mehar Khan M.sadiq Group

texts.en:
Mehar K. baji is 53 years old and a married lady and citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 21 years. Mehar baji is the mother of one son who is 15 years old and works in his father’s scrap business. Mehar K. baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

Mehar baji is the group leader for another four women from her locality. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Khatoon baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy CDs for her CD shop. Asma baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is engaged in a vending business. Some of the things she sells are vegetables and rice. She is glad that she can earn at least PHP 1,000 a week and she budgets her income as a rolling capital in the business and to cover the school allowance of her son.

At present, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of PHP 5,000 that she will use to purchase more stock. She is hoping that her loan will be granted so that her income will increase and meet the needs of her family. She always bears in mind that to be successful in life, one should exert more effort to succeed.

Ms. Cristina is 25 years old and her husband is working as a carpenter. They have a seven-year-old son and he is now in the elementary level. Her son serves as their inspiration to work hard for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia K. is married with 5 dependants and received an education through Junior High School. Since 1996, Cynthia has worked as a trader at Kotokraba in Siwdu, selling ladies clothing and footwear. Cynthia’s husband is also employed as a trader in the Kotokraba area. She uses her income to pay for various family expenses, including school fees. Cynthia will use the loan to purchase additional clothing and footwear for selling, and with her newly gained profits, she plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing and footwear for selling

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Мирзоахмедов Рахим- мужчина 48 лет. Женат отец 5-х детей. Занимается купли продажей скота. Рахим закупает скот и перепродает мясникам и на рынке частично. На полученный займ он хочет купит овец у чабанов.   Старший сын Рахима находится в Российской Федерации на заработках и по мере высиля деньги помогает родителям. Летом Рахим выдает свою дочку замуж, поэтому он хочет, увеличить свой оборот.
texts.en:
Rahim M. is 48 years old, married and has five children. He is involved in livestock sales. Rahim buys livestock and resells it to butchers or at a market. He wants to use this loan to purchase sheep from shepherds. Rahim’s oldest son works in Russia and sends some money home to help his parents. This summer, Rahim is marrying off his daughter, and this is why, he wants to increase his turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria has been married for 17 years to Mr. Romualdo Lugo, with whom she has five children.  

Gloria decided to become a street vendor five years ago when her husband got a job as a painter and could not provide for and sustain the family.  It was then that she went from house to house in the neighborhood where she lived, offering her goods, as she was very well accepted by the community.  She decided to resort to the Foundation in order to capitalize and be able to buy more goods to satisfy the demands of her clients. 

Very soon, Gloria wants to build her own salesroom in her house.

loans.use: Purchase of jeans, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie B. makes a living primarily from selling clothes in her local community. She is 46 years old, married and has three adult children. They are from the village of Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Rosalie has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalie is now requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Las Progresivas Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento: LAS PROGRESIVAS  fue fundado el 20 DE NOVIEMBRE del 2008, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras .Se encuentra situado en el Barrio PRIMAVERA , situado enl la calle 4, de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo  esta en su 3er ciclo, compuesto por 12 personas,como Presidenta tenemos a la señora:ANA YNGA R. J., Tesorera : FABIOLA P. D.  y de Secretaria: IDALMI S. R.. En el grupo hay señoras y señores que se dedican a la venta de cosmeticos, comida, venta de Hamburguesa, pasteleras, venta de bijouteria, venta de cd y dvd, venta de zapatos. Son actividades que necesitan créditos rápidos.			
			
La Sra.Ana Ynga R. J.  ella es la presidente del Banco de Emprendimiento, .Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa y con este nuevo credito ofrecera zapatos tambien, dentro del rubro tiene 3 años de antiguedad, asimismo  realiza labores de casa. La Sra.Ana Ynga R. J.  es  responsable dentro del grupo y la oportunidad que le brI. Emprender no la defraudara. Con los ingrersos que percibe ayuda al sustento de su familia. La Sra, es  responsable y cumplida en el grupo además de ser una de las fundadoras del Banco de Emprendiemiento LAS PROGRESIVAS.		
			
La Sr. Roberto G. es socio antiguo del del Banco de Emprendimiento.Él se dedica a la venta de CD's, tambien se dedica al mantenemiento de computadoras. Es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo, la oportunidad que le brI. Emprender es importante para él para incrementar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Tambien él es uno de los lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas.			
			
La Sra. Fabiola P. es la tesorera del grupo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pasteles,  tiene 3 años de antigüedad  en el rubro , trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 8 horas al dia, su trabajo es elaborar los pasteles y entregarlos a sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito en el Banco de Emprendieminto, esta muy contenta con la oportunidad que le brI. Emprender y el grupo LAS PROGESIVAS .
texts.en:
Cooperative Bank: LAS PROGRESIVAS was founded on November 20, 2008, at the initiative of a group of women. It is located in the PRIMAVERA neighborhood, located on 4th Street in the Plan 3000 zone. The group is in its 3rd cycle, and is comprised of 12 people. We have as our President: Mrs. ANA YNGA R. J., Treasurer: FABIOLA P. D. and Secretary: IDALMI S. R.. The group has women and men who dedicate themselves to selling cosmetics, food, hamburgers, bakery goods, jewelry, CDs and DVDs, and footwear. These are activities that require fast credit approvals. Ana Ynga R. J. is the president of the cooperative bank. She dedicates herself to clothing sales and, with this new loan, she will also start selling shoes. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and, concurrently, she takes care of the household tasks. Ana Ynga R. J. is responsible for the group, and she will not disappoint given the opportunities presented by Emprender. Her income helps to sustain her family. This woman is responsible and accomplished within the group, in addition to being one of the founders of the LAS PROGRESIVAS cooperative bank. Mr. Roberto Galves is a long-time member of the cooperative bank. He sells CDs and also does computer maintenance work. He is a responsible member of the group, and the opportunities provided by Emprender are important to him in order to augment his income and improve his standard of living. He is also one of the leaders of the group, ensuring that loan payments are made on time. Mrs. Fabiola P. is the treasurer of the group, and she dedicates herself to making and selling cakes. She has been in this line of work for 3 years, working 6 days a week for 8 hours per day. She makes cakes and delivers them to her customers. This is the second loan by the cooperative bank, and she is very grateful for the opportunities provided by Emprender and the LAS PROGRESIVAS group.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina B. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 67 years old. Peregrina is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Peregrina owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing dress-making services to local community members. Peregrina has been engaged in her business for over 45 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Peregrina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Peregrina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Peregrina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Peregrina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Imelda R. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudad mucho a que su negocio creciera y tuviera mas clientes.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio de ropa de temporada de verano y de otoño ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir  y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que es viuda y tiene bajo su responsabilidad de hijo el cual esta estudiando.
Doña Imelda cuenta también con un ingreso extra de una pensión que recibe de su esposo y con el cual planea pagar este otro crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Imelda R. is very grateful for her previous loan which helped her business grow and attract more customers.

She is requesting a new loan to restock her business with seasonal clothing for summer and fall. Right now, she does not have the available funds and does not want to take money out of her business. Her work provides income for her family, since she is a widow and is responsible for her son who is currently studying. Doña Imelda also receives extra income from her late husband’s pension, which she will use to repay this loan.

Click HERE to Doña Imelda's previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is thirty-three years old. She is married and has twins, a boy and a girl who are currently in school. She is a seamstress by profession. Agnes designs and sews for clients and also for sale. She has a workshop by the roadside in her community. She says she has three apprentices in training.

Agnes has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy textiles and other sewing accessories. She desires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy textiles and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary-Ann retails fish in their village for almost two years. She diligently walks around their village carrying her large and heavy Styrofoam container to sell her fish.  She is glad that she can earn a daily net income of PHP500 through her diligence in selling in their neighborhood.  As a parent, she always wanted to provide the needs of her children through her business.  She believes that by working hard she could also uplift the poor living condition of her family. 

Mary-Ann is hoping to borrow a loan of PHP4, 000 from the KIVA lenders.  She will use the loan to use as additional capital for her business to become productive.  She plans to purchase bigger volume of fish to increase her merchandise and so with her income.  She is hoping that her loan will be granted for it will greatly help her not only in the business but also in providing the needs of their family.  

Mary-Ann is already 40 years old and a diligent business woman from the village of Arcon, Tumauini, Isabela. Her husband Artemio is working as a farmer and a passenger tricycle driver which is owned by their neighbor.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard has been operating his motorcycle business in Naivasha town for the last three years. He is 28 years old and married to Margaret Njeri and they have two school-going children. Bernard was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan with the organization and he's planning to use the proceeds to repair and service his motorbike. In future Bernard plans to grow in the transportation business, owning his own fleet of taxis. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Ризвонов Парвиз проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Парвиз имеет среднее образование. Жена, домохозяйка. Парвиз более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Помимо этого он еще работает на стройке. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Parviz R. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 36 years old, married and has 6 children. Parviz has secondary education. His wife is a homemaker. Parviz has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. He raises and sells livestock. Besides this business, he also works at a construction site. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to buy more items such as cassava, beans, maize etc to sell.  Esther is 30 years old and is married to a carpenter. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for renting.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr: Haby B., 34 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAO BA depuis 8 ans. Elle développe un petit commerce d'huile, elle en achète en grande quantité dans des fûts et revend au détail. Cette activité lui donne de ressources additionnelles qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Haby B., aged 34, is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the village bank Diao Ba for eight years. She runs a small business selling oil. She buys the oil wholesale in barrels and retails it. This activity gives her additional resources which enable her to participate in the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her oil business

loans.name: Dugersuren

texts.en: Dugersuren O. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Arkhangai Province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a yurt or "ger," which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Both of her daughters have finished school. Her oldest now has her own business and her youngest is a teacher. O. raises livestock and sells meat in her town. She sells a variety of locally raised meats to her many customers. She started her business in 2003 with capital of 150,000 tugrugs (~$105 USD) and has built a successful operation over the years. Today, her business continues to grow quickly and she has a large base of loyal customers. Her working capital now exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~$560 USD). O. is a hardworking businesswoman and attributes her success to her good accounting skills. For the future she says, “I hope to soon expand my business.” She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug ($350 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell in her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: XacBank-Mongolia Lending Team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell in her business

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Yonny tiene 22 años y tiene una hija de 4 años y se llama Juana. La socia Yonny es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje. 

La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su esposo y su hija. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a atender su tienda de venta de comestibles en el Mercado Unidos de Urcos. Ya es un año y medio que se dedica a la venta de comestibles y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más comestibles como azúcar, arroz, fideos, leches y verduras, ya que por estas épocas es donde se vende más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Yonny is 22 years and she has a 4 year old daughter and her name is Juana. The member Yonny is a native of the city of Urcos, in the province of Quispicanchis, the department of Cusco and she belongs to the Asociación Arariwa’s Communal Bank “Qori Orcco”. The city of Urcos is located 45 Km. from the city of Cusco, approximately a 45 minute trip.

The member wakes up very early in order to do household tasks, like for example, preparing breakfast for her husband and her daughter. After doing her household tasks, the member has to attend to her grocery store and it has been going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. The member needs the loan in order to buy more food like sugar, rice, noodles, milk and vegetables, since this is the time when she sells more.

She is grateful for the opportunity given through this resource and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more food like sugar, rice, noodles, milk and vegetables

loans.name: Jenipher Achieng

texts.en:
Jenipher Achieng O. is 28 years old and is married to Joanes Ouma. They have three children, the eldest being nine years old.

Jenipher owns a posho mill business (a grinding machine that crushes maize into maize flour) on the outskirts of Kisumu in Nyanza province. She has been running her business for the last fourteen years.

Jenipher hopes to obtain a loan through KADET to enable her buy a new grinding mill and more sacks of maize to meet the demands of her clients. Her posho mill is the only one available in her area and this means that she has a huge clientele.

Jenipher’s dream is to diversify into a sugarcane plantation business.

loans.use: To buy another grinding machine and more sacks of maize

loans.name: Maria Marbelly

texts.es: Maria Marbelly tiene 30 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y ropa interior. Ella tiene 4 hijos y los quiere mucho tiene dos niñas gemelitas. Ella siempre lucha por salir adelante pues todos los días sale a visitar las diferentes casas distribuidoras como Avon, Zelsa, Vogue entre otros productos ella sale todos los días por la mañana a ofrecer sus productos, pues su esposo le ayuda a cuidar a los niños, y por la tarde el sale a vende los productos ya que tienen que buscar la forma de vender los productos a sus diferentes clientes. Ella sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos y proporcionarle todo lo necesario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cremas, colonias, tratamientos, shampoo entre otros productos.
texts.en:
María Marbelly is 30 years old. She makes a living selling cosmetics and undergarments. She is the mother of twin girls and has four children, whom she loves very much. María Marbelly is always striving to get ahead and visits the cosmetic distribution companies, such as Avon, Zelsa and Vogue, on a daily basis. She sells her products in the mornings, while her husband takes care of the children. They switch places in the afternoon, when he goes out to sell. Her main goal is to provide her children with what they need to get ahead. The loan will provide capital to buy different products, such as various types of creams, colognes, treatments and shampoo.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Leonardo Fabian

texts.es:
Leonardo Fabián Guaman C. tiene 22 años, vive en union libre, y  tiene un hijo.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario, es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Leonardo trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y en su casa. 
La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y aprovecha esta fiesta para reunirse con la familia.

El socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Leonardo Fabián Guaman C. is 22 years old, and lives with his common-law wife and his son. They live in the county of San Miguel in the Bolivar province. Leonardo is a member of the communal bank "Calzado Solidario," located in a compound that is 15 minutes outside of San Miguel county, on the road to the coast. There are 19 members in total, who work in agriculture and livestock production. Leonardo works in agriculture to support his family. His main crop is corn. He sells his products in the market of San Miguel and from his house. Each year in February the main cultural event is Carnival, a time when families take advantage of the celebration to get together. Leonardo requests a loan to buy supplies for his work in the fields. His goal is to produce a good income for the family. The challenges he faces are problems with the weather that affect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for his work in agriculture

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mrs. Tum S. is 41-year-old farmer. She plants rice and some vegetable crops, which she sells to buyers when they are mature. She has a partner in her husband who is shown in the picture above. He assists her in farming crops. This couple has been married for many years and they have six teenage children. Two of the children are garment workers for the industry and the remaining four attend school. Tum S. will use her first loan to buy an old motorcycle to supply transportation for the family. Any remaining money from the loan will be used to clean up her land on which she plans to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle and clean up the land.

loans.name: Ulpiano

texts.es:
Ulpiano es socio del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Ulpiano es soltero y tiene 43 años, Ulpiano tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros.
Ulpiano necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento del carro.
Los sueños de Ulpiano son tener mas ahorros y comprar mas carros.
texts.en:
Ulpiano is a member of the Las Margaritas Communal Bank. Ulpiano is 43 and single. Ulpiano has a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) that he uses to transport passengers. Ulpiano needs a loan for 1,000 PEN, which he will use for maintenance on his car. Ulpiano’s dreams are to have more savings and to buy more cars.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For maintenance on his car

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Cruz de Medano del distrito de Morrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Usualmente trabajaba como obrero agrícola en los campos de cultivo de la zona, pero como esta actividad no le generaba ingresos estables decidió hace tres años insursionar en el negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores, el cría animales desde pequeños y semanalmente selecciona los mejores ejemplares para venderlos en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Por otro lado eventualmente trabaja vendiendo leña a sus vecinos. Estas fuentes de ingreso son las unicas con la que cuenta su familia por lo que Cesar da lo mejor de si para mantenerse en el negocio. El desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales menores para criarlos y venderlos, así como en la compra de sus respectivos alimentos, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Cesar es un padre responsable y bastante entragado a su familia, todos los esfuerzos e inciativas que toma tienen la finalidad de sacarlos adelante. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable con sus pagos. En la imagen aparece junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Cesar is 32 years old, married with two children, and he lives with his family in the neighborhood of Cruz de Medano in the Morrope district, in the Lambayeque province, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He used to work as a farm worker in the local farmlands, but since this didn’t generate stable income three years ago he decided to start a small animal business. He raises farm animals and selects the best specimens weekly to sell in the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo. He also sells firewood to his neighbors. These sources of income are the only ones his family counts on. This is why Cesar gives his best to keep the business going. He wishes to increase the size of his business by buying more animals to raise and sell, and by buying their respective feed. This is why he finds himself asking for a loan of 1800 soles to Edpyme Alternativa that will help him achieve his objectives. Cesar is a responsible father who completely gives himself to his family. All of the efforts and initiatives he takes have as a goal to help them succeed. He has previously worked with our institution and has shown that he is punctual and responsible with his payments. He appears next to his wife in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy animals to raise and sell, and their respective balanced feed

loans.name: Sanat

texts.en:
Sanat H. is a 50-year-old businesswoman. She lives with her husband and four children in Bayn-Ulgii province, Mongolia. Sanat and her family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). They have been living together in their current home for 21 years. 

Sanat operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Tirlik. She purchases her products two or three times per month. Sanat spends 2,000,000 tugrugs (about $1,430 USD) per purchase. She pays 10,000 tugrugs (about $8 USD) for a rented counter.  She has been operating her business since 2000 and has built a stable operation and loyal customer base. 

Sanat operated her business at a market called Koshagash in Russia between 2001 and 2007. Since she started her business, her family's living conditions have been improving. With her earnings, she was able to pay her daughter's university fees until she graduated. 

Sanat is a very hardworking and open person. She says, “I would like to continue to successfully operate my business with the loan, and be financially able to pay the education fees for my children.” 

Sanat is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more clothing from Taikeshken, a Chinese border town, for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by buying more business goods

loans.name: Sophary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophary P. is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Bo Rous, is 35 years old. They have been married since 1994 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of them still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband has full-time employment.

Sophary has been running a grocery store in her village for ten years. She is requesting her first loan of $600 to remodel her grocery store.

loans.use: To remodel her grocery store

loans.name: G.s. Jehova E Mi Pastor No 2 Group

texts.es: La señora Luisa Emilia tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de diez años de edad y el otro de un año de edad. Ella se dedica a la distribución de cosméticos de manera ambulante. Ella solicita el crédito con el propósito de incrementar su capital de trabajo, además que desea variar un poco su inventario comprando además productos medicinales. Su otra amiga Cony Maria tiene 34 años de edad, La señora obtiene ingresos de la pulpería que tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, así deciden juntarse y conformar el grupo solidario Jehová Es Mi Pastor. Ambas necesitan el financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Luisa Emilia is 32, married and has 2 children ages 10 and 1. She sells cosmetics in a street market. She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital, and she also wants to add variety to her inventory through buying more medicinal products. Her other friend Cony Maria is 34 and obtains her income from a convenience store in her house. They decided to join together and form the communal bank "Jehova is my Shepherd". Together they need a loan to buy basic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Javier Eleazar

texts.es:
El Sr.  Javier González S., El trabaja como profesor Universitario en la Facultad de Humanidades Encargado de Cátedra con Licenciatura en la Universidad Autónoma de Nicaragua ( UNAN).
Es padre  de familia  de dos hijos  y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para  utilizarlo en gasto personal como es la compra de medicamentos para su mama que se encuentra enferma.
Javier  dice que gracias a los financiamientos  otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier González S. is a university professor in the Humanities Department. with a degree in the Autonomous University of Nicaragua (UNAN). He is the father of two school-aged children. The loan will be used for personal expenses. In this case it will be used to buy medicine for his mother who is ill. Javier says that thanks to the loans offered him by Ceprodel he has been able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use the money for personal expenses.  He is going to be buy medicine for his mother who is ill.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane L. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old. Mary Jane is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Mary Jane operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing mechanical services, like vulcanizing, which her husband handles. Their business also offers car washing. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma M. is from the town of Trento. She is 47 years old. To make a living, Norma raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over four years. She also helps at her family's farm. She helps keep it free of weeds and pests and also helps sell their harvest. Norma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Norma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and farm supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Norma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster-group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
