Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy different kinds of thread and cloth to grow her business

loans.name: Villaflor

texts.en:
Villaflor A. is from the village of Baclay, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Villaflor is married and has two children. To make a living, Villaflor owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Villaflor is just starting this business.

In 2008, Villaflor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Villaflor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Villaflor is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Villaflor from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
doña Emilia R. M. es una mujer muy trabajadora y  que se dedica a la venta de ropa americana desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que su negocio le genera a mantenido a sus hijos, tiene 5 hijos.
Emilia y su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante su hogar.
la ropa la vende en varios lugares cercanos de su comunidad.
tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, en estos momentos tiene varios pedidos y no tiene capital para comprar la ropa.
texts.en:
Emilia R. M. is a very hard-working woman. She has been selling second-hand clothing (popularly named by the public American Clothes) for several years. She uses the income generated by her business to support her children; she has five children. Emilia and her husband work hard to get their household ahead. She sells the clothes in various nearby places in her community. She also raises chickens. She will use the loan to buy clothes. She now has many orders, and she does not have the capital to buy the clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's outfits, dresses, shirts, pants, socks, and pajamas

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mr. Sinat S. (pictured here) is 31 years old and his wife, Mrs. Savy Yoem, is 27 years old.  They have been married since 2004 and have a young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mr. Sinat S. is a farmer.  He grows vegetables on his farmland in the village.  His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide and to make a shelter to protect his vegetables from the sun.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for his farming business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia L. is currently in the business of selling various items in the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell.  Lucia is 40 years old and is married to a driver. She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive sola en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener un mejor futuro. El puesto de comida de María es el más concurrido del mercado Asunción de la ciudad de Tarma, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 37 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola.  Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante y así tener más clientes. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas ollas y utensilios, ya que los que usaba se han deteriorado con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
María, 45, is a hardworking and responsible woman who lives alone in her parents’ home and what she most desires is to have a better future.  Maria’s food stand is the busiest in the Asunción market in the city of Tarma.  Every day her customers come by her stand to enjoy the delicious meals that she prepares.  She is a very skilled cook and the love of cooking was instilled in her from the time she was small, and she feels very happy to be able to work in this area. What she most likes about her work is to cook and she does this carefully.  She has been working as a cook for the last 37 years but what she finds the most difficult is seeing to the people who come into her restaurant.  This is because often she works alone.

With the passage of time she hopes to improve the facilities of the restaurant and thus have more customers.  This is her third loan with MFP. She hopes to be very punctual with the payments because she wants to have more loans.  In her communal bank Maria is a very active member.  With the three thousand new sols she is requesting, she will buy new pots and utensils, since the ones that she has been using have deteriorated with time.

loans.use: To buy pots and utensils to outfit her kitchen

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G. is from the village of Sinamar, Roxas, Isabela. She is 58 years old and married. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 33000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional seeds and seedlings. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan is a talented lady who operates an embroidery business to financially support her family. She is very skillful in her art and receives regular orders from her neighboring clients every month. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. 

She is married to Q. M. who is also involved in an embroidery business. He operates his shop in the market where he offers different designs of embroidery to his customers. His unique works helps him to introduce his talent to many more customers.  

She is a mother of a son who also does embroidery work. Embroidery has become their family business.

Shareefan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband expand his embroidery business. With the loan, he will buy an embroidery machine and also hire a worker who will assist him in his work. This will help him fulfill orders on time. 

She is a new loan applicant for Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy embroidery machine & hire worker

loans.name: Ami Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène a 33 ans et est mariée. Elle a en charge 5 enfants. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle fait  comme activité la vente de bijoux et chaussures pour arriver à aider son mari au foyer. Elle compte déjà 3 ans et s’approvisionne au Bénin à Cotonou et au grand de Lomé. Elle revend ensuite ses marchandises à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite au près de WAGES un prêt pour faire  face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Hélène is 33 years old. She is married and has five children in her care. To improve her children’s life conditions, she sells jewelry and shoes, in order to help her husband with family expense. She has three years of experience already and stocks up in Benin in Cotonou and at the big [market] of Lomé. She then resells her wares in front of her home. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to meet ever increasing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchasing jewelry and shoes

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Arlene P. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Arlene, 43, finished high school and is happily married to Dindo. They have been blessed with one child who is currently toddling at home. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Arlene presently runs a food stall, where she sells packed meals for breakfast, lunch, and even dinner. Her customers are her neighbors and the local community. Having been at least 10 years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most important, her customers. Monthly, she is able to earn an average of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP).

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP15,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more raw meats, ingredients and other materials. Arlene plans to take this opportunity to drive her business towards more profitability.

Arlene's life, both business and personal, is never without challenges. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw meats, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: motorcycle repair and a tricycle transport businesses. Her husband Aldemer, who is 38 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 5 and 10 years old. Myrna joined NWTF-Project DunggA. in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project DunggA., Myrna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy new equipment for the motorcycle repair shop so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Myrna is a DunggA. woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project DunggA. (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them DunggA. - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for her shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary L. is a married lady with seven children aged between 16 and 28 years. Her business is located in the town of Kakamega, which is in the region in Kenya known as the sugarbelt region for the production of sugarcane. 

Mary sells groceries to the local residents. She has been in this business for 18 years now and has employed one person. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area with the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes and onions to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one. She describes herself as humble, intelligent and polite.

loans.use: Tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Wano

texts.fr: Madame  a 4  enfants  et   est  mariée. Elle est âgée de  35 ans. Elle est née à  Bassar  et habité quartier   Batomé.  Elle fait la vente de bombons  et de charbons de bois mis en sachet.   Elle a commencé l’activité en 2002 et revend à côté de la  pharmacie Djidjolé. Elle a employé  2 personnes qui l’aident dans  ses  activités. Elle demande un prêt  pour  se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Mrs Wano S., aged 35, is married and the mother of four children. She was born in Bassar and lives now in the neighbourhood of Batomé. She sells sweets and bagged charcoal. She began her activity in 2002 and has her store next to Djidjolé pharmacy. She has hired two employees to help her in her activity. She applies for a loan to stock up her inventory.

loans.use: To buy sweets for her grocery

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años, que tiene este medio de vida. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos y se encuentra muy contento con este medio de vida. Inicio porque Luis no tenía un trabajo estable que le generara ingresos diarios, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mantener a su familia. El solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y granos básicos. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día más y agrandar su inventario.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel owns a grocery store and has been in this business for more than 4 years.  This is not the first time that he has taken loans and he is very happy with his work.  Luis started his business because he didn't have a stable job that made him daily income.  He has always looked after and supported his family.  

Luís is requesting this loan to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies and basic grains.  He dreams of improving his income every day and increasing his stock.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Viven en el caserío de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. El caserio es mediano pero tiene aspiraciones a superarse.

Desde hace más de 14 años, se dedica a la venta de comida y bebida lo cual realiza en una parte de su domicilio. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más envases de cervezas, mesas y sillas para su local. Espera poder atender a más clientes, y adquirir una mayor utilidad para solventar sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 46 years old, single, and has two children. She lives in the village of Tambogrande, a farming area that lies in the province and region of Piura, which is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. This village is of average size, but has aspirations for growth.

Beatriz has been serving food and beverages from a section of her home for more than fourteen years. She is well-known in the area and has an established customer base. Beatriz wants to invest her loan in more bottles of beer, tables, and chairs for her establishment. She hopes to serve more customers and acquire more income to cover the family expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase bottles of beer, tables, and chairs for her establishment.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Twenty-five year-old Ruth is a married woman with 2 young children. Her oldest child is only 2 years old.

Ruth is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 5 years. Her husband is also a farmer and mainly manages the farm. Ruth helps in preparing the land for crops. Like any other mother, Ruth wants her family to be happy and healthy always.

Ruth's loan will be used to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies. In the future, Ruth hopes for a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Najjembe Women's Group B, Lugazi

texts.en:
Faraziah K. is the leader of Najjembe Women’s Group B in Lugazi. She is 40 years old and married with six children, five of whom are still in school. For the past 13 years, Faraziah has run a hotel catering service in Najjembe. Because she is so hardworking and reliable with good customer service, Faraziah is able to make 240,000 UGX in monthly profit. She started her business after dropping out of school. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying raw ingredients to prepare a variety of dishes for her customers.

In the future, Faraziah hopes to better educate her children and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare a variety of dishes

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en: Thorng T. is 41 years old and a married woman. She is a recycling seller. She often buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other provinces or countries. The used goods she deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Her husband is a horse cart deliverer. They are humble parents who has been blessed with a lovely young child. Thorng T. has inherited a piece of farmland from her grandparents. In addition, she hopes to grow various crops on her own land. Due to lack of money, Thorng T. decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as seeds, a pumping machine, and other supplies to begin a farming business. Thorng T. and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a pumping machine, and other supplies to begin a farming business.

loans.name: Amparo Justina

texts.es: Amparo casada mujer trabajadora, honesta, humilde. Su esposo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Sus hijos estudiantes. Tiene su propio negocio venta de tortilla y nacatamales desde hace un tiempo lo tiene siendo e ingreso al hogar. Lo inicio con fondo propios requiere aumentar sus ventas ya que tiene proyecto de mejorar su vivienda. El préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como. Cemento, hierro, bloques, piedras cantera, arena, piedrín, estribu, reglones de madera, para levantar una pared de la casa. Obteniendo seguridad para su familia y negocio.
texts.en:
Amparo is a hardworking, honest, and humble woman. She is married; her husband works and helps her economically. Her children are students. She has her own business where she sells tortillas and nacatamales (a Nicaraguan dish), which has been a source of income for her household for some time. Amparo started this business with her own funds and would like to increase her sales because she has a plan to make some improvements in her home. 

The loan will be used to purchase construction materials for building a wall -- sand, concrete blocks, gravel, cement, wooden beams and others. These home improvements will allow Amparo to provide greater comfort and safety for her family and for her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a wall

loans.name: Lila Gloria

texts.es:
Lila  madre de familia de 51 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposo e hijos, la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de la Victoria que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracterizan por su agricultura  y la mayoría son choferes de transporte público que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Lila se dedica  a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, azúcar, arroz, detergente,  frugos,  golosinas, etc.), negocio que a colocado en su domicilio, en la cual sus  vecinos encuentran toda clase de productos comestibles, también se dedica a a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) una vez que los engorda y en su edad ideal los  vende en los distintos mercados de su zona y con los ingresos de ambos negocios que tiene trata en lo posible de brindar  un mejor nivel de vida para su familia.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Lila trata de adquirir un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para resalizar algunos acabados en su casa, como la parte posterior de la misma para que esté más seguro su hogar,  al incrementarse sus ventas en ambas actividades podrá cubrir su crédito como para seguir solventando sus obligaciones familiares.  Lila es una madre que con esfuerzo y trabajo trata que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Lila, 51, is a mother living in her own house with her husband and children.  The house has both water and electricity.  It is located in the rural part of La Victoria District which belongs to Chiclayo Province.   This zone is notedfor its agriculture and most residents are public transportation providers.

Lila sells basic need items (milk, sugar, rice, detergent, Frugo brand beverages, snacks, etc.)  The store is located in her home and her neighbors find  all kinds of foodstuffs there  She also raises sheep to sell. Once she fattens them up to ideal weight she sells them in the various markets in her area and uses income from both businesses to try to provide a better standard of living for her family.

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, Lila tries to acquire a 1000 new sol loan to do some home improvements, like in the rear, for example, to provide more security.  

Increasing sales in both businesses will make it possible for her to repay the loan while still meeting her family obligations.  Lila is a mother who, with effort and hard work, tries to move her family forward.

loans.use: to do some improvements to the rear of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a food stall for his prepared foods business.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines with his wife and three children. For the last five years, he has made a living by providing taxi services and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for maintenance of his vehicle. Eric has been a member of HSPFI since 2007 and is making good use of his membership to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old, married, and a father of two children who are one and three years of age. He is in the transport business and also runs a tailoring business in Kilifi. His business has been in operation for the last four years and has been a success. 

James has been a KADET client and this is his second loan to finance his business. With this loan he plans to service his tuk tuk and use the remaining amount to purchase cloth materials for tailoring. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. James' dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to service his tuk tuk and to purchase cloth materials for tailoring with the remaining amount

loans.name: Nicida

texts.es: Nicida, natural de Pampahuasi caserío del distrito de San M. de 21 años de edad, convive con Edmundo de 25 años y  fruto de ese romance tienen 02 hijos por quienes se esmeran a diario para darle lo mejor. Nicida es una madre joven, lucha por sabre salir adelante con su puesto de trabajo. Ella es comerciante y tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en su comunidad. La bodega de Nicida es muy frecuentado por sus compradores porque ella las atiende con mucha cordialidad. Es así que apertura las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores. Lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias ampliando su puesto de ventas. Este será su segundo crédito de Nicida y esta muy contenta de saber que una vez más contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes ya que le será de gran utilidad para seguir prosperando y se siente muy acorde trabajar con los socios de su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará, sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche y conservas.
texts.en:
Nicida is 21 years old and a native of Pampahuasi, a settlement in the San M. district.  She lives with 25 year old Edmundo and they have two children for whom they work hard to provide with the best.  Nicida is a young mother and struggles to get ahead in her work.  She is a merchant and has a grocery store in the community.

Nicida’s store is well frequented by her customers because she serves them with great friendliness.  She opens her doors very early in the morning and is ready to receive her first customers.  They know of the variety of merchandise she sells, so they have no problem buying from her, because they know that she will have the items they need.  What she enjoys most is talking with her clients.  This is one of the skills she employs to gain more customers.

She’s been doing this for four years and she considers the most challenging part to be having to be on her feet almost all day.  She will use the money from this loan to buy foodstuff to stock her store.  She would like to expand her sales by expanding her point of sale.

This will be her second loan and she is very happy to know that she can once again count on the support of all of you, because it will be very helpful to her.  She also feels very happy to be working with the members of the communal bank.  She will use the money from this 2,000 PEN loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, milk, and preserves.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother). 

Matilda has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Matilda sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested for a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings, from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenge(s) for Matilda include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell by wholesale only. 

Matilda lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity and she doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y sus hijos ya independientes, administra una cafetería y una venta D. hotdog,  negocios que surgieron por su propia iniciativa, trabaja todos los días y no tiene un horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella nesecita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería necesaria para la cafetería y la venta D. hotdog como lo son salchichas, aderesos, pan, cafe, gaseosas y jugos, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar el inventario del negocio y sus ingresos.
Su objetivo es poner varias ventas D. hotdog para ser una micro empresaria y mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and children who are now independent.  She runs a cafeteria and sells hotdogs.  The businesses arose through her own initiative.  She works every day and does not have a fixed schedule to take care of customers.

She needs a loan to buy needed merchandise for the cafeteria and hotdog sales like: sausages, dressings, bread, coffee, soft-drinks and juice.  This purchase will help her increase the business’ inventory and her income.

Her goal is to set up several hotdog stands and become a micro businesswoman and to improve her income for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her café.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 20 years of age. She is single and is rearing her two little kids. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Two years ago, she engaged in a retail business venture to make a living. The store caters to the local market's demands for everyday living. She earns 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from business operations.

Earlier this year, Analyn joined GDMPC to momentarily finance her business. She borrowed PHP 5,000 from the cooperative to purchase daily-use commodities to sell in local community. She hopes that by offering more products to choose from, she can get a good return of investment and thereby expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase daily-use commodities to sell.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a married man with three children.  To earn a living, he runs a retail shop.  He has operated the business for two years.  He has been able to grow the business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because he has been trained in business management skills.

Dominic hopes to expand his business into wholesale in five years.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, salt and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, salt and maize flour.

loans.name: Almida

texts.en:
Almida, age 58, has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon to offer for sale. 

She and her husband have one child.

Almida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Almida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon to offer for sale

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is requesting another Kiva loan of 40,0000 KES to purchase more goats.  She will fatten and sell them at a higher price. 

She dreams of expanding her business opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats to fatten and sale.

loans.name: Marlon Ivan

texts.es:
Marlon Ivan es un señor trabajador y emprendedor quien tiene una pequeño taller de metalúrgica desde hace 15 años. Este negocio lo inicio poco a poco  ahora trabaja junto con un sobrino.
El con el crédito comprara herramientas y materiales para realizar unos trabajos.
texts.en:
Marlon Ivan is a hardworking and enterprising man who has had a small metal workshop for the last 15 years. He set this business up little by little and now works alongside his nephew.

With the loan he will buy tools and materials to undertake some jobs.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment for his metal workshop.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: La socia actualmente tiene 39 años de edad; las edades de sus hijos son 23, 14, 7 años de edad; la socia ahora abrio un salon de belleza, ella alterna las dos actividades que tiene y desea invertir el credito en la compra de maíz amarillo una parte para hacer jora y la otra en la compra de articulos para el salon de belleza, la socia también en su espacio determinara un area para poner articulos de bazar como adornos, peluches, papel de regalo y otros. La socia principalmente desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de maíz amarilo y en la compra de articulos para el salon de belleza.
texts.en:
The member is currently 39 years old; her children are 23, 14, and 7.

Gladis now has opened a beauty salon.  She alternates her two jobs and wants to use one part of the loan to buy yellow corn to make "jora" [fermented corn], and the other part to buy supplies for her beauty salon.  She also will choose an area in her space to put miscellaneous goods like decorations, stuffed animals, wrapping paper, and other things.

She wants to use the loan primarily to buy yellow corn and merchandise for her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy yellow corn and merchandise for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca, 61, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. A widow, she manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to support the education of her two children who are both in high school

Francisca maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers count on for their income. Aside from direct selling, she sells processed meat. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 5,000 in sales every week.

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 36,000 that will help her to continue her business. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. 

Francisca dreams that her business will continue to grow and she will have more sales. She hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies and enjoy a good life. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación se unieron con el propósito de salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas. El trabajo en equipo es lo principal, por lo que ellas siempre se esfuerzan al máximo para lograr sus objetivos. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. 
Mirta es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos hace ya un buen tiempo. Por medio de este trabajo ella puede cubrir sus gastos y también los de su familia. Ella dice que debido a su amabilidad y buena atención ha logrado salir adelante y lograr sus metas. Desea seguir con su emprendimiento y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de más cosméticos, con lo cual podrá cumplir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Esta muy agradecida a la fundación y a kiva por la gran oportunidad que le, pues esta es la única forma para poder progresar.
texts.en:
Sixteen women from the city of Encarnación meet with the intention of getting ahead by all of them working together.  Working as a team is of primary importance.  That is why they always put forth their maximum efforts in order to achieve their objectives.  They are currently in the second cycle of the enterprising women’s program with the Fundación Paraguaya.

Mirta is one of the members of the group.  She says that she has been selling cosmetics for a good amount of time.  Through this work she is able to cover her expenses and those of her family.  She says that due to her kindness and good service she has managed to get ahead and achieve her goals.

She wishes to continue her enterprise.  That is why she is requesting the loan to buy more cosmetics.  Then she will be able to meet her customers’ demand.

She is very grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the great opportunity.  This is the only way she will be able to advance.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Birashoboka 1 Group

texts.fr:
Joselyne est une commerçante âgé de 32 ans qui habite la localité de  Gasenyi en Mairie de Bujumbura . Elle est vendeuse  de divers produits commes des limonades, du lait et le télephone public depuis 10 ans, un métier qu’elle commence alors qu’elle était boutiquière. Elle a fait ses études jusq’en 6è année primaire. Elle est mariée à Alphonse qui est un maçon et ont ensemble 3 enfants qui étudient.
Le crédit Kiva de 250,000 francs burundais q’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de caisse de fanta ainsi qu’une grande quantité de lait à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses economies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire BIRASHOBOKA 1
texts.en:
Joselyne is a 32-year-old saleswoman living in the town of Gasenyi in the Bujumbura Mairie province.  For 10 years, she has worked selling various items like soft drinks and milk and running a public telephone - a career path she started on when she was working in a boutique.  She completed her education through the 6th year of elementary school.  She is married to Alphonse, a builder, and together they have 3 children who all attend school.  This Kiva loan of 250,000 Burundi francs that she is receiving will enable her increase her capital to purchase a large quantity of cases of Fanta, as well as a large quantity of milk for retail sale in order to make significant profits and increase her savings.

She is a member of the community group Birashoboka 1.

loans.use: to increase her capital for purchasing a large quantity of boxes of Fanta, and of milk for retail sale, in order to make significant profits and increase her savings

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 44 years old, married and has two children. For the last eight years, she has worked hard at earning a living by running a sari sari or variety store in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 through NWTF and Kiva to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell to her customers. This is her sixth loan, and she has repaid the previous five fully and on time. Her goal for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers/

loans.name: Bester

texts.en: Bester is 32 years old, widowed, with two children aged 11 and 9 all are still going to school.She also takes care of her three young sisters. Bester is into Buying and selling clothes business in and around Masvingo.She has requesting for a loan of $1 000.00 to buy clothes for resale.She has been in business for eight years and has one employee.She says challenges being faced are of high import duty as she import her products from South Africa.With the extra income she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.Bester is planning to have bigger shop in Masvingo town.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Amalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Amalia del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora propietaria de una panadería. Este negocio lo inicio su papá quien al morir ella junto a su esposo y mamá siguió con el negocio. 
El cual en estos ocho años se ha ido desarrollando ampliamente ahora venden mayor cantidad de producto. Ella invertirá el crédito en materia prima harina, azúcar, moldes…etc.
texts.en:
Amalia del Carmen is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a bakery. Her father started the business and when he died, she, together with her husband and her mother, continued running it.

The business has expanded a great deal during these eight years and they now sell a greater variety of products. Amalia will invest the loan in basic materials such as flour, sugar, molds…etc.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies: flour, sugar, molds....etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, continua con su negocio de venta de cosa de horno, el cual la hace de forma ambulante, cada dia se ubica en el mismo lugar, en donde ah  captado su clientela, hoy en dia tiene su pareja, el cual apoya economicamente, labora como mecanico automotriz, sus hijos tambien trabajando.
Como meta es ir reparando su casa, con esta nuevo prestamo invertira en la compra cosa de horno, y tarros de leche en polvo el cual se vende mucho, siendo de alto consumo para las madres.y que espera obtener buenos resultado en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is continuing with her business selling baked goods as a traveling salesperson. Each day she goes to the same place, where she has gained many customers. Right now her husband, who helps support her financially, works as an automotive mechanic, and their children are also working. 

Her goal is to fix up her house. With this new loan she will buy baked goods and cans of powdered milk, which she sells a lot of due to its high consumption among mothers. She hopes to get good results from her sales.

loans.use: to buy more products to make baked goods and to purchase cans of powdered milk, which sell very well.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a 40-year-old married woman with seven children between the ages of 3 and 19. Bebiana's husband works as a farmer.

Bebiana sells food items in her community. She makes banana and camote (sweet potato) cues (fried snacks with caramelized brown sugar) to sell. She also sells friend peanuts. Bebiana has been in this business for two years. She earns 2,000 PHP per month. She plans to use her loan to buy more ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and bananas. Bebiana hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and bananas

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: This is Sallay, who is 28 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 4. In 2012, Sallay established her grocery shop business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of their home. Sallay's business is located on the outskirts of town, and her main customers are all classes of people. Working 7 days a week, 10 hours a day, Sallay earns about 600,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from her business. She needs a loan of Le5,000,000 in order to purchase more bags of sugar,bottles of mayonnaise, milk powder, ovaltine,etc for resale to meet the demand of her customers in the community in which she operates. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her stock levels and also her profit. In the future, Sallay plans to extend her shop and begin bar and restaurant services. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijas de 15, 14 y 11 años de edad. Él es un hombre que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad siempre ha logrado sostener la economía de su hogar, prestando sus servicios en una venta de madera, actividad que realiza desde hace 14 años. Roberto desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que considera que las láminas de la misma ya terminaron su vida útil porque cuando llueve se observan filtraciones que deterioran sus pocas pertenencias. Roberto sabe que para cambiar el techo de su vivienda necesita realizar una inversión económica con la que él no cuenta, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.

loans.use: Para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Ten years ago Isabel started her electrodomestic sales business because she had to support in her family economy and also widen her home. She is a very active woman and entrepreneur; she is married and her husband is a mechanic, they have five sons and all of them are married as well. When she started her business she did it as a raffle but actually she sells her products by credit and has a portfolio of almost 100 clients, with the incomes of her business she could buy a truck as a work tool because she now can transport her merchandise. Isabel is requesting for a loan of US$ 925 to purchase merchandise and be prepared for Christmas season when her sales increase.

**\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Hace 10 años que Isabel inició su negocio de venta de artículos electrodomésticos, con la intención de ayudar en la economía familiar y para poder ampliar su casa. Ella es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora, esta casada, su esposo es mecánico y tienen cinco hijos, ya todos casados. Cuando inició lo hizo a través de rifas y tandas, actualmente vende sus productos a crédito y tiene una cartera de casi 100 clientes, con los ingresos de su negocio se compró una camioneta que le sirve para transportar sus mercancías. Solicita un crédito por $ 925 USD para comprar mercancías y estar preparada para la próxima temporada navideña en donde se incrementan sus ventas, piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Antie Betty (lady in cap) sells cooking oils, fresh okra and local green peppers in the community's market. She requests a loan of $500.00 so she can open her own shed in the market where she can sell her goods in the same spot and have more returning customers. she has been a good standing client of Kraban Support Foundation for the past 5 years.

loans.use: Open a stall in the market

loans.name: Nasir Ahamad

texts.en: N. Ahamad lives in District 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a man who is very talented and educated but he doesn’t like to work in the government. He prefers business and he has a general store but he is faced with economical problems in his shop. He wants to take a loan to expand his business and buy more inventory items like bags of sweets and boxes of chocolates in twin-packs and triple-packs. He wants to be a great business dealer and he hopes that he can do something with this loan.

loans.use: To buy extra inventory items

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Mamami and her 18-year-old son live in their own home in the Cotahuma neighborhood on the west side of La Paz. Nine years ago, they lost their home in a landslide. The municipality gave them a lot on which she built a small home using her own savings and, since 2000, IMPRO loans. She has a small grocery store in her home, the revenues of which support her and her son. This loan will pay the legal costs of formalizing the deed to the property. Rosa is a preferred borrower, and this is her seventh loan from IMPRO.

Tranlsated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosa M. vive en casa propia en la zona de Cotahuma, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de la Paz con su hijo de 18 años; a causa de un deslizamiento ocurrido hace nueve años atrás, Rosa perdió su vivienda, por lo que el gobierno municipal le otorgó un lote de terreno en el que ella hizo construir una pequeña casa haciendo uso de sus ahorros y con créditos otorgados por impro desde el año 2000. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, que le proporciona los ingresos para la familia. El crédito que solicita es para cubrir los costos del trámite de legalización final del terreno sobre el cual Rosa construyo su casa. Este es el séptimo crédito y sus antecedentes históricos con Impro, la califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Real Estate legal documents

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is married and she has three children, they have motivated her to continue with the family business. It’s a furniture store that has been in the family for three generations. The business was going through some difficult times, but thanks to the good work that she realizes she has managed to keep the furniture store running. Now she wants to increase the variety of furniture that she sells; for this reason she is requesting a loan of $750 that will help to keep her business growing.

Maria is a very responsible woman and she promises to repay the loan in 6 months. The desire to see her daughters finish their studies and have a better future has motivated her to do better everyday. Now with your help she will be able to achieve it. Thanks for the trust and support that you offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es casada y tiene tres hijos, ellos la han motivado para continuar con el negocio familiar, es una mueblería que tiene ya tres generaciones, pasaba por épocas difíciles pero gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ha logrado sacar adelante la mueblería y ahora desea incrementar la variedad de muebles que comercializa para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares, con lo que podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio.

Maria es una mujer muy responsable y se compromete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. El deseo de que sus hijas puedan culminar sus estudios y tener un mejor futuro la motivan a mejorar cada día y ahora con tu ayuda podrá lograrlo, muchas gracias por la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero O. is a 43 year old married woman with 4 children and lives in Benin City.  She operates a bar business where she sells drinks and pepper soup.  She is requesting a loan to enable her to grow her business. She has been in this business for 1 year and she is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, meat & pepper soup

loans.name: Noheddin

texts.en: Noheddin E. is a taxi cab driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He has been working in this business for the last 10 years and lives in Devechi with his wife and two children. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,000 so that he can make some much-needed repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi cab

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
For a long time Olga Leticia and her husband, Julián, lived off of his pension. This money was not enough to cover their spending and their household expenses. For this reason Olga started to sell second-hand clothing. During the winter she went to Mexico to buy toys for the season and that is when she realized that toys sold easier than clothing. Little by little she built up a customer base that seeks her out to buy toys.

Her customers are now asking Olga for new products that she does not have to sell. For this reason Olga is requesting a loan of $850 that she is prepared to repay over 6 months. With this money she will be able to stock her store with new toys so that she will have a wider variety of products to offer her clients. With your help Olga will be able to make her business a success and thus gather enough money to cover her and her husband's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Olga Leticia y su esposo vivían hace tiempo de lo que Julián (su esposo) recibía de la pensión, sin embargo ese dinero no es suficiente como para pagar los gastos de los dos y de su casa. Es por eso que Olga comenzó a vender ropa de segunda, sin embargo en la temporada de invierno se iba a México a comprar juguetes para la temporada de invierno, y fue ahí donde se dio cuenta que los juguetes se venden mejor. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes que la buscan para comprarle los juguetes.

Sin embargo le están pidiendo nuevos productos a Olga que no tiene. Es por eso que Olga está solicitando un crédito de US $850 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder surtir su negocio con juguetes nuevos para poder tener variedad para sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Olga podrá sacar adelante su negocio y así juntar dinero para los gastos de ella y su esposo.

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Kabojja A1(A) Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 30-years-old, married with four children. She currently has a retail shop business but wants to use the KIVA loan to start a livestock farm. Halima and Teddy both have hotel businesses and want to use the loan to buy hotel furniture and food warmers. Stella wants to complete the poultry house with the loan. Cissy has a restaurant business and wants to use the loan to buy more soft drinks and a refrigerator.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase livestock, hotel and restaurant furniture and equipment.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
A. Habil is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Aghdam. He is married and has 3 children. Habil makes money for living from the small garage that you see on photo. He is an expert mechanic and a retailer at the same time. Some of his clients offer him cheap used cars that need to be fixed. So, after buying these cars, he purchases used spare parts and fixes what needs to be fixed. His garage neighbor, Zaur, doesn’t charge Habil for painting his cars. This way, Habil reduces his expenses to a minimum, which gives him greater income.

He needs this loan to buy some new spare parts for the car he purchased a week ago because it is sometimes difficult to find specific used spare parts.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for auto repair and reselling business

loans.name: Cristina Del Pilar

texts.es:
Cristina is a young, 29-year-old woman who has worked managing her mini-bazaar for two years. Previously, she worked selling electronic devices in a store until it went bankrupt. Upon finding herself without a job, she decided to open a store. She started with little, selling only some groceries, until she was able to obtain what she has today with much effort.

She has studied computer applications and English. Besides attending to her business, she also works as a cosmetics consultant. She invests the income from her two jobs back into her business, since she is still single and doesn't have a lot of expenses. She hopes to be able to have enough money to have a mini-market in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cristina es una joven de veintinueve años que desde hace dos años trabaja en el manejo de su mini bazar. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como vendedora de artefactos eléctricos en una tienda hasta que ésta quebró. Al verse sin trabajo decidió abrir una tienda. Empezó de a pocos vendiendo solamente algunos abarrotes hasta obtener con mucho esfuerzo lo que hoy tiene.

Ella ha estudiado computación e inglés. Aparte de atender en su negocio también trabaja como consultora de cosméticos. Los ingresos de sus dos trabajos los vuelve a invertir, pues aun ella es soltera y no tiene muchos gastos dentro de su hogar. Ella espera en un futuro poder tener el dinero suficiente para tener un minimarket.

loans.use: To expand the location of her store

loans.name: Benkoma Iii Group

texts.en: Mohamed Makie J. is the leader of Benkoma group.  He is 57 years old and married with more than 7 children.  He is well respected in the community for his efforts to encourage youth to engage in agricultural production.  The group members are also the members of the village bank.  To increase their rice production, the group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 for farm inputs.

loans.use: The Benkoma III group is wanting to increase their production of rice this coming season and need additonal capital in order to do so.

loans.name: Zulfiya.

texts.ru:
Zulfiya H. lives in Rudaki. She is 20 years old, married. She has a secondary education. For the last three years Zulfiya has been baking pies at home. She sells them at the local market, where she has a permanent client base. She selling her pies at a reduced price. The client lives with her elderly parents, and is the sole breadwinner for the family. Zulfiya needs an electric oven to make her baked goods. This is why she decided to take out a loan. She plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva translator.

Хатамова Зульфия жительница района Рудаки. Возраст 20 лет, замужем.Образовагние среднее.Зульфия вот уже 3 года занимается выпечкой пирожков у себя дома. Реялизует свою продукцию на местном рынке, где имеет постоянных клиентов. Так как Зульфия продает свою продукцию намного дешевле других.Клиентка живет с престарелыми родителями и является единственной кормилицей в семье. Зульфия нужна элнктро-духовка для выпечки хлебо-булочных изделий. Для чего она решила взять кредит . Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of an oven

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamed is 41 years old, the father of two children and lives in the suburbs of Saida in south  Lebanon. Mohamed owns a coffee shop, and has used previous loans from Al Majmoua to start his business and improve it. He now needs a loan of $1,200 to buy aluminum display windows for his shop. This is a step up because it will allow Mohamed to attract more clients. Mohamed has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past two years and has always made payments on time.

loans.use: To buy aluminum display windows for his shop

loans.name: Lightness

texts.en:
Lightness, a 30-year-old divorced woman with two children aged eight and three, owns a small stock of poultry as well as a tailoring business, which she started in 2001. Daily she works from 7:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Lightness now hopes for a loan to buy more poultry for her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of poultry.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Guadalupe M. C. is 42 years old and lives with her partner. Guadalupe has two children. One is 20 years old and has special needs, due to a cerebral lesion. Her other son is 18 years old and is in his first year of university. Guadalupe's partner works as a driver in the city of Leon. Guadalupe sells new clothing, including pants, shirts, and Masaya footwear. Guadalupe's business started as an alternative to unemployment and a way to help with household expenses. She buys supplies in Managua and sells in the markets of Leon. She also sells on credit to her neighbors. Guadalupe's greatest wish is to get ahead with her disabled son, and she'd like to do this by installing a store in her home so that she can spend more time with her family. With loans she's been able to raise capital, giving her the opportunity to familiarize herself with local markets.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Guadalupe M. C., tiene 42 años de edad, vive en union de hecho estable es decir acompañada, tiene dos hijos, uno de 20 años de edad el cual posee capacidades diferentes ya que tiene una lesion cerebral, y su otro hijo tiene 18 años de edad actualemnte cursa el primer año de la universidad, su compañero de vida trabaja como chofer de ruta urbana en leon, La actividad economica de la señora es la venta de ropa nueva como pantalosn, camisas y calzado masaya, la cual lleva acabo de forma ambulante, compra en managua y entrega a clientes de los mercados y al credito en su sector domiciliar, tiene seis años de tener dicho negocio, su mayor anhelo en la vida es poder salir adelante con su hijo enfermito, su sueño es poder instalar una tiena en su domicilio de esta manera estar mas cerca a su familia. Dicha actividad surge como una alternativa al desempleo y una manera de aportar con los gastos del hogar, con los creditos ha podido crecer en capital y se ha dado a conocer en los mercados como comerciante

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Kunthea S., 24, crushes papayas (a Khmer food that is popular for ladies). She sells to customers in her area, and makes around $4 USD per day. She has two children, both of whom are in school. Her husband, Mr. Buntha Khim, 29, helps with this business. Mrs. Kunthea’s income is insufficient for her family; she wants to start a new business selling groceries in the market, but she lacks the capital to do so. Hence, she requests a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase a small store for selling groceries in Kampong Thom Market. They live in Kampong Krobav Commune, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a small store for selling groceries

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miriam del Socorro se dedica a la labor de venta de queso en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Estelí. Es muy visitada por muchos clientes por la razón de que vende gran variedad de quesos a gusto de sus clientes.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la señora Miriam atraviesa la necesidad de obtener el recurso económico para la compra del queso y por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra del producto para comercializarlo. Actualmente se ha perfilado como fiel cliente de Ceprodel ya que anteriormente ha tenido tres créditos los cuales todos han sido pagados satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Miriam del Socorro is dedicated to the work of selling cheese in her home in the city of Esteli. It is visited by many customers because she sells a large variety of cheeses enjoyed by her customers. Like any developing businesses, Ms. Miriam experiences the need to obtain economic resources for the purchase of cheese and for this reason she is seeking support from Ceprodel to get a loan that allows her to purchase product to market and sell. To this day she has been a faithful client of Ceprodel; she has previously had three loans, all of which have been paid off satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese

loans.name: Dalila Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Dalila tiene 54 años de edad, es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Fuente de Vida y vive en el Pasaje Jhon Kenedy 113 El Cortijo, distrito y provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria, pero se casó y ya no continuó sus estudios. Tiene 5 hijos, sólo dos dependen de ella porque son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la confección y venta de camisas y blusas, esta actividad lo realiza en su casa  y también en otras provincias.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas compró una máquina de coser.
Con este crédito de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará telas para hacer blusas y algunos insumos para navidad.
texts.en:
Dalila is 54 years old and the president of the communal bank “Fuente de Vida” (“Fountain of Life”). She lives in El Cortijo, Trujillo, located in the La Libertad region of Perú. She studied to the third year of secondary school, but she then married and did not complete her education. She has five children, two of whom still depend on her and are students. Her business consists of making and selling shirts and blouses, an activity she carries out in her house and also in other provinces. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, which was paid in four installments, she purchased a sewing machine. With this loan of 800.00 soles, to be repaid in six months, she will buy fabrics to make shirts as well as some supplies for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and supplies for Christmas.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
El negocio de venta de ropa en toda época requiere de la inversión en la compra de este producto para ofrecerlo ya que si no se realiza de esta manera por lo general los clientes deciden comprar la ropa en otro establecimiento. Muy consciente de esta situación, la señora María A. se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado Central de Chinandega donde atiende con muchísimo esfuerzo con el propósito de sobrevivir en la vida.

Para salir adelante ha buscado el apoyo brindado por Ceprodel para que le permita la compra de la ropa y así comercializarla en su establecimiento de ventas en el mercado de la ciudad de Chinandega.
texts.en:
The sale of clothing for all seasons is an effort that requires an investment into products to offer to customers, otherwise they will decide to go elsewhere to make their purchases. Very conscious of this situation, María A. dedicates herself to selling clothing at the Central Market of Chinandega where she tends to her business with great care hoping to triumph in life. To get ahead, she has sought the support of Ceprodel which allows her to buy the clothing and then market her wares in her establishment at the market of the city of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Zokhra

texts.en: Zohra is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region of Zobchug village. She is the mother of 5 children. Five years ago she started a dairy business. She was born in 1960. Now she needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy a cow for improving her dairy business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to improve her dairy business

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA ANA RUTH V. D. A.  D. 36 AÑOS D. EDAD,   TIENE UN  PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EN  ILOPANGO.    ELLA SE DEDICA A  LA ELABORACION D.  PAN DULCE Y PAN FRANCES. AMBOS CONSIDERADOS PARTE DEL MENU QUE A DIARIO SABOREAN LOS SALVADOREÑOS. 

 ESTA COSTUMBRE SE DELEITA GENERALMENTE POR LAS MAÑANAS Y LAS TARDES;  SIN EMBARGO  PARA LA PRODUCCION D. ESTOS PRODUCTOS SE REQUIERE D. MAQUINARIA D. ALTO COSTO; RAZON POR LA QUE DOÑA RUTH  LA QUE  HA SOLICITADO CREDITO A  INTEGRAL.

DOÑA RUTH CON SU EXPERENCIA CREDITICIA Y LABORAL EN LA PANIFICACION  DESEA  ADQUIRIR UN HORNO CON MAYOR CAPACIDAD PARA HACER MAS PAN, PRODUCTO D. GRAN DEMANDA EN EL PAIS. Y POR LO TANTO OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS Y MEJORAR ASI EL NIVEL D. VIDA D. SUS DOS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS. ADEMAS D. APOYAR ECONOMICAMENTE A SU ESPOSO QUIEN SE DEDICA AL NEGOCIO AMBULANTE.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth V. D. A. is 36 years old. She has a small business in Ilopango making sweet rolls and French bread, both of which are considered part of the daily menu of Salvadoreans. She generally enjoys doing this in the mornings and the afternoons. However, producing these goods requires an expensive machine, which is the reason that Doña Ruth has requested a loan from Integral. Doña Ruth, with her credit history and experience making baked goods, would like to buy an oven with greater capacity so she can make more bread, which is a product in great demand in the country. This way she can make more earnings and improve the quality of life of her two small children as well as financially help her husband, who is a traveling salesman.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an oven.

loans.name: Pelba

texts.en:
Pelba T. grows rice for a living. She is 55 years old and has 4 children. She and her husband till their 4 hectares of land to support their family. Their harvest is for family use; what remains is sold to rice traders in order to add their family's income. Her children are studying; she has to budget her money to make sure that she can pay for their tuition and books. She and her husband work very hard to give their children a good future. 

She is asking a CEVI loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to increase her yield. The loan will truly help her increase her harvest. It will also help her start another business to augment her family's income.

CEVI gives entrepreneurs like Pelba a chance to start and sustain their businesses. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Mugamba Hellen is the leader of the Main Street Group in Jinja. She is a young businesswoman who sells used shoes, mostly for ladies and children, that she displays in a stall outside a shop in Jinja. This is her second loan with the group. The first one helped her increase the stock of shoes that she sells.

Hellen is still a student pursuing her dream career. Her shop has helped her so much during her school times with school fees and upkeep. She hopes that if she ever finds a job, she will keep her shoe-selling business by employing someone to manage it. She needs a loan to help buy more shoes from Jinja and Kampala to sell.

loans.use: Buying more shoes to sell

loans.name: Rokhaya's Group

texts.fr: Réunues au sein d'un groupe dénommé TAKKU LIGGEY DIALMA2 elles s'activent dans le commerce de detail depuis plusieurs années .Chacune d'elle vend de peitits objets .les revenus tiré de leurs activité leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins familliaux paiement de frais médicaux pour les enfants et pour elles .elles sollicitent ce pret pour renforcer leurs activités de commerce  .
texts.en:
For several years, these women have worked together selling small items within a group called TAKKU LIGGEY DIALMA2. The income generated from their business activities allows them to provide for family needs, including the payment of medical expenses for themselves and their children. They are requesting this loan to strengthen their retail business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Married with five children, Rano sells nice quality fabrics for national dresses in a large local market. Her family is actively helping her with the business which she started about 15 years ago. Rano is requesting a loan of $800 to increase her inventory which will help supply her until the spring season. She believes this timely investment will help generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Rano’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad Group

texts.en: Ahmad is the group leader of the Ahmad group. There are three members in this group and each wants a loan to expand her/his business. Ahmad wants a loan for a general store; he would like to expand his business and buy some more materials to attract more clients. Zaher Ghuan wants a loan for her husband who has a general store; he wants to expand his business and buy more materials, especially  things that are more in demand. Nafesa Gul wants a loan for her fruit and vegetable cart business. They request a group of loan 42000 Afghani for a term of 10 months.  They are very happy about this process of small loans in Afghanistan and want especially want to thank the Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: for expanding business

loans.name: Rocio Del Carmen

texts.es:
ROCIO del CARMEN O. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL ÉXITO-CAF” con domicilio en la Urb. JJ MUÑOS Mz.F Lt.12, tiene 33 años, 03 hijos (2 de ellos menores), y su esposo tiene una chacra donde trabaja diariamente.

Tenía un negocio de venta de pescado y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 1 1/2 año, con este dinero compro un triciclo para vender pan y abarrotes, con ello afianzo su negocio.

Actualmente  continúa con el negocio de venta de panes  y con este préstamo  de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de una vitrina mas grande para exhibir sus panes así como en la compra de harinas y  otros insumos necesarios para que trabaje y crezca su negocio. 

Pese al poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, gracias a ello puede ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y sobre todo aportar en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
ROCIO del CARMEN O. G., is a client of the Community Bank “RUMBO AL ÉXITO-CAF." She lives in Urb. JJ MUÑOS Mz.F Lt.12, is 33 years old, and has 3 children (2 are minors). Her husband has a farm, where he works every day.

Rocio had a business selling fish. She received her first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles a year and a half ago, and with this money purchased a bicycle cart to sell bread and groceries, which financed her business.

Currently, Rocio continues selling bread. With this loan of S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in a larger display case to exhibit her bread, and also in the purchase of flour and other ingredients that she needs in order to work and grow her business.

Despite the short time she has been with Manuela Ramos, Rocio is happy with the help she gives for women to succeed. Thanks to this assistance, Rocio can help her husband and children, and above all can contribure to their home finances.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case, and ingredients like flour and others.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
S. Pich, 33, produces carpets for the small income of $1 per day. Together Pich and her husband have eight children.

Pich's husband is involved in the business of selling blankets and nets in all the nearby provinces and places and earns a daily income of $6. She really wants to take a loan from Kiva of $1,200 to expand her husband’s business by purchasing more blankets and nets to sell. When more income is generated, she wants to eliminate the great difficulty with her family expenses.

Pich and her husband are photographed together with a pile of door carpets.

loans.use: To buy blankets and nets for her husband's business

loans.name: Medela

texts.en:
Medela S. is from the village of Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Medela is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Medela owns & operates a motor cab transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motor cab transport to local community members. Medela is just starting this business.

In 2004, Medela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Medela has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Medela is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Medela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to improve her general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Emilina

texts.en:
Emilina N. is from the village of Looc  Proper. She is 33 years old. Emilina is single. To make a living, Emilina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emilina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.
