In 1999, Emilina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Emilina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Emilina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 36 años y vive en Pomalca, un distrito cuyos pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de caña de azúcar y que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 6 años mantiene un pequeño puesto informal en los exteriores del mercado de Pomalca en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, especias y aderezos previamente preparados. Este único ingreso económico le ha permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar donde vive únicamente con su madre de 65 años de edad, quien debido a su avanzada edad depende de Sebastiana.

Ella está solicitando por primera vez un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles, los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de artículos de primera necesidad (aceite, arroz, azúcar, etc.), lo que le va a permitir ampliar su negocio y seguir ayudando a su madre por quien trata de salir adelante para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 36 years old and she lives in Pomalca, a district where the inhabitants mostly grow sugar canes for a living. It is located 15 minutes from the town of Chiclayo.

For 6 years she has had an informal stall outside the market of Pomalca where she sells vegetables, groceries, spices and previously prepared dressings. This her only income has allowed her to meet the needs of her home where she lives with her 65-year-old mother who depends on Sebastiana due to her advanced age.

For the first time she requests a loan of 800 nuevos soles, to be invested in buying basic necessities (cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc.) in order to improve business and keep supporting her mother as she wishes to get ahead in order to offer her a better life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities for sale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is single and independent. She is thirty - nine years. She trades in men’s foot wears. She sells her stock through 'hawking'(door-to-door selling) around her community and also treks to nearby markets to sell on market days. She has been in business for more than ten years and wants a loan to buy more quality and attractive shoes to serve her customers. Faustina believes she would be able to improve her income. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy shoes in bulk

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice makes a living through her business of buying used bottles and cans that she sells in the junk shops. She has been in this kind of business for more than two years. She is proud of her business and she believes that as long as she can provide her five children with their daily needs there is nothing she should be ashamed of with her business. 

She hopes that she will make her business more profitable, so she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000.00 from KIVA lenders to have additional capital.  The loan will be used to buy recyclable materials like cans, empty bottle, steel, plastics and other aluminum products that she will sell later on.  

Eunice is married to Eulgenio, a farmer.  They have five children: three of them are already studying. They live peacefully in the village of Arcon Tumauini, Isabela.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nita L. lives in Tikathali in the Lalitpur district of Nepal. Nita lives with her husband, brother-in-law and sister-in-law. Both her brother-in-law and sister-in-law are studying in secondary school.

Mrs. and Mr. L. opened a shop four years ago from which they sell gas and gas stoves. She is requesting a loan of 15000 NPR to add some gas cylinders to their shop to meet the increasing demands of their customers.

Nita wants to upgrade her family’s standard of living with all profits resulting from this loan.

loans.use: To stock gas cylinders in her shop

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita has been selling second hand clothes since 1998.She hopes to own a boutique in the future.She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell.She is 40 years old and married with 4 children.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Pov Kann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov K. is the village bank president. The group consists of eight people who live in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan, which is guaranteed by the group, for different purposes.

Mrs. Pov K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Reth Ra, is a fishnet maker. Although they work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Pov K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to improve her family's standard of living after she sells her cow.

Mrs. Pov K. has four children; two are fishermen and the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Koy Ton is presented in the picture with the other group members.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: B. Ingrid

texts.fr: Z. B. Ingrid est née en 1976 et vit depuis vingt ans à Sainte Cécile à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ATCHEFON Ahlonsou, un pêcheur, Ingrid est mère de trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le conjoint seul. Ingrid n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Ingrid vend des poissons frais dans son quartier à Sainte Cécile. Ingrid fait ses approvisionnements à la poissonnerie à Cotonou. Ingrid est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour renforcer son activité et agrandir sa clientèle, Ingrid sollicite un nouveau crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Ingrid Z. was born in 1976 and for the past twenty years she has lived in Sainte Cecile in Cotonou, the capital region of Benin. She is married to Ahlonsou Atchefon, a fisherman. Ingrid is the mother of three children, some of whom are attending school. The family's expenses are taken care of by her partner. Ingrid has never attended school. For the past fifteen years Ingrid has been selling fresh fish in Sainte Cecile. Ingrid purchases her products in the fish market of Cotonou. Ingrid is a long-time member of Alide (Kiva Field Partner) and she always repaid her loans. In order to support her business and to increase her clientele, Ingrid is requesting a loan from Alide.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cartons of fish.

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya is married with a son, Mykola. She is a small entrepreneur from the town of Khoost, Western Ukraine. Lesya runs a small business selling bicycles that are in high demand in their small town where very few people can afford to buy and own a car. Along with bicycles, she also sells different parts and accessories for them. Lesya works really hard to keep her business sustainable and running smoothly. Lesya has been operating for 2 years. Currently, she earns about 5,500 Grivnyas a month in net profit.

Lesya hopes to develop her business in the future. She is thinking about purchasing additional merchandise to facilitate her sales and business activity as a result. This time she is requesting a loan of 5,500 Grivnyas to help her offer a nicer variety of this type of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Mademoiselle A. owns a general store in the Hédzranawoe quarter of Lomé. She is single and has no children. She began her enterprise in 2004 and this will be her second loan with WAGES. She hopes to replenish her stock of supplies with this second loan.

She will buy 10 bags of rice, 18 bottles of oil, and other diverse products necessary to keep her business running smoothly. With the profits, she hopes to improve her personal wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, y con ella viven sus dos hijos y su esposo en su propia casa. Desde hace 6 años que tiene su tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, siendo más ventajoso haber instalado su puesto de venta en su propia casa, por lo que los ingresos que obtiene son necesarios para los gastos del hogar,  ya que el trabajo que realiza su esposo en el servicio de transporte no le da abasto pese a que tienen un auto que recientemente adquirieron gracias a un crédito que solicitó. Para Liz su trabajo le da mucha ventaja ya que puede dedicarse a su bebe y a su hijo que aún esta en el colegio, ya que lo más importante es brindarles una buena educación y formación, por tal motivo se siente muy contenta con lo que hace, y por lo que espera tener más estabilidad y mejorar poco a poco. En el futuro desea extender su tienda para que así pueda ofrecer artículos para el hogar y con ello cubrir la demanda de sus clientes que viven en la zona. Este es dieciochoavo préstamo con MFP y es considerada una líder dentro de su grupo comunal ya que ha demostrado responsabilidad en su trabajo. Con este crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para surtir su tienda y también para el nuevo espacio en donde podrá vender artículos para el hogar y para el cliente, ya que estando en temporada navideña están solicitando muchos regalos.
texts.en:
Liz is 32 years old and a hard-working woman who lives with her two children and her husband in her own house. For 6 years now she has had her own store, selling products of primary necessity. It was advantageous to install her business in her house. Her earnings are necessary for household expenses. The money her husband earns in public transport is not sufficient because he has just acquired an auto, thanks to a loan which he solicited.

For Liz, her work has many advantages, since she can dedicate herself to caring for her baby and her son who is still in school. The most important thing is to offer them a good education and preparation. For that reason, she feels very content with what she has, and hopes to gain more stability and continue improving little by little.

For the future, she wants to expand her store in order to offer articles for the home and supply the demands of her customers who live in the zone. This is her 18th loan with MFP, and she is considered a leader within her communal bank, because she has demonstrated responsibility in her work.

Liz will invest this loan in buying more products to expand her selection, including the new space where she will sell household articles, and in space for the customers, since it's Christmas season and they are requesting many gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE FOR HER STORE

loans.name: Line

texts.fr: S. Line est née le 30 Mai 1977 et est mariée à SESSINOU Simplice, un magasinier. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Il y a 2 ans environs que la famille s’est installée à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Line mène comme activité, depuis une dizaine d’année la vente de divers produits (produits concentrés, pâtes alimentaires, sardine, lait, petit pois, mayonnaise, couscous, riz, savons, bougies, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile à Agla. Line vend également des condiments de sauce (tomate, piments, huile de palme et d’arachide), ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. Line a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Très sollicitée par ses clients, Line ambitionne agrandir davantage son étalage afin de mieux faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante, mais Line manque de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C’est ce qui amène Line  à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Line voudrait également plus tard construire sa boutique en briques.
texts.en:
Line S. was born May 30, 1977 and is married to Simplice SESSINOU, a storekeeper. The couple has five children, all in school and living with their parents. About two years ago the family moved to the Agla area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple share in supporting the family. For the past ten years Lise has been selling various products from her home-based shop in Agla : concentrated products, pasta, sardines, milk, peas, mayonnaise, couscous, rice, soap, candles, etc.. She also sells sauce ingredients (tomatoes, hot peppers, palm and peanut oil), which allows her to diversify her sources of income. Line has already been granted two loans with ALIDé, both of which have been reimbursed. Very much valued by her customers, Line wants to expand her display of goods to better respond to the ever-growing demand, but lacks the financial resources to do so. This is why Line is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. At some point, she would also like to rebuild her shop with bricks.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (pasta, concentrated products), condiments (tomatoes, hot peppers, etc.), and peanut oil

loans.name: Birgilia

texts.es: La senora Birgilia A. de 53 anos, casada con 7 hijos cuatro casados y tres solteros se dedica a vender pan desde hace muchos anos, ha sido de apoyo a su esposo el es panadero ahora como ayuda para su esposo ella vende refacciones junto a su venta de pan ella obtiene ganancias tambien tiene otras ventas de pan en otros lugares donde la gente se moviliza, como las fabricas ella se ha preocupado en el estudio de sus hijas para que pudan terminar su carrera y para ello debe esforzarse un poco mas por lo que quiere invertir sus ganancias en otro negocio que es un deposito de tostadas, y utensilios desechables porque en la colonia donde vive no hay venta de estos productos su fin es de poder apoyar a sus hijas y hacerlas profesionales para que en el futuro ellas puedan apoyarlos economicamente.
texts.en:
Senora Birgilia A. is 53 years old, married with 7 children; 4 are married and 3 are single. She sells bread. For many years she has helped her husband, who is a baker. Now, as a help to her husband, she sells refreshments next to the place where she sells bread. She also has earnings from sales of bread in other places where people gather, such as factories. She has worried about her daughters' schooling, about whether they can complete their courses, and for that she needs to exert herself a little more. For this, she wants to invest her earnings in another business, which is a store to sell fried tortillas and disposable utensils, because in the neighborhood where she lives, there is no sale of these products. Her goal is to be able to support her daughters and have them become professionals, so that in the future they can support them economically.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Yude

texts.es:
Yude es una emprendedora mujer de 24 años, vive con su pareja Humberto, de 27 años, y con sus dos hijos: Jacqueline de 4 y Gean de 2 años.

Hace 2 años decidió tener un negocio propio y así ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que el trabaja en un restaurante como mozo y sus ingresos no resultaban suficientes. Por tal motivo, empezó a vender productos de belleza, ayudando así a generar ingresos extras para el beneficio de su familia.
Esta actividad tiene la ventaja de que puede disponer de su tiempo y organizarlo según su conveniencia para cuidar a sus hijos menores, quienes necesitan aún de ella. A Yude le gusta su trabajo, pues visita a sus amistades y vecinas ofreciéndole sus productos, además también aprovecha en tener amenas conversaciones, lo que ocasiona que cada vez tenga mayor cantidad de clientes, por su buen trato al trabajar.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy cómoda con su grupo, ya que todos se conocen y saben muy bien de su responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cosméticos para tenerlos en stock y así satisfacer el pedido de sus clientes cuando se lo soliciten.
texts.en:
Yude is a 24 year old entrepreneur who lives with her partner Humberto (age 27) and their two children, Jacqueline (age 4) and Gean (age 2).

Two years ago, Yude started her own business so that she could help her partner with the household expenses. She previously worked at a restaurant as waitress, but her earnings were not sufficient. For that reason, she began selling beauty products so that she could generate extra income to benefit her family. The advantage of this job is that the schedule is flexible and she can arrange her time based on when she needs to look after her children. She enjoys her work because she gets to visit friends and neighbors when offering her products. In addition, she benefits from having interesting conversations that allow her to attract more customers and provide them with better service.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yude feels very comfortable working with her group because she knows everyone will assume their responsibilities. She will use the money to buy more cosmetics to keep in stock so that she can fulfill her customers’ orders immediately upon request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en:
Dupe is well known in her community for her grinding machine that she uses to grind foodstuffs for her customers. The demand for her grinding service is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is married with three children and she is 40 years old. She has been in her business for the past three years. 

Dupe hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase a grinding machine to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase another grinding machine

loans.name: Olga Beatriz

texts.es:
La  señora Olga, es propietaria de una despensa,  con 7 años de funcionamiento, con clientela formada , ya que tiene buenos precios y buena calidad en sus mercaderías, también el trato con los clientes.
Su proyecto es ampliar su local comercial con un salón en frente de su casa con espacio suficiente para cargar muchas mercaderías de primera necesidad, al por mayor y menudeo.
Los clientes vienen de distintas zonas para abastecerse de las mercaderías y por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de panificados, lácteos, pastas, enlatados, embutidos .
texts.en:
Olga is the owner of a dispensary that has been in business for seven years, with an established customer base since it has good prices and good quality merchandise and treatment of its customers. Her project is to expand her commercial shop with a lounge at the front of her house that has enough space to store a lot of basic merchandise, wholesale and retail. Customers come from different areas to procure goods and for this she is requesting a loan to buy baked goods, dairy, pasta, canned goods and sausages.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baked goods, dairy, pasta, canned goods and sausages.

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Venicia, 42, is a borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic.  She is the coordinator of a group called Canal de Bendicion (Channel of Blessing).  Her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Venicia and her husband live with their three children in a simple home in a Batey near La Romana.  Bateyes are very poor.  The small rurl community was built by sugar companies for their field workers.  Life is extremely difficult, with no potable running water, daily power outages and inadequate access to health-care.  Despite these difficulties, Venicia runs a successful “colmado” (small corner store).  Colmados sell everything from bread to batteries.  With this loan, Venicia will buy rice, oil, flour, chicken, soft drinks, meat, and fish to sell.

This is Venicia’s fourth loan from Esperanza International.  She hopes to continue to growth her business.  Venicia’s profits help her provide for her family and cover many basic necessities around the house and for her children’s schooling.  Venicia hopes to continue growing and improving her business, taking out larger and larger loans over time.
----------------------------------------
Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families from poverty through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Venicia and the Canal de Bendicion group!

loans.use: Food and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen K., 26, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. She sells groceries for an income of about USD 10 per day, while her husband, a barber, earns an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda N. is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Already a widow at 59, she is blessed with five children. She makes sure that she earns well so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own video game business for quite some time now.

Winefreda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 13,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business, buying spare parts for the maintenance of computer and video games.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying spare parts for the maintenance of video games

loans.name: Violeta Lucas

texts.pt:
Violeta Lucas G. nasceu na província de Inhambane, sul de moçambique, tem 49 anos de idade estudou ate a 12ª classe, não deu mas continuidade devido a falta de tempo, não tem filho pois é estéril, vive na casa cedida pelo serviço. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e sobrinho que vivem em inhambane enviando lhes em cada 3 meses uma sexta básica no valor de 1.000.00mt.  

Violeta ganha uma bolsa de estudos para Alemanha antiga RDA, onde fez uma formação profissional de dactilografia. Apois a Independência ela volta novamente a sua terra natal Moçambique concretamente em Inhambane, mas devido a falta de emprego saiu de Inhambane para província de Maputo no distrito de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia com sua tia. Esta consegue arranjar um emprego na Escola Secundária da Namaacha como dactilógrafa onde trabalha a mais de 16 anos das 7:30 as 15:30h auferindo mensalmente 2.960.84mt que aplica nas despesas da sua casa.com os empréstimos anteriores de (5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt) não conseguiu concluir a sua obra devido ao elevado custo do material.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Violeta na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. O primeiro de 5000,00mt foi usado para compra de material de construção, o segundo de 8.000.00mt foi também usado para comprar material de construção e este terceiro de 15.000.00mt para a compra de material de construcao (cimento, areia, ferro e outros)para continuar com sua obra. Esta confiante que vai pagar cem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer manutenção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Violeta Lucas G. was born in Inhambane, south of Mozambique. She is 49 and studied until 12th grade, but had to drop school because she didn't have time. She doesn't have children and lives in a house given her by her job. She also helps her mother and a nephew that lie in Inhambane by sending them some basic food products every 3 months. Violeta had a scholarship and studied in Germany back in the day, where she became a certified typist. After the independence she went back to her native Mozambique and moves to Maputo in Namaacha District, to live with an aunt. She then got a job as a typist at a local school where she's been working for the past 16 yeras from 7:30AM to 3:30PM, making around U$90 per month. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. The frist two were used to buy construction supplies. She is asking for U$450 so she can buy more materials she needs like cement, iron and rocks, and finishe building her house. She's confident she will pay it back on time and hopes to ask for another loan after this one is paid so she can do some maintenance in her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction supplies

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Justina;   ella tiene 43 años de edad, es natural de la provincia de chumbivilcas la socia es conviviente ella estudio hasta el segundo grado de secundaria y por motivos económicos no pudo culminar la secundaria, La socia  tiene 1 hijo y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tienen un stand en el centro comercial el paraíso, ella vende radios, relojes, despertadores, accesorios de relojes y desea implementar su negocio comprando mayor diversidad de equipos. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con la compra de equipos diversos y accesorios para sus relojes.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is one of the members of the Banco Comunal “Lideres del Tercer Milenio” (“Leaders of the Third Millenium” Communal Bank). She lives in Cusco, in the Huanchac neighborhood. Her name is Justina. A native of the Chumbivilcas province, she is 43 years old and she lives with her partner. She attended school up to the second year of secondary school, but she could not finish her studies due to economic reasons. She has a son, and she alternates her housewife duties with her activity as a retailer. She has a stand in the “El Paraíso” shopping center, where she sells radios, watches, alarm clocks, spare parts for watches, and she wishes to increase her business by buying a wider variety of equipment. The loan she is requesting will be used to boost her business by buying different equipments and spare parts for her watches. She is thankful for and appreciates the help offered to her through this loan, and she commits to complying with repaying his debt within the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different equipments and spare parts for her watches.

loans.name: Rocio Erika

texts.es:
Rocio es socia del bancomunal Ccori Soncco, tiene 22 años, es soltera, ella se dedica a la impresión y estampados en la imprenta de su tío. El préstamo que esta solicitando lo va ha invertir para la compra de tintas, papel, fotolitos para poder realizar estampados, porque las ganancia de estampados es para ella.
Rocío menciona que gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido es mas puntual y mas organizada en el trabajo.
El suño de Rocío es tener su propia imprenta, también poder viajar a otro país para poder buscar nuevas oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Rocio is a member of the Ccori Soncco community bank. She is 22 years old and single. She is dedicated to printing and stamping at her uncle's print shop. The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of ink, paper and films so she may create her stamps since the earnings from stamping are for her. Rocio mentions that, thanks to the training that she has received, she is more punctual and more organized at her job. Rocio's dream is to have her own print shop and also to be able to travel to another country in order to be able to look for new living opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ink, paper and film.

loans.name: Nabat's Group

texts.en: Manufacturing national articles has always been one of the well-known women’s occupations in Kyrgyzstan. For men, the traditional way of making a living has always been either farming or cattle breeding. However, over the last decades, women have diversified their occupations and started doing various other jobs. As for the production of national articles, it requires lots of patience, love and enthusiasm since, if a woman does not put all her talent and passion into the work, she might not make a good article and her product may be left unsold. The heroines of our story make national articles and are involved in cattle breeding and farming. Nabat S. is 50. She has raised six children. Her daughters are married and live separately. Her only son works in Russia and visits his parents once a year. Nabat’s youngest daughter goes to college. To make a living, Nabat’s husband works as a security guard and Nabat manufactures national articles. She learned this craft from her sister. She would never have dreamed that this acquired skill would become the main source of her income, were it not for the high unemployment rate in the country. Nabat hopes to obtain this loan to purchase fabric for making articles. Nabat’s partners: Parizat C., 45, is a widow. She is the mother of four children. Three of them are working in Russia. Parizat is engaged in cattle breeding. She has sheep and plans to build a new shed. For now, she needs a loan to purchase some sheep. Gulzat K., 37, has two children. Both of them go to school. Gulzat’s husband is a village shepherd. Gulzat is also occupied with cattle breeding and selling milk. She manages to make $170 a month. Gulzat has applied for this loan as she wants to buy a piece of land nearby for building a house. Kandalat S., 43, is married and has four children. Kandalat’s husband has gone to work in Russia and, for now, Kandalat is the sole provider for her family. She breeds cattle and thus manages to earn $105 a month. She needs this loan to purchase sheep to increase the total population of her livestock. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Mrs. Sokim Sou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group has fifteen members who live in Trapeang Reang village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sokim S., who was born in 1969, is the village bank president having been selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses.

Mrs. Sokim S. and her husband, Mr. Thol Tuon, are farmers who own a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Moreover, Mrs. Sokim S. is also a pig breeder.

Mrs. Sokim S.’s problem is that her field is far away from the irrigation system. So, to solve this problem, she is seeking a loan to dig a well. With the rest of the loan, she will buy pig feed.

Mrs. Sokim S. is the mother of two children, one of whom is studying in the local school, while the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To dig a well and buy pig feed

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora D. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, beans, onions, and Irish potatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and maize flour to sell.  Flora is 37 years old and is married with a husband that is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by stocking cocks and hens to sell.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia G. is from the village of Banquero. She is 44 years old. Cornelia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cornelia owns & operates a business planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cornelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Cornelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Las Emprendadoras De La Q Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS D. LA Q”
Gloria Rosario N. Hernández tiene 53 años vive en el asentamiento humano José Carlos Mariategui en el distrito D. san Juan D. Lurigancho,es madre D. cuatro hijos ya todos mayores D. edad, hace seis años que Gloria se quedo viuda su esposo falleció y desD. ese momento todo los gastos y responsabilidades D. la casa los asume ella sola.
Gloria se dedica a la venta D. pescado en un mercado cercano donD. vive hace 23 años que viene realizando este negocio con el cual pueD. mantener a su familia,educar a sus hijos y terminar con algunos arreglos D. su casa.
 La alcancia viene trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad desD. el año 2009 este es el cuarto préstamo que realizan con nosotros y su primera experiencia D. la Sra. Gloria como presidenta.
 El sueño D. la Sra.Gloria es convertir su puesto en una distribuidora al por mayor y menor en la venta D. pescado en la más alta calidad y la mejor variedad; por ello el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en incrementar aun más su capital D. trabajo y mediante eso atender a la mayor demanda posible
 la sra Gloria en la foto se encuentra D. pie y viste una chompa azul y una blusa azul floreada
texts.en:
THE COMUNAL BANK "LAS EMPRENDEDORAS D. LA Q" Gloria is 53 years old and lives in the Jose Carlos Mariategui settlement, in the district of San Juan D. Lurigancho. She is the mother of 4 children, all already adults. It has been 6 years since her husband died and Gloria became a widow, and from that moment, all the costs and responsibilities of the house became hers alone. Gloria sells fish in a market near where she lives. She has done this for 23 years in order to maintain her family, educate her children, and finish building her house. The group has worked with Edaprospo-Prosperidad since 2009, and this is the 4th loan they have taken out. This is Gloria's first experience as president. Gloria's dream is to convert her stall into a wholesale and retail distributership and seller of fish of the highest quality and the greatest variety. To do that, the loan will be used to increase her working capital and, in this manner, to satisfy the greatest possible demand. In the photo, Gloria is standing, wearing a blue sweater and a flowered white blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO OPEN A NEW STALL IN THE MARKET DUE TO  THE GREAT DEMAND FOR FISH

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Srta. Nancy Q.  vive en el barrio Crucesita tiene 24 años tiene vivienda propia donde cuenta con todas las comodidades, no tiene hijos cuenta con móvil propio (moto).
Es comerciante desde hace 4 años primero se desempeño como administradora pero hace más de un año adquirió un local propio donde se dedica e la venta de prendas de todo tipo de buena calidad y de marcas reconocidas, en la ciudad es reconocida por la gran clientela con que cuenta.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de prendas para esta temporada que se acerca; y agradece  la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado a través del crédito concedido.
texts.en:
Nancy Q. lives in the neighborhood of Crucesita.  She is 24 years old and has her own home, which has all of the amenities.  She does not have children, and she has her own cell phone.

She has had a store for four years.  At first, she was an administrator, but more than a year ago, she acquired her own store.  She sells all types of clothing from recognizable brands of good quality.  She is known in the city for her large number of customers.  

She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of spring clothing.  She thanks the Paraguaya Foundation for the support they provide through the loans they give.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for the spring, including t-shirts, dresses and other items

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora B. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Leonora is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling charcoal by the sack in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosa Onelia

texts.en:
Rosa lives with her parents in the village of San Sebastian in the district of Morrope.  She is twenty-three years old and has no children.  She is a new client with Edpyme Alternativa although she has worked with other financial institutions in the area in the past.

Rosa sells beauty products from the lines Esika and Unique.  She sells her products both via requests and on credit, a method which allows her to offer her products to a greater range of customers.  Rosa manages a small stock of products and has a good following among her clientele.  Rosa also works in a restaurant in the area, in order to maintain a more stable income.

With her first loan from Edpyme, Rosa plans to purchase additional beauty products in order to expand her stock and provide greater selection to her clientele.  She hopes to be able to earn additional income for her future education and to further provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchase additional beauty products

location.town: Anexo San Sebastián - Centro Poblado Romero - Morr

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mr. Cheng S. and his wife, Mrs. Srey Yin, have been married since 1980 and have five children—two sons and three daughters. They live about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Mr. Cheng S. and his wife are farmers. In addition, they also raise pigs and produce rice wine. Cheng has asked for a Kiva loan one time already. He is now requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise and use for farming.

Photo: Mr. Cheng S. and his wife

loans.use: To buy additional piglets to raise and use for farming

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en: Zouheir is a 27 year old married man, father of two kids, working in selling car spare parts and accessories since 2009, he is requesting a loan for the second time from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his capital and improve his business. Zouheir’s main issue is to provide good secure living for his beloved family members; he works hard to provide them with good financial and social situations, in addition to perfect education levels. His clients can be anyone in need of such service; most of them say that his honesty is his positive point and advantage among competitors. He hopes to expand his business in the future with a larger shop and a better living.

loans.use: To increase his capital.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma B. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 53 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Norma has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 33 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Raphael Ndirangu

texts.en:
Raphael Ndirangu has been operating a retail shop in Kiwanja, Thika Road Town, for six years with a maximum monthly profit of Kshs. 10,000. He is 29 years old, single and a hard working gentleman.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and he has a very good credit history with the firm. Raphael is applying for his fourth loan of Kshs. 50,000 from KADET after repaying the previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan to purchase more stock of goods for the retail shop to sell during the high season. 

The anticipated profit he plans to plough back into the business for it to grow, and he hopes that the business will be stable financially. In the future he hopes to venture into the transport industry.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the retail shop.

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin A. is from the village of Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Daylin is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a butcher shop, butchering and selling a variety of meats in the local community. Daylin has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Daylin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Hannah Wanjiru

texts.en:
Hannah has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 43 years old, married to John Thuita, and they have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan. She repaid both her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertiliser.

In future, Hannah hopes to buy her own farming tools instead of always having to hire.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertiliser

loans.name: Kofi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Kofi    est enseignant de profession, mais il a associé la conduite de taxi-moto pour avoir plus de revenus pour satisfaire  sa  famille. Il a commencé  en 2008 et l’exerce dans les zones environnantes  de Lomé.  Il a 2 enfants et est marié. Il a 37 ans et habite quartier kohé.  Il demande un  prêt pour acheter une nouvelle moto.
texts.en: Mr Kofi is a teacher, but he runs also a motorbike taxi business to increase his income and provide for his family. He began in 2008 and works in the surroundings of Lomé. He is married, 37 years old and the father of two children. He lives in the neighborhood of Kohé. He applies for a loan to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Paola Annabel

texts.es:
Paola García es de la isla trinitaria que hace algunos años antes ella se quedo sola su esposa la se fue de la casa y vio la necesidad de poner un negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Trabaja ella con la ayuda de sus padres y vende arroz azúcar y aceite. No tiene ningún inconveniente en su negocio y tiene 3 hijos 17, 15, 12 y estudian es escuela fiscal. Quiere su prestamo para comprar arroz, aceite, enlatados. Unas de sus metas es comprarse un carro
texts.en:
Paola García is from Isla Trinitaria.  A few years ago her husband left her and she was left alone.  She had to set up a business to support her children.

With help from her parents she works selling rice, sugar and oil.  She does not have any inconvenience in her business and she has three children who are 17, 15 and 12 years of age; they are all going to public school.

She wants her loan to buy rice, oil and canned goods.  One of her goals is to buy a car.

loans.use: For rice, oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Estela; La socia tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 5 hijos, (todos ellos independientes); la socia es docente de profesión, la socia es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal, la socia trabaja desde hace 10 años con esta modalidad y le ha ido muy bien, en especial la socia nos comenta que a ella en particular le gusta reunirse con sus amigas cada mes; La socia trabaja vendiendo útiles escolares a pedido ella tiene a sus nietos en el colegio y tiene amistades que son las mamás de los amigos de sus nietos y otras personas que la conocen y le hacen pedidos y ella les provee todo lo relacionado con la época escolar. La socia también compra y vende productos de belleza por catálogos y le va bien, ella en esta oportunidad desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de útiles escolares y aumentar a sus productos de belleza.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "AMAUTA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Mrs. Estela is 62 years old, married and has five children who all live independently.  She is a teacher and one of the founders of the communal bank, with which she has been working for 10 years.  She enjoys it and especially likes the monthly meetings with her friends.

Estela sells school supplies on an order basis.  She has school-aged grandchildren and friends with grandchildren and other people who place orders for  everything related to school activity.  She also buys and sells beauty products by catalogue and the business is going well for her.  She plans to use this loan to buy school supplies and increase her beauty products inventory.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and beauty products for retail

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van V. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Van sells groceries, earning an income of USD 9 per day. Her husband is an electronics repairman, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Van is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. V. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a truck to transport agriculture products to resell

loans.name: Sarah Akinyi

texts.en:
Sarah Akinyi O. is 25 years old, comes from Kisumu and is married to Heston Ogola. They have two children who are both in school.

Sarah has a shoe business consisting of both second-hand shoes and new ones. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to add more shoes to her stock. Sarah is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan. 

The profits made will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to have a shoe boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married man who lives in the small resort town of Berdyansk. It’s a town on the Azov Sea in Ukraine. Most of the people living in this town make their living during the tourist season. Ivan is not an exception. He dries fish and sells it to tourists during the summer. His produce is reasonably priced, therefore, many can afford to enjoy it. Ivan has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, his gross income amounts to 50,000 Grivnyas. 

Ivan is seeking a 20,000 Grivnya loan to purchase raw pigfish to souse and dry. Ivan is not only planning to sell his merchandise by retail this summer. He has found some wholesalers who have offered him a good price for his dried fish which is why he is hoping to increase his sales and income as a result. Ivan enjoys running his business and is hoping to continue seeing it flourish and bring him consistent income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pigfish to souse and dry for sale

loans.name: Matin

texts.en:
Matin S. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is single and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Matin has a poultry business, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Matin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken feed to feed the chickens he raises for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Matin hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feed.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela Maria de 41 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.  Ella tiene 1 hijo con el que sueña ver prósperos y productivos y por eso se esmera por lograr una educación de calidad y es precisamente su mayor motivación en el trabajo que desempeña como comerciante. Ángela inició su negocio con capital propio, pues con ciertos ahorros que tenía decide comenzar a comprar ciertos productos para empezar a ofrecer a todo público en general. La competencia de su mercado es muy fuerte y para ella este es su mayor desafío, pero como maneja muy bien sus relaciones con los proveedores, logra precios que traslada a sus clientes, con los cuales los mantiene fieles. Este crédito es para la compra de  cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, lápiz labial, brillos, lápiz de ojos entre otras.
texts.en:
Ángela María, 41, sells cosmetics.  She has a son that she hopes to see prosperous and productive and this is why she strives to give him a quality education and precisely why it’s her greatest motivation to work as a merchant.

Ángela started her business with her own capital, certain saving she had.  She decided to buy certain products to start selling to the general public.

Her market competition is quite strong and this is her greatest challenge.  However, because she maintains very good relationships with her suppliers, she gets good prices that she passes on to her customers which keeps them faithful to her.

This loan is to buy creams, hair treatments, shampoo, lipstick, nail polish, eyeliner, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC II”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 34 años de edad y La socia es conviviente; La socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual ella va implementando poco a poco, según el requerimiento de los productos de primera necesidad que son los que salen a diario como, arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, la socia también es vendedora al por mayor de huevos y ha implementado en su misma tienda de abarrotes en la entrada unos módulos para exhibir los huevos al por mayor en cajitas especiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de huevos al por mayor y de productos de primera necesidad.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC II” communal bank.  She lives in Urubamba District in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

The member is 34 years old and is in a relationship.  She has a grocery store that she is gradually stocking according to basic need item requirements for items that sell daily like: rice, sugar, milk and eggs.  She also sells eggs at wholesale and has set up special modules at the entrance to her store to display the wholesale eggs in their special little boxes.  She is asking for a loan to buy eggs at wholesale as well as basic need items.

The member values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan because it makes it possible for her to grow in business and improve her quality of life.  At the same time, she commits to make her installment payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy eggs at wholesale as well as basic need items.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, 31 years old, has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  He does small-scale farming and sells all his produce in the local market.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour as he will employ casual workers to help him in planting.

In future, Paul hopes to buy more land and practise large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard keeps livestock and cultivates land. Alvard has a tractor for cultivating the land, but it is very old and needs to be repaired. With a repaired tractor, Alvard will cultivate the land faster and more effectively, which is very important for getting a good harvest. With the loan’s help, Alvard will develop the land and insure a sustainable future for her family. Alvard lives together with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for tractor repair

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana began her Dallas, Texas-based salon and bookstore, Elevate, because she saw an opening in the market for a business that, as she says, “serves the needs of the mind, body and soul.” The idea for Elevate came to her one day while sitting in church. She says, “I was thinking about how big companies merge to offer customers more services, and I realized that I could combine my 18 years of experience as a hairdresser and my passion for books to meet the needs of a vast array of people.” So, eight months ago, Adriana opened the doors to Elevate, a first-of-its-kind salon, book store and coffee shop.
Elevate's salon offers its customers traditional salon services while its bookstore and coffee shop meet the intellectual needs of Adriana’s customers. The salon side of the business offers hair styling, manicures, pedicures and massage services. Her bookstore and coffee shop offers customers an opportunity to read, exchange and purchase books while enjoying coffee and organic teas. Adriana says, “The business has turned into a community hub; people come in and trade books, and a lot of family members accompany their loved ones and wait in the shop while they get salon work done.”
In the future, Adriana hopes to expand the services offered at her current location as well as open new locations in other communities in Dallas. Her expansion plan for her current location includes the addition of an organic juice bar in the coffee shop, facial services to the salon and a Tezmecal spa, which is a type of ancient Mayan therapy, in the current courtyard of her building. She also says that, eventually, she would like to expand her business to offer the same quality services in several locations across Dallas.
This loan helped Adriana complete the vision for her salon and book store. She used it to purchase two pedicure chairs and three manicure stations, along with all of the necessary implements to provide complete manicure and pedicure services. She will contribute the remaining funds to installing the juice bar into her coffee shop.
Adriana’s business philosophy is extremely community oriented. In order to establish her business in the community, she has donated and offered free services to community organizations, offered free cosmetic services to women in the community for job interviews, and hosted events for young women’s empowerment organizations. Of this, she says, “It’s a real privilege to be a part of the community and these people’s lives. As someone’s hair stylist, you become a part of their lives – you are a therapist and counselor, not just a hairdresser.”
With this loan, Adriana will continue to serve the needs of her customers' minds, bodies and souls, while expanding her services to meet the needs of communities like her own across Dallas.

loans.use: to purchase two pedicure chairs, three manicure stations and the tools needed to offer manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 31 años, es un padre de familia muy dedicado a los suyos, vive en una casa alquilada con su esposa e hijo. En la búsqueda de oportunidades  logró conseguir un trabajo como peón en  una fabrica de ladrillos. Su empeño y dedicación le permitieron  producir  ladrillos de buena calidad y en la actualidad él ha hecho su propia fábrica. Vende lo que produce, es un comerciante intermediario de ladrillos que puede dar fe de la calidad de los ladrillos a sus clientes. Poco a poco esta capitalizando e incrementando sus ganancias que en la actualidad puede adquirir de primera mano  varios millares de ladrillos para vender,, generándole buenos ingresos. Por el momento continúa trabajando de manera dependiente pero se ha propuesto tener su propia fábrica de ladrillos. Es la novena ocasión en que tiene un crédito con MFP, se siente muy complacido de ser parte de su banco comunal de las que tiene buenas enseñanzas que le enseñan en su vida diaria. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá para abastecerse de más ladrillos como parte del crecimiento de su capital.
texts.en:
Jesús is 31 years old and a dedicated father to his family. He lives in a rented house with his wife and child. Looking for opportunities, Jesús was able to secure a job working at a brick factory. His commitment and dedication enabled him to produce bricks of good quality and now he has his own brick business. He sells what he produces, but he also acts as a middleman, which allows him to test the quality of bricks that he offers to his customers. Little by little, Jesús has been able to capitalize and increase his earnings to the point that he can acquire firsthand several thousands of bricks to sell so that he can generate good income. At the moment, he continues to work as an employee but has hopes of having his own brickyard.

This is the ninth time he has received a loan from MFP. Jesús is pleased to be part of his Communal Bank because it has provided him good lessons that he can use in his daily life. The money he is requesting will be invested in more bricks to add to his growing capital.

loans.use: to purchase bricks to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all of them go to school. She has additional family members. She has a restaurant at  the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 30 years. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bananas, beef, a sack of rice, and beans. Rose's aspiration and goal is to expand her business to serve more customers. Her major challenge is seasonality. Rose lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expense includes food and power.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, rice, beans and beef

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is an aggressive 57-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with nine children between 15 and 31 years old. For the last 10 years, she has been engaging in farming to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have started another business:a retail shop. Her dream is to farm in large scale and to supply produce to a wider market, especially the export market. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizers. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to save on a weekly basis.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizers

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a 61-year-old married man with nine children and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda with a family dream of building a house in the next five years. He has been operating a bar business for eight years which he started with one crate of beer, two crates of soda and one jerrycan of local brew and now has ten crates of soda, ten crates of beer and three jerrycans of local brew. His hardship is bad debts and his vision is opening another outlet plus educating his children to university level. Isaac needs the loan facility to buy drinks and to pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy drinks and pay school fees.

loans.name: Irene Cris

texts.en:
Irene Cris is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Irene Cris has a pigpen and she sells matured & full-grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Irene Cris is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Irene Cris hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Enrrique

texts.es: Enrique, tiene la edad 42 de años, está soltero y vive con su mamá. El con el crédito pretende comprar un ternero para el engorde. El  cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de estos animales y se encuentra vacio por lo cual realizara la compra para darle uso y obtener ganancias de este. El comprara en ternero pequeño y la engordara para su posterior venta y obtenerle el máximo de las ganancias. El tiene como meta generar las ganancias para el bienestar de él y de su madre y asegurarse un poco su futuro. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Enrique, 42, is single and lives with his mother.  With the loan he plans to buy a calf to fatten.  He has the right kind of land for these animals and it's empty, so he will make the purchase to use the land and profit from it.  He will buy a small calf and fatten it for its later sale, to get the maximum profits from it.

His goal is to generate profits for his and his mother's well-being, and to secure their future somewhat.

This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously, he had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a calf to fatten.

loans.name: Katy Sanny

texts.es:
Katy Sanny nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella trabaja en una de las municipalidad de la ciudad del cusco en el área administrativa. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para la educación, alimentación, vestimenta de sus hijos. 
     
Katy Sanny pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Katy Sanny was born and lives in the city of Cusco. She is 32 years old and has 2 children. She works in one of the municipalities of Cusco in administration. She has been working for several years and she is doing very well. This time she needs a loan for personal use; specifically for education, food and clothing for her children.

Katy Sanny belongs to the commmunal bank “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” which belongs to the Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity afforded her by the bank and agrees to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to pay for education, food and clothing for her children.

loans.name: Diana Mayela

texts.es: Diana de 31 años de edad es soltera, habita en casa de su mamá junto a sus hermanos. Diana trabaja para la municipalidad como Auxiliar de registro desde hace 3 años . Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejora las condiciones de vida de su familia, comprando materiales para hacer una tapia que le permita tener su casa mas segura, pues actualmente la delincuencia esta creciendo en el barrio donde vive, y teme que cuando se va a su trabajo pueda meterse alguien a robar lo poco que tiene.  Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Diana is 31 years old, she is single and she lives in her mother's house with her siblings. For the past 3 years, Diana has worked as a municipal registration assistant. She is applying for her second loan with the goal of improving her family's living conditions by purchasing materials to build a wall in order to make her house more secure. Delinquency is currently on the rise in the area in which she lives and she worries that somebody could break in and steal the few things that she owns while she is out at work. Her greatest dream is to be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr.Juan Carlos  es un joven de 22 años que vive en la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, es soltero, y un no tiene hijos, es un joven muy emprendedor que desde un principio decidio abrir un negocio que pueda manejarlo y ademas pueda generarle ingresos para su sustento, El sr. Juan Carlos cuenta con un internet provisto de  5 equipos de computacion, las cuales son su unica fuente generadora de ingreso que le ayudan a subsistir, por tal motivo  la única manera de mejorar su calidad de vida es implementado mas computadoras en su internet; Juan Carlos ha observado que el lugar donde se encuentra instalado tiene bastante afluencia de clientes, ya que  esta en un lugar estrategico, es por ese motivo que cuenta con una elevada demanda. 
Es asi que Juan Carlos ha solicitado un credito para su negocio de cafe Internet para poder comprar mas equipos de computacion y asi generar mas ingresos.
texts.en: Señor Juan Carlos  is a youth of 22 years that lives in the City of Santa Cruz.  He is single, and does not have children.  He is a very enterprising youth that from the beginning decided to open a business that he can manage himself and also can generate income for his living.  Señor Juan Carlos relies on an internet cafe business consisting of 5 computers, which are his only source of income that helps him to subsist.  For this reason the only way to improve his quality of life is to install more computers in his network.  Juan Carlos has observed that the place where his business is located has enough affluence of clients, since it is in a strategic place and therefore is in high demand.  It is for this reason that Juan Carlos has requested a loan for his Internet cafe business to be able to buy more computers and in this way to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment for his Internet business.

loans.name: Ramathan

texts.en: Ramathan wants a loan to buy more cows for resale. He operates  a butcher shop in Masindi, Uganda.  Limited capital is his challenge.  His desire is to educate his children and expand his business into new areas. He is a 37 year-old single father with four children.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Felista's Group

texts.en:
Felista's Group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Felista is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Felista has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Felista has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Felista to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Felista hopes that, in the future, she will be able to learn a job skill in hairdressing. 

Felista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Felista's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Mrs Baasansuren is 29 years old and lives with her husband and her mother-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She sells clothes in the market called Narantuul, which is located in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar. She has been selling clothes for three years and she has gained a little experience in her business.  Currently her business earnings the main source of income for her family.  Therefore she always tries to increase her earnings by improving her business in day by day.  

Now Baasansuren needs some financial support to purchase winter clothes for her sales in preparation for the coming winter season because the price of winter clothes is more expensive than other seasonal clothes in Mongolia.  Winter is a big chance to increase her income in the year. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing a large number of winter outfits for her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of winter outfits for her clothing sales.

loans.name: Chritine's Group

texts.en:
Chritine's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Chritine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Chritine has been working hard to manage her small hotel, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Chritine has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks to sell and will help Chritine generate greater profits, which she will use to pay her child’s school fees.  Chritine hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Chritine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Chritine's future prospects by helping her learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Thua

texts.en: Mrs. Thua is requesting this loan for her daughter, a first-year university student studying to become an accountant. After her five years of university, she hopes to work for the accounting department of a joint venture company near her house. Now studying hard to reach her goal, she needs 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay for tuition fees, books, and supplies.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees, books, and supplies.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es: La señora Cleofe tiene su kiosco donde vende comida rápida, hamburguesas y salchipapas,  en la zona tembladerani  vende hace 2 años empezó con un pequeño monto y ahora gracias a su esfuerzo salió adelante y mejoro su negocio y creció, la Sra. Cleofe  esta muy dedicada a su negocio donde le va muy bien su domicilio es la zona tembladerani,  su esposo viaja a Luribay es chofer viaja constantemente, ella sola se ocupa de la educación de sus hijos por la ausencia de su esposo, ella trabaja mucho ya que a parte de dedicarse a su negocio tiene que ocuparse de la educación de sus hijos, la Sra. Cleofe es una persona muy responsable, y amable, se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado, con el dinero del crédito comprara pinturas y pagara la mano de obra para el pintado de su kiosco, donde vende sus hamburguesas y sus salchipapas.
texts.en: For the last 2 years, Señora Cleofe has run a stall selling fast food, hamburgers and salchipapas (sliced hot dogs with French fries) in Tembladerani. She started out with a small amount of capital and now, owing to her own efforts, she has progressed and improved her business. Sra Cleofe is hard working and works well. She lives in Tembladerani and, as her husband is a driver, he continually travels to Luribay. In her husband's absence she is the only one who deals with the children's education, as well as this she also works much of the time. She is a responsible and pleasant person who feels very grateful for the offer of support. With this money she will buy paintings to decorate her hamburger and salchipapas stall and pay a painter to decorate it.

loans.use: PAINT HER SALCHIPAPA/HAMBURGER STALL

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is age 27 and has been in farming for 5 years, doing mainly tea and horticultural products.  He is married with one child age eight months.  He sells his produce to the local market.

Evans has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.  He says he wants to embark on intensive dairy farming so that he can meet the needs of his family.  He adds that the market for horticultural products is not consistent and requires better management with a ready market and transportation being the major limitations in the area.

He reiterates that the market is a real challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tout Est Grâce 20 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TOUT EST GRÂCE 20 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Lucienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.
