Amalia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Amalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Asomidin

texts.ru: Чураев Асомидин проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование средне - специальное, шафер. Занимается перевозкой людей по маршруту Турсунзаде-Душанбе, Душанбе-Турсунзаде. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для ремонта машины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Asomidin C. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  He is 49 years old.  He is married and has four children.  He has secondary education - his specialty is a driver.  He transports people across the route from Tursun-zoda to Dushanbe and back.  He has been in this business for two years.  He is taking out the loan to repair his car so he can provide a safe service.

loans.use: To repair the car

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco C. is from the village of Libertad, Gingoog City. He is 58 years old. Francisco is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Francisco owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, detergents, noodles, and canned goods in the local community. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisco joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell.

loans.name: C5291 Faith Group

texts.en:
Constasie is 53 years old and is a widow. She is the president of a group called Ibyiringiro which means 'Faith' in english. This group is commonly known for selling a variety of goods such as clothes, foodstuffs, gasoline, etc. 

Constasie and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to satisfy the demand of their customers which keeps increasing beyond their financial capacity. With the use of this loan, Constasie and her team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will be used to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as clothes, foodstuffs etc.

loans.name: Cyrus  Wakaigua

texts.en:
Cyrus is 52 years old and married to Veronica Wambui who contributes to the family income. They have children aged 30, 27, 22,18 and 16 years. He has a welding and metal fabrication workshop which he has been running for 10 years with an income of about 17,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan from Kadet with which he wants to buy metal for making burglar-proof doors for sale. He hopes to expand the business, start a manufacturing company, and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: Buy metal for making burglar-proof doors

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla a 36 ans et est mariée. Elle a un enfant en charge. Pour pouvoir participer au ménage, elle exerce comme activité la restauration plus précisément la vente de la viande de port et débit de boissons. Dans cette activité, elle cumule 2 ans déjà et s’approvisionne à Noépé pour acquérir  les porcs et les ingrédients au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite elle satisfait   les clients dans un restaurant à Adidogomé non loin de l’école  ANNE   ALBERT. Elle demande un crédit pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Abla is 36.  She is married and has one child at home.  To help out with household expenses, she operates a restaurant selling pork dishes and drinks.  She has been doing this for two years.  She buys meat at Noépé, and other ingredients in the big marketplace in Lomé.  Her restaurant is in Adidogomé, not far from the Anne Albert school.  She is asking for a loan to build her inventory.

loans.use: Buy pork and drinks

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn S. is a villager who lives in Krapeu Ha village in Kandal province. She was born in 1955. She owns a food stall for selling food and cooked rice to support her living. She also earns her living by selling Khmer traditional cake. 

Her husband, Mr. Chan Thorn, is 58 years old and works as a construction worker. Together, they are able to earn some income to support their family. They have two children; one is a car driver and the other is a student.  

In order to support her businesses and increase her income, Mrs. Chorn S. would like to ask for a loan to buy more rice and food to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice and food to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose K. a 37 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 6 enfants entre 3 ans et 16 ans.  Elle a fini 1 année d’école post-primaire, et 4 de ses enfants  vont a l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de triplex pour le plafond, ciment, sable, portes, fenêtres, et main d’œuvre pour la construction d’une maison a louer.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de renouveler tous ses maisons pour demeurer dans un lieu propre et idéal.  Rose voudrait améliorer son habitation, et aussi améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rose K. is 37 years old. She is married and has 6 children between 3 and 16 years old. She completed one year of secondary school and 4 of her children go to school. 
She will use her loan to purchase plyboard for the ceiling, cement, sand, doors and windows and to pay for labor costs for the construction of a house to rent. Her strategy to grow her business is to renovate all her houses in order to live in a clean and ideal place. 
Rose wishes to improve her housing as well as her family's well-being.

loans.use: To purchase plyboard for the ceiling, cement, sand, doors, windows and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Nery Lisseth

texts.es: Nery Lisseth se dedica a la venta de tortillas y leña. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este medio de vida. Siempre le ha gustado mantener a su familia, de la forma más humilde. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, sus experiencias con créditos han sido satisfactorias pues le han brindado a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Ella tiene todas las intenciones de salir adelante con su negocio y mejorar cada día sus ingresos. Este crédito es para la compra de maíz, cal, leña y frijoles. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y mejora la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nery Lisseth sells tortillas and firewood. She has made her living in this manner for more than eight years. Nery always enjoys supporting her humble family.

This is not the first time she has received financing. Her credit experiences have been satisfactory and provided her family with the necessary income. Nery has every intention of succeeding in her business and improving her income each day. This loan will be used to buy corn, lime, firewood, and beans. She dreams of improving her earnings and her family’s living condition.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy corn, lime, firewood, and beans

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester M. is from the village of Tapon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Ester is married and has eight adult children. 

To make a living, Ester owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling green and yellow bananas. She also sells fish like sardines and milk fish. Ester has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Ester is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell like mackerel and salmon. This will be the third loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es: María Amparo A. G. es una mujer muy emprendedora y a pesar de las adversidades que le ha ofrecido la vida, ha salido adelante con la frente en alto, hace ya tiempo se divorcio y quedo a su cargo una niña discapacitada que necesita cuidados especiales. Por lo que se dedico a la venta de productos por catalogo y distribución de vales para zapatos trabajos que puede realizar desde su casa para no descuidar a su hija. Amparo se ve en la necesidad de arreglar su baño, instalando vitromuro para que de mejor aspecto y limpieza.
texts.en: María Amparo A. G. is an enterprising woman.  Despite the adversity she has had to face in life, María has been able to rise above it.  She has been divorced for some time and has custody of her disabled daughter who requires special care.  María earns her living by selling products through catalogs and distributing vouchers for shoes.  She is able to work from home so that she can take care of her daughter.  María Amparo needs to repair her bathroom and install tiles in order to improve its appearance and cleanliness.

loans.use: Repair a bathroom & install tiling

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene V. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Rene is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Rene sells green bananas and coconuts for copras in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & to fund working capital. 

Rene is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts & bananas to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and bananas to sell

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en: Hadidja M. is 27 years old and is married with two children between the ages 2 and 5 years old.  Hadidja sells shoes in the market and she has five year's of experience.  Her business is well-organized. She employs two person to help her.  She starts from 6:30 am until 6:30 pm every day.  Hadidja has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With this profits, Hadidja will reinvest in her business, satisfy her customers and to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 11 años que tiene su tienda, instalada en su misma casa, negocio del cual se encarga casi las 24 horas del día, asimismo sus hijos la ayudan cuando tienen tiempo libre. Siempre esta pendiente de la cantidad de mercadería que este repleta para dar a su clientela la mayor variedad de productos. Sus ventas son continuas durante las mañanas, es por eso que para ella es vital tener la mercadería en el momento oportuno y aprovecha cada temporada del año cuando festividades vender más. Las rentas que recibe le permiten seguir adelante por lo que ha decidido ampliar más su tienda y comprar más mercadería y complementarla con frutas y útiles de escritorio. Es su crédito número 13 con MFP, es relativamente nueva en su banco comunal como integrantes y considera que ha sido una buena experiencia formar parte de  su grupo que le ha enseñado buenos aspectos en cuanto al cuidado de su finanzas es por esto que se compromete una vez más a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in a house that is their own. She started her store business 11 years ago and it is installed in her own home. She operates her business almost 24 hours a day. Her children help her during their spare time. She always makes sure to have plenty of inventory in order to offer her clients with the widest selection of products. Her sales are steady in the mornings and for this reason it is vital for her to have the merchandise on hand. She takes advantage during the time of year when the sales for the holidays are more. The profits she earns enables her to move forward so she has decided to expand her store and to purchase more merchandise, including fruits and office supplies. This is her 13th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is relatively new member of her communal bank and she feels that it has been a good experience to become part of a group. It has showed her different perspectives on managing finances. For this reason she is committed once again to be punctual with her payments. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to supply her store.

loans.use: to purchase products to supply her store.

loans.name: Diambar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Diambar fut créé le 15 Novembre  2006. Il compte  sept  femmes, toues issues du  même quartier. Leur  activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Nialing (debout à l’extrême gauche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle  est âgée de 50 ans.

Elle vend des légumes au marché. Elle pratique cette activité depuis deux ans.

Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre de renforcer son stock de marchandises.

Son objectif est de soutenir mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Diambar Group was established on November 15, 2006. It comprises seven women, all from the same neighborhood. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Nialing (on the far left in the photograph) is the group's leader. She's 50 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She's been selling vegetables at the market for two years.

She will use her new loan to bolster her product stock. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Dalis Marilyn

texts.es:
La señora Dalis es socia del banco comunal Las Gemas, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija.
Lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios para damas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 12 blusas, 12 pantalones, 6 carteras, 6 shores, 12 polos para damas.
Su esposo es electricista y para poder traer más dinero a casa decidió invertir su dinero en la compra de más mercadería, la mayor parte de la mercadería que trae es para repartir, ya tiene clientes fijos.
Ella misma se encarga del reparto de su mercadería y lo hace en compañía de su pequeña hija, porque no tiene con quien dejarla.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por seguir ayudando a las mujeres que tiene ganas de salir adelante.

En la foto se muestra junto a su hija.
texts.en: Dalis is a member of Las Gemas community bank in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali, Peru. She is 27 years old, married and has a daughter. She has been working with loans from Kiva partner Mauela Ramos for two years. Dalis makes a living selling women's clothing and accessories. With the loan of 1,200 soles, she plans to purchase 12 blouses, 12 pairs of pants, six handbags, six pairs of shorts and 12 women's polos. Her husband is an electrician and in order to bring in more money Dalis decided to invest her money in the purchase of more merchandise, the majority of which she brings in for deliveries, since she has regular customers. She delivers the goods herself, accompanied by her young daughter since she has no one to leave her with. Dalis is grateful to Manuela Ramos for continuing to help women who have a desire to succeed. She is with her daughter in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing.

loans.name: Oumran

texts.en:
Oumran is a 26-year-old single man from Qana. He owns a coffee shop located in a very special region in his village, in which competition has no place at all.

Oumaran's coffee shop belonged to his dad, and it was opened 10 years ago. He made the necessary changes to it, through decoration and changing most of the machines, equipment, chairs and tables.

He also added "Hooka" (bubble pipes) and a billiard table/pool game known by some, which helped a lot in attracting a new generation in addition to those who used to come when his dad was handling the business. 
 
Oumran is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to buy a refrigerator and a washing machine which are necessary for his business. He hopes to improve his business and open a bigger cafe with several new activities.

loans.use: To buy necessary refrigerator and washing machine for his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose has been rearing chickens for the last two years. She is a hardworking, single 30-year-old businesswoman. Rose is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering her financially. She hopes to have a well-established business in five years. Rose is asking for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy more chicks for rearing.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Angela Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos los mismos que  ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella  junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de producción y venta de helados. Trabajan todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 17h00, ella en las mañanas se encarga de fabricar los deliciosos helados de distintos sabores,  luego su esposo sale a vender en un carro  por la localidad y también se desplaza hasta los campos donde sus helados son muy apreciados y apetecidos, también en su casa vende sus helados. Además de esto por las tardes pone un pequeño local en el cual vende  meriendas, allí prepara platos al gusto de sus clientes que llegan en gran número a su pequeño local. Nos cuenta que llevan en este negocio  20 años y que a pesar de la competencia les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar azúcar, saborizantes y víveres para preparar las meriendas. Ella está en el Banco Comunal hace ya nueve años y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez que los reciben salen adelante y aumentan su producción.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres Organizadas' community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the sweet treats that the locals make.  They are well known throughout the country.

Here we meet 55 year-old Angela who is married and has four children who are all now adults.  Two of them still live in her home.  Her husband is a salesman.

Together with her husband, Angela owns a business making and selling iced treats.  They work every day, from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  In the mornings, Angela takes charge of making the delicious iced treats in different flavors, then her husband goes out to sell them in town.  He also travels to the countryside where their iced treats are very much appreciated and enjoyed.  They also make sales from their home.

In addition to this work, in the afternoons Angela sets up small premises where she sells afternoon meals.  She makes dishes to please her customers who arrive at her small premises in large numbers.  She tells us that she and her husband have been in this business for 20 years and, in spite of the competition, things are going very well.

Angela will use this loan to buy sugar, flavorings and food products for preparing her afternoon meals.  She has been a member of her community bank for nine years now and she likes it because every time she receives a loan she gets ahead and increases her production. 

Angela's dreams are to continue working and enjoying good health.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flavorings and food products

loans.name: Lilian Antonia

texts.es:
Lilian, administra una tienda y un molino de nixtamal, vive sola, este negocio lo instalo por iniciativa propia, para el sostenimiento de sus necesidades, sus clientes son vecinos y amigos del lugar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, surtiéndola de insumos para el hogar como aceite, pastas, arroz, azúcar, huevos, boquitas y pan, toda esta mercadería es muy necesaria ya que a diario es demandada por los clientes.
Su objetivo es mejorar los servicios a la clientes, con este préstamo espera mantener el negocio con todo lo necesario para poder vender, también en un futuro sueña con comprarse su propia casa.
texts.en:
Lilian runs a small store and a maize mill.  She lives alone.  She started this business on her own initiative in order to provide for her needs.  Her customers are neighbors and area friends.
Lilian is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise for her business.  She plans to stock up with household items like oil, pasta, rice, sugar, eggs, small sandwiches and bread.  She needs to have all of the previously mentioned merchandise on hand, as it is requested by her customers every day.
Lilian's objective is to improve the services she offers her customers.  With this loan, she hopes to keep her business well-stocked.  She also hopes, in the future, to buy her own home.

loans.use: to purchase oil, pasta, rice, sugar, eggs, little sandwiches and bread, for her business.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inicio gracias a la iniciativa de la Señora Aida de la Ciudad de Carapeguá. El grupo es denominado Medalla Milagrosa y actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo con 15 integrantes, ellas se definen como señoras muy activas, destacadas en el ámbito del trabajo.
Ellas se integraron para lograr mejorar sus emprendimientos, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad con el objetivo de generar sus propios ingresos y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias con una mejor calidad de vida.
La Señora Aida se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, por medio de este trabajo logra desenvolverse plenamente, ya que gracias a su sacrificio ha logrado mantener a su familia dándoles un mejor estilo de vida. En cuanto a la clientela posee mucha demanda por lo que le gustaría poder ampliar la variedad de prendas que tiene a la venta. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un local donde vender u ofrecer sus prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de estación para la posterior venta, lo cual la ayudará para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda
texts.en:
The formation of this committee was thanks to the initiative of Aida from the city of Carapeguá.  The group is called “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) and is currently in its first cycle with fifteen members.  They define themselves as very active ladies who stand out in their work environments.

They joined together to improve their enterprises.  Others, however, are starting their first activities in hopes of generating their own income and thus help their families attain better quality of life.

Aida sells all sorts of clothes.  She feels completely fulfilled in this work because thanks to the sacrifice she’s done she’s managed to support her family giving them a better standard of living.  As far as her clientele is concerned, she has quite a bit of demand so she’d like to expand the variety of goods she has to sell.  One of her dreams is to be able to have a locale that she can sell her wares at.

She is asking for the loan to buy seasonal clothing for subsequent resale which will help her meet customer demand.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the support it’s provided her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Aiza has a retail shop that sells spices like onions and garlic by the kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy spices to sell.

Aiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Aiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell.

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es:
Isolina tiene la edad de 57 años, cuenta con su propio negocio, una pulpería con más de cinco años trabajándola, es madre de cuatro hijos e independiente, su esposo es pensionado.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con liquidación de su hija, comenzando con poco y luego comenzo a crecer al introducir más mercadería de productos. Con préstamo en Afodenic.
Luego se retira y comienza a trabajar por cuenta propia, y es ahora que solicita de nuevo un préstamo, ya que la demanda es mucha, en donde quiere comprar productos de granos básicos, carne, queso, crema, papel higiénico, jabón de baño, kotex, golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, jugos, granos básicos entre otros productos de los cuales son más demandados por sus clientes.
Con esto espera aumentar las ventas, logrando tener mejores ganancias. Y así cumplir con sus gastos personales, como las medicina de su esposo.
texts.en:
Isolina is 57 and the mother of four children. She has owned and run her own business, a small grocery store, for over five years. She works independently; her husband is retired. She started the business with her daughter's severance pay. It started small but later took off with the addition of more merchandise, thanks to Afodenic loans.
Later on she retired and started working for herself. She is now requesting a new loan, as demand is high. She will purchase basic grains, meat, cheese, cream, toilet paper, bath soap, Kotex, sweets, pop, cookies, juice, and basic grains, among other items most requested by her customers.
With this action, she hopes to increase her sales, making a better income. This way she will cover her personal costs, such as her husband's medicine.

loans.use: to invest in products: in basic grains, sweets, meet, and dairy products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie, age 41, runs a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She lives with her husband and their three children in Dampil, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 
 
Julie  has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Julie  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Jeovanny Omar

texts.es: Jeovanny, utilizara el préstamo para comprar abono, herbicidas para las plagas, semilla, para que sus cosechas sean mejores y produzcan más y  mejores ganancias. Se decidio por un nuevo prestamo porque esta iniciando nuevamente el proceso de siembra, y el prestamo anterior le ayudo para realizar la siembra de la temporada,  este ha sido un gran apoyo para él, que le permite apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en: Jeovanny will use his loan to buy manure, herbicides to deal with pests, and seeds, so that his harvests improve, he produces more and makes better profits.  He decided to take out a new loan because he is beginning his sowing once again.  His previous loan helped him to carry out his previous season's sowing and it has been a great help to him, allowing him to support his children with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides and seed

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, es una persona bien conocida y trabajadora por su zona, es soltero y no tiene hijos, es un hermano ejemplar, su madre y el educan a sus 4 hermanos, el se dedica al cultivo de platano de freir en la localidad de mariposas, su mercado es netamente local y su competencia es muy creciente, actualmente sus ingresos le sirven para poder  sobrevivir, su madre es una persona mayor por lo cual no puede trabajar por lo consiguiente el es el único sustento de su familia, 
Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de Plantines de piña, para contar con una variedad de productos y así poder generar un mas ingresos y mejorar la vida que tiene el y su familia
texts.en:
Juan is well known in his community and his a very hard worker. He is single and does not have any children but he is an exemplary brother. He and his mother care for his 4 brothers. He grows plantains, his customer base is extremely local and his competition is growing. Juan's current incomes supports his family and allows them to survive, since his mother is older and unable to work. 

This is the first time Juan has requested a loan, which he will use to buy pineapple plants in order to diversify his products. In this way he hopes to increase his income so that he can improve his family's life.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seedlings.

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Raimunda;  La socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia se dedica a la compra al por mayor de golosinas y a la venta minorista de las mismas, ella vende en una carreta en la esquina de la av. principal de Andahuaylillas cerca al mercado central. La socia en esta ocasión desea el crédito para invertir en la construcción de su vivienda, ella también compra palos y los vende en trozos como leña en su casa, la socia en esta ocasión desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la construcción de su vivienda.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Raimunda is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trinufadoras” (The Winners) which is located in the District of Andahuaylillas, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 34 years old and in a common-law relationship. Raimunda buys candy in bulk and then sells at retail from a cart located on the corner of the main avenue of Andahuaylillas, which is near the central market. On this occasion, Raimunda wants a loan to invest in the construction of her home. She also wants to buy logs that she will sell individually as firewood for home use. Therefore she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials for her home.

Raimunda is grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Valerik

texts.ru:
Валерик  родился в 1968г. в  селе Ачанан (Achanan) Капанской области. Имеет среднее образование, специальность электромеханик.В данный момент работает оператором в Капанской кислородно- заправочной станции . Валерик женат и  имеет сына и дочь. Сыну 18 лет , учится в Капанском коледже на втором курсе юридического факультете , а дочке 21 которая  учится в магистратуре Ереванского Архитектурного университета . Жена  помогает Валерику по хозяйству.
Валерик почти 10 лет занимается  сельскохозяйственным бизнесом и имеет в деревне Ачанан  собственый земельный участок  где выращивает вместе с женой овощи и пшеницу. Кроме того у него есть крупно рогатый скот, пчелы(2 улья). Вместе с женой он реализует овощи из огорода на рынках Сюникской области а  мясо, молоко ,пшеницу и мед у него покупают постоянные скупщики прямо из дома .С дохода от сельскохозяйственого бизнеса Валерик платит за учебу детей и содержит семью. 
Валерику нужен кредит 800.000 армянских драмов, для покупки сена для скота и для покупки  нового сорта пшеницы для посевных работ.
texts.en: Valerik was born in 1968 in the Achanan village in the Kapan region.  He has a secondary education and is an electromechanics professional.  Currently, he works as an operator at the Kapan oxygen fueling station.  Valerik is married and has a son and a daughter.  His son is 18 years old and is a second-year law student at the Kapan college.  Valerik's daughter is 21 years old, and she attends a master program at the Yerevan Architecture University.  Valerik's wife helps him with the business.  He has been involved in an agricultural business in the Achanan village for almost ten years and has his own plot of land, where he and his wife grow vegetables and wheat.  Besides this, he owns cattle and bees (two beehives).  Together with his wife, Valerik sells vegetables from his land at the Syunik regional markets, and his loyal wholesalers buy meat, milk, wheat and honey right from his house.  Valerik uses his profits from the agricultural business to pay for his children's education and to support his family.  Valerik needs a loan in the sum of 800,000 Armenian dram to buy hay for his livestock and to buy a new variety of wheat for sowing.

loans.use: to purchase hay for livestock and to buy new wheat varieties for sowing

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is married and blessed with three children and two of them are in school. She has been running a retail shop for the last ten years to support her family. She also does farming to increase her income. Dorothy has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. She has employed two people to assist in the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale.

loans.name: Sarah Adwoa

texts.en: Sarah Adwoa is married to a palm wine tapper and has two children. She sells secondhand footwear. She has been in this business for the past three years. Sarah uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more secondhand footwear. With her new profit, Sarah wants to get a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: purchase more secondhand footwear.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is 51 years of age, married to Gina, and has three children. They live happily in the village of Luyao. They have plans to uplift their standard of living and to continue sending their children to school and give them a better future. 

Farming is one of Roy’s major sources of income. He plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been in this business for more than eight years and usually earns a profit of PHP 28,000 in every harvest season. 

At this time, Roy is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for the labor costs required for a rice plantation. He believes that this loan will be an enormous help for him to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for the labor costs required for a rice plantation.

loans.name: 119.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa lê is 27 years old, and she is married with one child, who has finished school. Hoa lê is the group leader of the 119.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

Hoa lê has a service business repairing electronics. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hoa lê faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical equipment and electronic devices to resell. 

In 2009, Hoa lê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With the profits from this loan, Hoa lê hopes to buy more supplies and equipment to help her business do well and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase electrical equipment and electronic devices to sell.
